reviews.content: A terribly written trash heap that made no sense, the storyline was disjointed to say the least. The effects were okay. But what good there was is overshadowed by poor acting and bad dialogue. Almost laughably bad.

Bruce Willis stopped telegraphing his acting for this film. He just didn't act at all. I mean, it looked like he was between high and mentally disabled. I worry about the dude. Then Frank Grillo, happenstance makes that I have seen three of his films this week, I was just saying how I wish he would get a break. Not for this film! Note that he is billed first, above Willis, and his role is at most 15 minutes from the film anyway.But what makes this film shine like a black hole is the story. It felt more than devoid of passion, like a spreadsheet that sucks one's soul away in the accounting department on a hot day after the air conditioning died. I mean, if a kid would have written it, it at least would have been fun. If someone was incompetent it would have felt like trying to send some kind of message, however badly. But no, it ... just made no sense, like someone hated writing for this film.Bottom line: it is so bad you can't even enjoy it wasted. It's a non-movie. It's like what's on the other side of the event horizon of TV static.

First,I adore sci-fi. And am willing to overlook A LOT. But this piece of.... What the heck where they thinking. The writing and scenes/environment are so sooo bad its just too distracting. I still (skipped after a point) to the end but this is one of the worst sci-fi movies I have EVER seen.
This is supposed to be happening in 2500s . And sci-fi is usually written by guys/gals who like the genre right? So you'd assume they're not dumb, this is genre for tech/gadget/future visions loving people/thinkers.
First of all, its all happening in a city like today. Petrol cars, grunge plaid shirts wearing, beer drinking dudes everywhere and every single piece of the environment they are in is from like 2005. NOTHING is advanced anywhere except a CGI spaceship here and there. Everyone still uses regular guns with bullets propelled by gun powder and use petrol. They still use incandecent lightbulbs. Even we in Europe dont use them anymore, they dont even sell them anymore by law. TODAY.Or landing with a spaceship on a foreign planet and then they pitch up A TENT. A TENT!!! In 2500s and not a fancy,sci-fi redesigned/decorated for the movie to look special, hi-tech tent. Nah-ha. An obviously locally bought, regular, simple tent with old regular folding chairs and tables. They didnt even try to make anything look advanced.Also everything from clothing,storage boxes, various military tools, every piece of housing is from 2000s. You might think (for a milisecond), how about Firefly, combo of Wild West and space. Not even close,that beautiful show was an intelligent combination,smartly done,with foundations explaining everything. Insulting to even be considered in regards to this disaster.The story. Lets not even get there. The (IMO) very interesting plot summary that draws your interest to watch it is 100% misleading.
Its so boring and slow it stops drawing your interest after 15 minutes. In then end its just confusing and silly. Never mind again, that so so many things just dont make sense or are ignored.
I do not know how such a thing can get approved. It is so bad. And Bruce. What the heck. De Niro at least sold his soul for comedies that work in 50%. But Bruce lately... this movie isnt worth the few cents of material that the medium it is recorded on. Dont watch.

reviews.review_title: I think they spent all the budget on Bruce Willis and had nothing left for writing, props, actors and more.
reviews.content: I noticed that "Cosmic Sin" recently made it to IMDB's infamous Bottom 100 list and has a pitiful score of only 2.5! So, not only is it on the list...but it is way up the list at #39!When I first started watching this sci-fi film, I could IMMEDIATELY see why the film is so hated. It's a film set in the 26th century and at this time, there is space travel and life on many planets and moons. So, why do you see folks driving pickup trucks that look like they are from 2021? Why are the clothes pretty much what you'd see today and why are most of the weapons not much more effective or different than today's?! It honestly looks like they must have spend all their budget on securing Bruce Willis' talents and had nothing left to make it look like a futuristic story. Now I don't think you need expensive props to make a good film...but this is ridiculous and really takes you out of the story.The story begins with some form of life being discovered on some new planet. It seems that up until this time, humans have never made first contact with any intelligent species...even with humans inhabiting many new worlds. As you'd expect, this new form of sentient life is not sweet and friendly....as who would want to see a film like that?! And, it turns out that it is so deadly that in the entire galaxy (numbering many, many, many billions) the only guy that can stop the creatures is a war criminal, James Ford (Willis)!I have seen much worse films that never made it to the IMDB list...mostly because they are older, cheaper and more obscure. In other words, the Bottom 100 is very heavily skewed to new films...so although the film is bad, it's not the 39th worst film ever made! I think it's just that a lot of folks get Netflix and had a chance to see it...whereas far less folks have seen the films of Ed Wood, Al Adamson, Ray Dennis Steckler and William Grefe...all filmmakers who REALLY knew how to make terrible films...REALLY terrible films!So is there anything good about this movie? Some of the CGI space scenes are very nice and would probably look great on the big screen (though I assume this film, when it came out, only went straight to Netflix and Amazon Prime). Otherwise, the story is not especially interesting, the dialog often pretty bad and the acting not especially good. It is not completely awful...just mostly awful. And, unfortunately not so bad that it's fun to watch in order to make fun of the film.By the way, nearly all the reviews for this are extremely negative. With this and a score of 2.5, I am amazed to find some folks giving it 10s! A few admit that it's bad but are just trolling or love it because it's so bad. A few, however, are VERY short reviews that talk about how brilliant it is...a sure sign normally of fake reviews done by folks connected with the film...which is pretty shameful.

Some 500 years in the future, mankind has spread into the cosmos. On a faraway planet, humans have encountered First Contact. An alien presence infects people and turns them into marauding zombies. James Ford (Bruce Willis) is a disgraced military leader arguing for the doomsday Q-bomb. Engineer Fiona Ardene (Adelaide Kane) is called in to prep the device. General Ryle (Frank Grillo) leads the soldiers while Dr. Lea Goss (Perrey Reeves) is awed by the aliens.First thing first, this movie opens with an info-dump in text form. It's a lot of gobbledygook. Someone should try to read it again. Then there is the awkward mix of present-day technology with the future tech. There is no logical reason for it. It's an obviously sign of bad budgeting and unimaginative set design. When that happens, they are better off putting the movie in a smaller space and as much future tech onto the screen. At least, put some effort in giving the characters some future-cars. Its greater sin is that it's boring. I think I must have spaced out. One moment, they're fighting zombies in the warehouse and the next, they're space-diving to another planet. It's a forgettable muddle.

Granted, I have to admit that I was lured in to watching the 2021 movie "Cosmic Sin" given the movie's cover/poster and the fact that the movie was starring Bruce Willis, Frank Grillo and Costas Mandylor.And let me just come right out and say that writers Edward Drake and Corey Large failed to deliver a wholesome movie here with "Cosmic Sin". While I managed to sit through the entire ordeal, then I must say that all throughout the course of the entire movie I was sitting with an overwhelming sense of pointlessness. I just couldn't find anything worthwhile in the storyline, and everything seemed just bland and without a cause.It was so difficult to indulge myself into the storyline because it was so linear and anything but interesting and exciting. So the end result that is "Cosmic Sin" from director Edward Drake was just a very forgettable and rather mundane movie. The storyline was just so amazingly generic and linear that you could have left the movie for a longer period of time, and returned only to be right up to speed with the storyline.Now, I am sure that die-hard fans - pardon the pun - of Bruce Willis or Frank Grillo might actually find some kind of odd enjoyment here in the movie. I, however, didn't. So this movie was a swing and a miss.I must admit that it felt that Bruce Willis wasn't really committed to this movie project, and his performance felt half-hearted, as if he was running on auto-pilot. And Frank Grillo just wasn't given enough on-screen time to manage to do much of anything to salvage the movie.The characters in the movie were every bit as bland and pointless as the storyline. So you don't really connect with any of them, nor do you form any kind of attachments to any of them. So whether they live or die, it hardly matters.Now, what did work for "Cosmic Sin" was the visuals. They had some nice enough suits for the soldiers of the Alliance. And the weapon effects were quite good. The aliens, however, they just felt like something out of a B movie. So that was disappointing to say the least.All in all, "Cosmic Sin" was exactly what the movie title says; a cosmic sin. This movie came and went without leaving much of any blast mark or memorable impression. My rating of "Cosmic Sin" lands on a mere three out of ten stars.

U know that when one movie comes out before it is scheduled for release, it means it's pretty bad.The rest of the reviews pretty much echo my sentiment but one scene in particular made me laugh out loud. Around 44:48 the group in the forest get confronted by another group and one of the members says "what's going on, wtf is happening" and then girl from the other group asks him to say something so he can prove he is human cuz alien don't talk or so. But he just talked to her saying what the F is going. hahahaAnyway the movie is riddled with stuff like this. Couldn't finish it it was too atrocious.The only thing that wasn't bad was the camera's quality and the fx. The rest is totally Elephant dung.

reviews.review_title: Low ratings are in this case completely justified.
reviews.content: Bruce Willis is becoming the new Nicholas Cage. It looks like he's just accepting any role without reading the script, something Nicholas Cage seems to do as well. Not that I think Bruce Willis is a great actor, he just played in some good movies, but he's not a great actor, and lately he's been actually really bad. It's going downhill for Bruce Willis. Cosmic Sin is just bad, with a story that is badly written, special effects that looked from another century, and actors that don't seem to know what they're doing. I wish I could unwatch this piece of garbage.

After the scene with the decontamination I had to stop, just the idea of bringing back some people that had contact with an unknown alien civilization and decontaminate them in a shower is so ridiculous that i can't have any more expectations for the rest. Even for covid contact you get more decontamination and protection than what the wrote for this movie.

Bruce Willis stopped caring ages ago, he's here to collect a cheque while doing the least amount of work possible. He's acting like he doesn't care, and it shows, from his very first scene he looks bored and that never changes. The problem with Bruce's approach of not caring is this; if he doesn't care, why should we?Frank Grillo's always going to be a B-grade actor because he takes what he gets. I can imagine he turns down proper dumpster fire scripts on occasion, but for the most part I'd say he's in it for the cash. Although, he's hardly in this film.With those two being the main characters, I immediately knew it wasn't going to be a good movie. The story line is boring & nonsensical, the actors are bad to middling at best. The writer can't even properly weave exposition into natural conversations or set pieces. Here's an example:The scene opens with 'Guy 1' walking by someone smoking.Guy 1: No smoking behind the wire, specialist!Guy2: Yes, sir.Guy 1: I don't give a damn if your uncle is our boss or not.LMAO! The writer couldn't even be bothered to come up with a decent way to let us know this character (in my example 'Guy 2') was the nephew of their boss. Who wrote this dialogue?! This happens numerous times, why is it so bad?! Worst of all, Guy 2 later confronts his uncle to ask if he can join the war, he even goes on to say, "you would send them off to war, but you wouldn't send your own family?" lol why the heck didn't you leave it there? There was no need for the initial exposition if you were going to drop it in a scene later. OMG!Okay, there are plenty of instances of that happening, so I won't harp on it. Let's get back to Bruce. So, at the (roughly) 25-minute mark there's a scene between the main-ish characters - Willis, Grillo and a third person are all there. Each one is playing a high ranking official, but Bruce Willis is clearly not in that scene, he doesn't look like he's responding to them, he nods in their general direction as if he's in the room with them, but you can clearly see he's not there with them, they do no wide-angle shots... until they do! And when they do, it's a stand-in for Bruce LMAO it's clearly not him. It's so obvious! Their heads look very different! This happens several times throughout the movie, imagine paying an actor to act and they just go, "Nope! But he looks like me, so...." LMAO!Ladies & gents I could go on for a day and a half but let me stop here and say this... This movie sucks! any chance it had at being a movie (not even a good one, just 'a movie') was killed when Bruce Willis was brought on. I recommend you avoid. Don't waste your time. End of story.
... Bruce Willis is jealous of Nicholas Cage career.

We have here a confusing space war movie taking place in 2524, where aliens attack a remote mining outpost part of Alliance protection. A rescue crew containing a retired soldier deemed too violent for war, James Ford (Bruce Willis), leaves Earth before determining if the aliens are even hostile. This rescue unit is led by General Ryle (Frank Grillo), hauling a weapon known as the Q-Bomb.Battle scenes look as if they belong in a video game. Dialogue seems rushed and phony. Visual effects are crowded and clumsy. I think Willis' paycheck may have been too much to afford putting more into this project. Also in the cast: C. J. Perry, Brandon Thomas Lee, Adelaide Kane, Lochlyn Munro and Sara May Sommers.

Really wanted to like this as I love scifi movies especially anything involving aliens, I'm thinking, supposed to be 500 years into the future but the fellas still driving a 4x4, i got to the bar scene, and I thought, this looks like roadhouse, (albeit no where near as good) warning signs of a crappy film start to kick in. 90 percent of the movie was just people talking random s#*t, practically no action whatsoever, and by the time we were down to the last 20 muinites I gave up! Dont know what Bruce Willis has been thinking last couple of movies he's been in, All I'm looking for is a movie that'll rival Independence Day form 1996, it's been nearly 25 years and still nothing! Avoid this if you value your time on this earth, absolute garbage.

I get the concept but the overall end result is a confusing mess, and the enemies well I guess the power ranges villains needed some work. The first act okay not great but works, act two is confusing as to where they go after the discovery, why is there an epic battle going on in orbit, did I miss something because just a few scenes before hand people were talking about first contact, and having those weird people coming back from the event, but why then do we go to this planet where a space battle is taking place... I hadn't heard anywhere that a full on conflict had erupted on this planet, and didn't really get whether this was the planet from where we first encounter the aliens... act 3 doesn't really exist, what was the whole thing with Bruce Willis on the space ship, somehow hanging on while taking off leaving the planets orbit... and then the chat in space on top the ship... I'm leaving the film so confused haha. If your looking for a fun bad film that you get to laugh at how bad the film is check this out, it will leave you scratching you head to work out the missing plot points and the questionable dialog, you can almost feel and tell where the film should have gone, definitely one to watch after a good smoke 🌳
This was total trash. Don't waste your time. It's not even bad enough to make you laugh. The people who participated in this farce should be jailed for wasting peoples time.

1 out of 5 stars.Cosmic Sin is a horrible science fiction action film. The cast ensemble performances are horrible and phoned in. Looking for an easy paycheck. The visual effects are terrible. The action is boring. The story is terrible. The script and direction is terribly put together.

reviews.review_title: Mystery of this film is Why Was It Made?
reviews.content:
500 years of progress and this is what we have to show for it?It really feels like nobody wanted to make this movie but someone made them do it. Nobody had anything to say. Anything to add. Nothing we haven't seen a million times before. Screenplay has nothing whatsoever to say or convey and is full of clichés, just like it would be if you never wanted to write it in the first place, but had to. For a grade, or something.Clearly, there was no excess money to burn - almost entire scenography is some kind of paintball course. And some forest. And all the crops are close-ups of people doing stuff, mostly shooting off into something offscreen, presumably into the distance.The movie is set in the 26th century, with the space and time bending human species spanning three planets (only indication of this is an introductory text) and the weirdest thing we can see in the galaxy is a girl with semi-yellow hair? Everything else, technology, weapons, fashion, everything looks exactly as today. Alright, excepting a few seconds long filler scenes of spaceships.I'm writing this because one question baffles me without cease. It's - Why did you have to make this? What was the motivation behind this work? I don't see you making any money, however inadequate the investment was. What's the point?
I'd really like to know.If this is some kind of student project movie, then its kinda cool. If you go to school with the guys who made this then you should really have a go at it. Otherwise...

reviews.review_title: I think less of myself for having watched this.
reviews.content: The Blood General? That is totally made up by a twelve year old boy.What an idiot firing so many rounds into darkness.2500 something and people are still driving the same cars?!There were two people on the whole planet abs now you have several more than that survivors?! Is counting a lost skill in 2500 something?!They weren't tipped off my their face and eyes?!2500 something has no laser or pulse guns?They may be in hibernation.Aliens with hoods is an easy way to cut costs, and disappoint the audience.What the hell was that scene?! It made no science?! Bruce walks into a cage having hallucinations and surrounded by aliens, then the specialist appears and they walk through the woods?! F-n terrible.This is another example of what 1.25 speed was made for... maybe 1.5 speed.That general sidekick side conversation was pointless... as was his conversation with the little girl. Trying to inject some humanity in a dump truck of garbage.They ran out of "armor" so they told a guy on set with a flannel shirt to grab a toy gun.This can't end quick enough.All the kids shots hit the armor... why is he dead?This was a complete waste of money.Grillo got the best deal out of this, he had the least screen time.There is not even a single good line in this film.What kind of armor leaves the midsection wide open?Why is there a flashing open sign inside!!!

reviews.review_title: Worse than you can possibly imagine
reviews.content:
Can anyone remember when you could give more than 3 out of 10 to a Bruce Willis movie.
This movie is just as bad as his last several films but with a budget less than fan fiction YouTube film. It's really that bad, I'm guessing 99% of the budget went on paying its 2 main stars.

reviews.review_title: Very cheaply made and made little sense
reviews.content: The story happens in 500 years later future, but people wear exactly the same clothes as now and same buildings, same cars. The robot bartender can't even pour a drink without spilling.The alien enemies are supposed to be way more advanced than us humans, but they fight us with axes and swords, we hit them from a distance with guns.If a human is possessed by an alien, then they won't be able to speak human language. Yet one alien had a 10 mins monologue while in the female scientist's body.The film is just over an hour, rather short for an action-sci-fi. But they still managed to have so many pointless filler scenes, like the chitchat scene with the little girl about sunglasses.
Cosmic Sin is goofy, with thriller dance, tower defense, nonsense. Bad characters, intangible silly plot, yawn end please.

If you're a scifi fan like me you probably read the premise and be quite interested. Bruce Willis wasn't anything positive or negative for me but I thought it would be a sign of a high quality movie.
Well... I watched the first 30 Minutes of this and... it's bad. Like really bad.
It's not like this one thing in it is bad like for example the plot is a bit weak. But when you're at the point where even I critique the cinematography and color grading you have to be at a very low point to the degree of college-first-indie-movie-attempts-bad.
This is usually stuff I can overlook quite easily because I don't notice.This film basically has everything bad a film can have. From every category. Take your pick what you think is the worst.

reviews.review_title: This garbage really is a cosmic sin
reviews.content: Its so excruciatingly bad. Its the most generic cliched garbage you can imagine. Bad acting, bad story, bad casting, bad cgi, bad filming, bad editing... all of it is bad.Its honestly worth watching the first 30 minutes just to get a sense of how bad a movie can really get.

reviews.review_title: Can't justify anyone seeing this movie.
reviews.content: Bruce Willis does this sometimes, it's one of those cheap flicks in which they spend a lot of money to have Mr. Willis spend 10,mins in the movie so they can put him on the poster and say Bruce Willis is in the movie, so that...Die Hard fans like myself will check it out.I'm hip to the con and sometimes it leads to a good movie. In this case I at least thought I would get Frank Grillo as the actual star of the movie but as it turns out he's also phoning this one with Willis. Guest he can do that after making that money In the Marvel Cinematic Universe flicks.The movie has a complex plot about survival of the fittest on an interstellar level, which was pretty much wrapped up in the trailer of the film and never really goes any further.I would love to tell you how action packed this film is but that falls short as well. It feels set up to be fluffed with action but its all lame .The only thing I truly got a kick out of was the cheap Sci-fi. You could tell they were trying to turn 20 bucks into 200 million, but sometimes those failures can give a movie charm. They had some visual effects scenes that were filmed perfectly and some of the costumes were so stylish i could not keep my eyes off of them (Making it easier to see all their flaws)If you want a really good Bruce Willis is just on the poster movie checkout Extraction, it's perfect. I would leave this one alone.

reviews.review_title: This sci-fi has the budget of my last KFC run.
reviews.content: This sci-fi has the budget of my last KFC run. But hey, you can tell it is set 500 years in the future because it has neon lights. Bruce Willis and Frank "How the Hell Did I get Famous" Grillo are tantamount to cardboard cutouts in this cheap nothing-burger. I have already forgotten the plot... and I watched it ten minutes ago.

What an epic disappointment this turned out to be. Dire acting, unconnected plot. As mentioned there is a large percentage of nothing happening in this movie. The aliens were nothing of note. Special effects were lacking. I thought Bruce Willis was going to save the movie but he gave up in the first bar scene. Mankind did not deserve to win in tjis one. Come on writers, stop using the angry young soldier stamping his feet routine as it made me want to stop watching more than the slow pace.

reviews.review_title: It is beyond me, how something like this gets released. Awful.
reviews.content: It is seldom that one comes across a movie with so little to give. There are dozens of shoot'em up games out there with better storylines more engaging dialogue, better graphics and acting. Bruce Willis probably has better commercials out there. Stay away. Keep away. Not worth it even in fast forward.

This film is just a mess. I hope that the intention behind this was to make some easy cash.
Otherwise, I just can't explain why would anyone get involved in this.There are outlines of a story, but not like an actual screenplay. The time setting makes no sense, the WORLD BUILDING that is done through on-screen text doesn't seem to mean anything. The science is messed up beyond even the lowest fiction standards of science fiction. I think I had a general understanding of what was supposed to be going on, but I'm not sure.At times it felt almost like a bad parody, and I hope they were just trolling the viewers with just how much they can get away with.It looks like a fan film shot on a good camera with good actors but nobody cared one bit.I can't really bash on the actors, everyone needs some cash, there were a couple of recognizable faces like Frank Grillo (who isn't a pro actor, but he's always likable), Lochlyn Munro, even Costas Mandylor from the Saw series...this is just...bizarre.Willis delivered his basic nearly-coma performance which he does in most of his fast paycheck-oriented films now, and he made sure that the contract mentioned him in the script as an ultimate badass. His appearance was obviously agreed on only to have his face mentioned in the promotion materials.I usually endorse low-budget sci-fi when I see a spark of an idea or actual care put into one. This is an absolute waste of time, I strongly recommend everyone to skip this.

reviews.review_title: Does this writer/director team have something on Bruce or is it all some kind of tax write off thing?
reviews.content: Breach was really bad, this is no better and we've got two more pairings of this dynamic team to look forward to later this year I see.To be fair some of the effects in this are good and you can see the actors trying their best. But already wearing restrictive paintballing gear and having to pretend that their badly fitting space 'helmets' actually fit something in the 'suit up' sequence really is the height of comedy.All the ingredients are here to make a half way decent film but somehow nobody quite managed it. Again.

reviews.review_title: Were this a no budget film released on YouTube by some students for free I'd recommend it, but as a product by a professional studio with Bruce Willis in the lead it's trash.
reviews.content: In the year 2524 an Earth colony has first contact with a hostile alien race. General Ryle (Frank Grillo) enlists disgraced "Blood General" James Ford (Bruce Willis) who was infamous for his use of a Q-Bomb that killed 70 Million people. Ryle enlists Ford to lead an off the books team to eliminate the alien threat before they're aloud to spread through the galaxy.Reteaming with Edward Drake and Corey Large of fellow DtV Willis sci-fi film Breach, Cosmic Sin looks and feels like it's from the same filmmakers to the point they almost feel like entries in their own "universe". Instead of aping Alien or The Thing like Breach, Cosmic Sin is more in line with sci-fi action like Aliens or Edge of Tomorrow. In a way I suppose Cosmic Sin is a marginal improvement on Breach, but in other ways with a larger scale story and a similar production budget, it feels noticeably cheaper than Breach as well.Much like Breach the movie doesn't feel like it takes place in the future. At least with Breach once they were on the ship they at least had proper uniforms that fit with the situation, but in Cosmic Sin everything feels like it's straight from today save for some CGI establishing shots of spaceships and some "armor"(we'll get to that). It's clear the movie's reach far exceeds it's grasp with the "high tech military facility" using the same tricks as breach to make it look futuristic with harsh multicolored lighting and poorly integrated hologram effects. But the filmmakers luckily decided to give us some locational variety with their shoot....the woods! All of the colony scenes (save for one scene with a tent) take place in the woods and have the same feeling of rushed and economic one would expect to see in a LARP straight out of Role Models. The armor the characters wear in the second half of the movie makes no sense as the script says it's approved for "quantum combat"(whatever that's supposed to be) and with open faced helmets and massive bare patches there's no thought or care as to how these cheap bulky monstrosities function in combat or space.Outside of the bare bones production values, the movie's script is a hodgepodge of pretty much every other sci-fi film/video game you've seen(and a few you haven't) with the likes of the 2009 Star Trek, Stargate, Edge of Tomorrow, Screamers, Gears of War, Aliens, and even Ghosts of Mars. The movie's script also tries to address "ethical issues" in quite possibly the most ill fitting approach since 2005's Stealth tried to analyze the moral issues of unmanned drone warfare. Willis' "Blood General" James Ford is so named because he quelled an separatist rebellion by dropping a Q-bomb killing 70 million people. The movie is strangely uncritical about this character with many of the supporting cast spouting things about how Ford got a "Raw Deal", "It's harder to give orders than follow them", "you need monsters to beat monsters", and it's the kind of mindset that many villains use for justification in many films of this ilk that makes the film feel fundamentally confused. Not that the story will draw most people in as it's poorly delivered with bad camera work, poorly staged sequences, and sleepy performances from uninterested actors with Bruce Willis' voice never even breaking an octave.Cosmic Sin continues Bruce Willis' disappointing DtV streak with an embarrassing cheap sci-fi rehash that is put to shame by amateurly made fan productions. With a sloppy production, cut and paste script, and uninterested performances that leave the movie inert and dull the movie will give you the odd laugh or smirk from point out its stolen ideas and concepts, but aside from that it's yet another cheap dud from a once respectable actor.

I was hoping this movie could deliver an interesting story. The low budget is obvious from the trailer, and the cheesy dialog and bad acting can be seen miles away. But low budget, poorly directed movies can have entertaining and compelling stories, and I like to find those.This is not it. If you think there is any redeemable quality for this movie, because Bruce Willis must have seen something to be in it, you'd be wrong. I don't know why he agreed to be in this film, but the script was not.The movie is full of cliches, but the worst part is that it doesn't make any sense. All is supposed to happen in less than 24 hours, yet the movie has characters and events that seem to have happened for decades. The mismatch of technological advances is ludicrous, with rifles with ammo alongside lasers, and gas vehicles with wormhole jumps.Absurd beyond believe, there is a pocket sized weapon capable of destroying an entire solar system. Unstable, it can't be rattled and can be activated if dropped. The encasing of this technological marvel of 500 years into the future? A glass cylinder. Not even a cardboard box with padding like an iPhone.The inconsistencies are so profound and frequent, that I truly started to worry about my own understanding. Am I having a stroke? How can this have passed through a team of people and nobody said anything?But it is not me. This movie is really that bad. Like a word salad of low budget sci fy scenes cobbled up together by a defective algorithm.Don't waste your time.
I was waiting for somebody to make a cut and tell that this is just a joke.

reviews.review_title: A lot of people say this movie is bad.. Let me tell you why..
reviews.content: Before I start with the review, Let me tell you how I and my brother approached this movie, Critics said this movie is bad, Everybody said this movie is bad, As am I writing this review rn is has a rating of 2.5 outta 10 (yikes).. So basically everyone said this movie is bad and WE KNEW THAT.Me and my brother love watching bad movies, Sometimes when a movie fails at every aspect of being a decent product It can be super entertaining, Movies like The Room, Troll 2, I will even go as far to say that Suicide Squad is one of my favorite movies because of how hilariously awful it is.. Unfortunately this movie wasn't...Cosmic Bin is one of most boring bad movies I have EVER SEEN!The story is the most generic sci fi fantasy gebber gabber, Bruce Wills is a retired space soldier (or something like that) and the space military station want his stuntdoub~ I mean him, To do one last mission..The action scenes are too boring and so far in between with unnecessary slow-motion with sound effects we have heard a thousand times before..Characters so generic you won't even remember their names after the credits roll, Bruce Wills's character (James Ford, Such a creative name lol) kills one of soldier friends FOR NO APPARENT REASON.. and that's the character that we should love and sympathize with.. Oh yeah and Frank Grillo, The first guy in the credits, He barely appear in the movie (WOW, Such a great passion for movie making)Don't watch this movie, It's super boring, Full of filler and pointless scenes, Bad acting / custom design, Uninspired music and It's not even funny, Avoid this movie at all costs..
I have no words to describe how truly awful this movie is. Best part of the movie is the backing music to the credits.

reviews.review_title: Bruce takes another B trash dive
reviews.content: Honestly, if you are a huge sci-fi/horror/thriller aficionado, you cannot forget genius classics like Twelve Monkeys or The 5th Element.....not gonna happen. So what happened to Bruce Willis' movie choices? Is he in a secret competition with Nicholas Cage to star in the most B movie bombs, or is he simply bored with too much idle time? The first three sentences of this script starts off with F bombs, as if this adds to its appeal (appealing to junior high kids going through puberty, perhaps). Then we hear an atmospheric breach signal from the computer (everybody hears it, by the way), but the highly-skilled astronaut/soldier does not, and berates his companion who warns him of a pending threat. He steps out of the tent and fires randomly in every direction to prove no threat exists? Who wastes ammunition in every random direction when silence to hear an approaching threat may be useful? Not a trained soldier or security expert, that's who. Then the infected Alliance personnel are brought to the base with no extreme biohazard precautions in place? Then when the infected personnel lash out like zombies, killing a top commander, the other soldiers bearing weapons just stand there and watch him be killed? Please Bruce, as a fan since the 80's, please just stop with these nonsensical scripts; they are pure garbage. As dedicated fans of this genre we will gladly patronize a Venmo account or charity on your behalf to stop you from this madness. We love you, but these B movie disasters are not fitting of your career.
I didnt belive for the people who sayd this is the worst movie in the year or era. But now i belive. This is. Dont waste your time. Its realy realy that bad.

reviews.review_title: "Either way this works out, it's gonna be on the wrong side of history."
reviews.content: Ah yes, a movie that's finally described by it's own title. This film doesn't require a long review because it's just too disjointed for a coherent story line, what with all those scenes that look like they might be dream sequences or flashbacks to another time and place. They just don't seem to connect to what's going on in the main picture. Sad to say, I was looking for Bruce Willis to break out of his recent string of dismal flicks to really make an impact in this one, but he just looked way tired of the whole thing as Blood General James Ford, the banished soldier who dropped a Q-bomb on planet Zafdie to wipe out seventy million people. All for a good cause of course, because they were on the way to secede from the Alliance with Earth and Ellora. Ford has the film's most prescient bit of dialog, which I've put in my summary line for you. Along with the title, it pretty much says everything you need to know about this sci-fi travesty.
Yikes, this film is a series of bad clichés one after the other, the visual effects are poorly done, the plot is confusing and not interesting, I managed to watch it to the end but barely.

reviews.review_title: A Faint Potential For A Engaging Sci Fi Movie Falls To Poor Writing and Execution
reviews.content: In Cosmic Sin the 26th Century still using way outdated hand weapons (eventually even a grenade) and pick-up trucks and honking vehicles on a street and parked motorcycles and even cigarettes indistinguishable from the 1960s. The Nostromo from the Alien (1979) had a way much better med unit. Early scenes after the good and bad introductory mystery have of course the requisite robotic servers and hologram (country?) singers and a barfight with a slight difference with again the old-fashioned side arms and the Calvary with an attempt at twinge of an alternative outcome that really is not.There are major storyline problems with the quarantine procedures even simple glass windows and even a typical "gun" fight, yet there was an initial attempt at fascinating underlying dynamic taking place however with the first contact encounter scenes and subsequent reflective commentary. Then somehow a brief firefight does not flow well, problems with editing arise, a scene very underdeveloped, and supposedly a well-manned defensive team becomes at risk of being actually overrun. Instead of a quickening climatic pace, the energy seems to dissipate and slow down along with almost no high-tech, futuristic surveillance networks to warn of impending attacks becomes more combat scenes from a mediocre World War II movie with elements from Stargate (1994) and worse yet the climatic battle is something that would be more like out of a World War I engagement and lame hand to hand sequences and a limp effort a riveting emotional end. The screenwriters were definitely not up the job and no actor could improve on a thin script that had the promise but not the actual substance to translate into a credible movie. This movie even reverted to absolutely unnecessary cowboy, western era musical harmonics while Bruce Willis strangely just seems to fade almost completely away by the end of the movie.The major problem with Cosmic Sin lies with the screenwriters trying too hard to be cute and offer up something substance, different, and try to incorporate too many fancy relational and philosophical ideas. They failed in their execution and omitted too many important backstories to offer audiences a sense of plot flow. Instead the audience is sort of just dropped into this movie without the understanding of what the real motives of what is going on. The audience is forced to play catch up. The writers fall into their own traps with the only way out of empty ideas is to create overly convenient ways to extricate themselves out of various corners (i.e., where a general loses face for backing down on his own orders, the awkward political dynamics of the military decisions being made, past undisclosed relationships).Maybe the only nice surprise of this movie is the character and what some people might call a cameo performance of Lochlyn Munro. He appears to have finally broken out of his typecast of either simple bad guy or side character in a slew of romantic comedies. Munro had a decent performance here.

reviews.review_title: I am a huge scifi and Bruce Willis fan. BUT...this scifi movie looks ridiculous and Bruce Willis is only present due to contractual obligations...
reviews.content: I AM (was) A BRUCE WILLIS FAN.BUT....this movie is a stinker, a fraud. It is simply NOT anything near a scifi movie. It is just another contractual obligation for Bruce Willis, so he can pay his bills for 15 minutes of acting...The only one that is gonna be happy is the producer of this movie, because he knows that many, MANY people will watch it, based on the sole appearance of Bruce Willis. Too bad, this movie s8(!ks...The "story": .....Pfff... a 9 metacritics score, that is a new record low (before it was 12).In my quest to see ALL Bruce Willis movies I also watched this one. Let's not forget that some of the movies Bruce Willis is making nowadays is only because of contractual obligations. That's the reason why he is churning out 5 till 10 movies a year upon year. That's a lot. Of course you cant be picky when you are starring in 10 movies a year. He often only stars in each movie for no more than 15 minutes or so. Producers happy, because they sell tickets with Bruce his name on the bill. Bruce Willis happy because he got his paycheck and can pay alimony to his ex-wives. But the audience watching it, might not be so happy, because they are expecting DIE HARD quality filmmaking. And to put it politely, some of these newest Bruce Willis movies are "a bit" inferior to DIE HARD.At an (excrucially) important sidenote, let us not forget WHY we are watching Bruce Willis movies to begin with. We watch Bruce Willis movies because of DIE HARD (1988). THE ONE AND ONLY BIGGEST ACTION AMERICAN ACTION CLASSIC OF THE CENTURY.This classic is still standing strong after more than 30 years. Millions of people still REwatch it during every Christmas holiday. Recently a petition was launched to rename Nakatomi Plaza into DIE HARD plaza.A life time achievement award for Bruce Willis is in the making.DIE HARD (1988) NEVER DIES but is still ALIVE AND KICKING IN 2022. Why not simply REwatch the brilliant DIE HARD (1988) again and start the new year with a bang! Happy New Year!

I see Bruce Willis and I generally think 'action flick, but might be good'... Ohhhh how wrong was I. The only thing good about this movie is the 'idea' behind it. Everything else is just so, so bad! The acting, the dialog, the "action", the plastic/paper weapons, the reaction of characters, the story building its all just so bad. I registered my account on IMBD just to write this review, that is how bad this movie was.Please do not waste your life. You might have dreams, do not let this thing crush them! Go and live, spend time with your family have some fun, but for the love of everything that is good DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE!

reviews.review_title: One of those 'Bruce Willis just can't say no' movies
reviews.content: I read that Bruce Willis only took a day of filming for this and the rest of it was stunt doubles, that doesn't bode well. He barely put a full sentence in. It had a cast capable of making something at least decent; Bruce Willis, Frank Grillo, Lochlyn Munro are some of the more known actors that you might have seen before but are usually hit or miss actors and this was a miss. The main problem was the writing though, the script was horrible and unimaginative. The plot and premise were unoriginal but okay, with a good enough script this would have been tolerable, maybe good if you wanna stretch. It's paced all wrong too, with some scenes and pauses going on too long for dramatic effect but it just made me wanna fast forward. The CGI was all bright and neon, quintessential of low budgets sci-fi movies and series to make them seem more futuristic. Also, the whole mysterious alien wormhole gate and a rogue team heading to stop it feels like a farce take on The Expanse. I'm surprised I watched the whole thing, but I think that's owing to heading into it with already low expectations and nothing better to do. Definitely not worth a watch. I've always wondered how directors feel after making a movie and it has a crappy ratings on every review platform.

reviews.review_title: They paid Bruce Willis in iTunes vouchers
reviews.content: Remember when Bruce Willis was in Quentin Tarantino movies? Remember when you couldn't see how much he hated acting? Remember when he used to care? Yeah, me too.

Willis continues his downward spiral, adding another cinematic catastrophe to his credits. This low budget snoozer does little for Frank Grillo either which is unfortunate.Hopping from cliche to cliche, the film bounces between very poorly choreographed fight scenes to absolutely abominable speeches sputtered out by an entirely wooden cast. The real sin hear is how badly the human to alien dialogue plays out. The director is either laughing or crying. And Spoiler: the aliens never wanted peace. Ever heard that before? There's plenty of outright dialogue stealing from a number of other films: adding a degree of shamelessness to this quagmire.With a average rating of 2.5 it's clear Willis has totally given up on caring.

reviews.review_title: So far the worst movie of 2021
reviews.content:
I know Covid is out and the actors got hard times to get a job, but this is
by faaaaaar the worst movie Bruce Willis ever done.This will easy get him an good score at Rotten Tomatoes.
Bruce is the New Nicolas Cage.This is a trash movie. Dont waste time on it.

I no longer fear death because I have seen Cosmic Sin and what could possibly be worse? The biggest sin is that this steaming pile ever got made. Made my eyes bleed and I kept throwing up in my mouth. Saying it was bad is an insult to bad movies everywhere. I could actually feel brain cells dying as I sat through this abortion. I don't think I'll ever be able to drink enough to erase it from my memory. Best part of the whole movie was when it ended and the pain finally stopped. Shame on you Mr. Willis. Shame on You. If you have someone that you hate. I mean REALLY HATE tell them to watch Cosmic Sin. They will no longer want to live in a world where horrible things like this "movie" exists. Gotta go shower now and try to wash the stench of this atrocity off me.

Another atrocious offering from Bruce Willis. Everything about this film is garbage. The acting, the script, the direction. If you wish to spend an hour and a half more productively, rip off your clothing and roll in poison ivy.

Honestly rethinking my whole system of determine "the worst movie ever" because this set the bar at a new low. Hot garbage pile of jumbled and incomplete story, terrible acting, awful stereotypical action movie tropes, useless and confusing onscreen text (they came up with a plan to track down and destroy an alien invading force 47 minutes after first contact?) and the cringiest sound and ending scene.

Cosmic Sin is how Steven Speilberg would have directed movie.... if he was a baby. Maybe not. Any baby can make a movie better than this. Because this is a disgusting garbage that should not exist in humanity.Bruce Willis is the star of this. Every scene he is in he looks tired and bored. Poor Bruce. Can't imagine working in a set of this film. Guess he just wants to pay some bills.There are also other 'actors' in Cosmic Sin. But none of them knows what is called acting. There are even frequent close-up shots of actors just to show how terrible their performances are.Words can't describe how boring and boring this movie is. The plot isn't even interesting to begin with. It's amazing how 88 minutes can feel that long.Everytime you think this movie is ending it gives you more scenes. NO. You will find yourself begging for it to end.Go grab some snacks to eat instead. I find my self more entertained by eating the bag of chips in my hand than staring at this pathetic motion picture. Or if you want to look your TV for 88 minutes about a movie with nothing watchable, enjoy.

reviews.review_title: Far from cosmic; the true sin has been committed by those that produced and worst still green lit this film!!
reviews.content: When a small group of soliders on a remote planet are attacked by a mysterious alien civilisation another team of soliders headed up by disgraced retired General James Ford must work together and bring the fight to the aliens before they destroy Earth and the various other civilisations...I'm really starting to get sick of Sky Movies and their misleading ratings for films; 4 stars out of 5 this rubbish got from them (so 8 out of 10 on the IMDB scale). After I watched the film I decided to look at its IMDB rating to see what others thought of the film and was relieved to see that I wasn't alone in thinking this was a stinker (it's current rating of 2.5 out of 10 speaks for itself).Although many other people will have doubtlessly explained the many flaws with this film I may as well throw my hat in the ring and give my two penneth...For a start, despite the film only running for around 85-90 minutes it is excruciatingly slow with a practically non-existent storyline; I mean there's no real definitive explanation for what the aliens wanted and why they were attacking these civilisations in the first place? At one point it's mentioned that the aliens don't believe that they can co-exist with other civilisations and therefore effectively rather than destroy the people within the civilisations. They embody the people and use them as hosts to continue their destruction (effectively creating an army). This is summed up in about 30 seconds of dialogue and isn't eluded to again. To say this film lacks depth would be an understatement!!!Still shallow sci-fi isn't always bad, but if you're not going to give your audience a deep and involving story then it's usually a good idea to provide a shedload of action, sharp dialogue, interesting characters and a sense of fun. OK it's asking a lot to see all 4 elements, but even 1 or 2 of these things may have made the film just about bearable, but honestly the film is so colourless and so devoid of personality that it becomes a challenge just to sit through it.The acting is pretty poor as well; Bruce Willis isn't the best actor in the world, but he has appeared in a lot of good films meaning that if he is working with the right director and screenwriter they know this and will play to his strengths. To be honest though, given how bad this film was I think Bruce knew he was starring in a turkey and simply didn't care and therefore put no effort in at all. Everyone else is no better with many of the cast reciting their dialogue in an emotionless manner as though they were reading from an autocue. Oh and by the way guys you're meant to be soldiers so something in the way of camaraderie wouldn't have gone a miss.Believe its abysmal IMDB rating and the 1 or 2 star reviews, save 90 minutes of your life and just skip this rubbish.
All I got to say is don't watch because its a complete waste of your life.
I usually watch this kind of movies for a good laugh, but this one didn't even give me that little pleasure. I almost feel sorry for everyone who participated in this useless endeavor.

reviews.review_title: We finally have an answer to an age old question
reviews.content: Apparently there is nothing Bruce Willis won't do for money. They somehow managed to reduce the script to the title. The film itself is just a lot of stolen ideas from everything from Starship Troopers to Stargate to the infected humans were like the things from Ghosts of Mars. They just throw out a couple of ideas to get the ball rolling and then start the effects and gunfire. This seems to be Netflix's answer to Tomorrow War only somehow without anything resembling a story. Bruce, I hope you made some money off this turkey because the next step down is picking up cans along the side of a road.......

Its a low budget C/D title (or was this some kind of a fan film?, not really sure) with Bruce Willis. Do not expect any interesting shoot outs, fight scenes or effects, story is... lets call it "simple".
Couldnt watch it in one go, found myself escaping the torture every couple of minutes.
Acting aligned with the simple cliche story so do not expect anything in that area as well. Very little character back story and universe lore, characters are shallow and aliens are just simple strange looking cannon fodder with high tech appearing randomly, talking some brief non sense here and there and doing silly stuff before they are shot.
Sound was okay I guess for a low budget... thats why I gave it 2.I think anyone can guess how it ends in the first 5 minutes so not even bothering to put a spoiler here. If there was one thing surprising, its that Bruce didnt do 99% of the killing, that came really unexpected.

First I saw that movie you did, I think it's called breach? Where you're a space janitor and come under attack by aliens? Now this? If I hadn't been doing something else while this was on, I would've turned it off completely. This was so bad I don't have words. Actually, I do have words, for the actor that was the specialist officer/nephew. Your acting is terrible. Quit. I looked up other things you've been in. Acting isn't your calling!Also, normally I complain there aren't any black people in the movie, or only one. But even tho there isn't a single non white person in this movie, I'm glad for once. This was so bad.

reviews.review_title: Contender to the title "Worst Sci-fi movie ever".
reviews.content: This is honestly one of the worst movies I've ever watched, it's lame in every department. It seemed they burned of their budget to have Bruce Willis in half the movie, and as a result, the rest of the production cost had to be cut down, the whole movie takes place in a warehouse (made look "futuristic" with blue and orange neon lights, because that's the lighting everyone uses in the future(!)) together with a few set pieces in a forest. That's it. Do not, I repeat, DO NOT waste your time (or money) watching this stinking pile of crap. I wonder what made Bruce Willis agree to contribute to this tragedy? (He must have owed someone a huge favour)If I could give it zero stars I would, it's a terrible movie, terrible story, terrible acting..... TERRIBLE!!!

I sort of wonder whether there is a minimum word count for IMDB reviews, but then again I suspect there isn't if the number of reviews that appear that simply say 'I created an account to give this movie one star' is anything to go by. Mind you, those reviews generally don't tell me all that much, though the star rating generally does go to help the final score, not that this tells me anything these days with the number of single review accounts that seem to appear with all of the movies these days.However, this movie definitely deserves one star - it is bad - really, really bad. Okay, I was pretty tired when I watched this film, and found it rather difficult to follow, and normally that would suggest that maybe I should watch this film again. However, this film literally have the lowest rating that I have seen of any film on IMDB - and that is definitely saying something. It sounds as if nobody who watched the film enjoyed it. In fact, nobody has even bothered to write a synopsis on Wikipedia.What is it about? Honestly, I'm not all that sure. Is it an alien invasion that the people of Earth have to stop, or are they zombies trying to take over the Earth, and the people of Earth have to stop them. Yeah, it is pretty confusing, and doesn't seem to really have a coherent plot. Also, what is this thing about going out and destroying the aliens before they can, well, take over the Earth? That doesn't seem to be the type of thing that we should be advocating.Yeah, this film was incredibly painful to watch, and I really couldn't wait for it to be over. Sure, I could have simply walked out of the cinema, but I really don't like doing that - at all. I pretty much like to hang around until the end. Sure, I might watch it again if it appears on Netflix, but then again with all of the other films out there that I could be wasting my time watching, this one isn't going to be high on my list.

Maybe they were bored and thought, "Let's see how quickly we can slap a sci-fi movie together..."?Painfully bad dialog, crappy set design, dumb costumes, and a storyline that was borderline incoherent, not to mention completely unoriginal.They had a few people in this who should have known better, so it's hard to understand how one of them did not step forward and stop this catastrophe.
Bruce Willis in particular should be ashamed because you cannot tell me he could not afford to sit this one out.The real nail in the coffin is that you can't even laugh at this film because it is humorless.If they had gotten even one element of this movie right, I would tell you, but it truly is awful through and through.
The big take away from this film for me was that it one you wish they could unmake.

reviews.review_title: Cosmic Sin is really a SIN
reviews.content: A few things that i observed during my 1+ hour of struggle: Worst Acting, worst story, worst CGI, And of course, Worst version of Bruce Willis.. Please dont watch it even if you have a lockdown!!

I'm not even going to bother wasting an hour and a half my brain cells watching this because I know just by the pain staking wince inducing trailer that this belongs in a dumpster fire.Bruce Willis retire. Quit. Do something. But just stop with this embarrassing garbage.0 Stars.

reviews.review_title: Why wasn't this a big budget movie?
reviews.content: I feel like 2 stars is generous because this movie is really bad. Low quality on every level. But I'm a self-proclaimed sci-fi junkie and I enjoyed all of the sci-fi elements and concepts. Everything else is laughable.This is the kind of premise that will always get me to watch a movie. I just don't understand why it didn't attract a studio that could have turned this into a big budget blockbuster. In the right hands it could have been an awesome sci-fi action flick, something along the lines of Edge of Tomorrow. But instead we get this direct-to-video garbage. (1 viewing, 1/21/2022)

reviews.review_title: 500 years in the future n STILL using modern firearms LMAO!!!
reviews.content: Movies cost millions of dollars - you could feed thousands of starving and homeless people with that money, instead of making some utter piece of garbage that will be entirely forgotten in a week. All movies should at least TRY to be of high quality, otherwise what the hell is the point of expending all that time, energy and money? This movie was ridiculous, the entire first half was just too much exposition, but when it got to the second half, the movie forgot what it even about, then proceeded to throw space orcs using a super-stargate at us. During the big battle, when it looked like the space orcs didn't have enough main cast characters to attack, the crew decided to drop whatever they were doing on the set and and began to run around the base like crazy. If this is the only kind of work that Bruce Willis can find in order to survive, then I feel really bad for him.
A very amateur and boring movie. No idea why stars like Bruce Willis agree to be in these kind of films? Too much of colors makes it irritating and impossible to watch.

I'm not one of those users who tend to write one star reviews on IMDb. In fact, many of my favorite b-movies or indie movies are movies I discovered on IMDb and tend to have between 1 and 4 stars to which I don't agree because I loved the movies for being low budget in the first place. But now this Cosmic Sin really baffled me. Nothing works, the pacing is clunky, the dialogues are terrible, Bruce Willis seems to stare at the camera and do one liners just because and looks totally bored, the cinematography looks really amateur and cheap, and the special effects are worst than the ones found on amateur Star Trek fan films. Worst of all the story is bland and it looks like it was written by some teen fed on a bad diet of unimaginative comics and boring videogames. The movie locations also don't help and all seems like a useless z movie because in some ways it does not even reach the status of a b movie.
I was bored beyond words with this one, couldn't wait for it to be over and simply don't get how this was even made and more baffled to see Bruce Willis in this. Its not even one of those so bad it become great. It simply is not a fun movie at all and one star is the best I can give. One of the most boring, predictable and pointless space adventures I ever saw. And I'm 51, I've seen things ...

I made it about 12 minutes into the film and just said no. There is nothing redeeming in this film. Direction is bad, acting is bad, dialogue is absolutely atrocious. This is an afternoon low budget SyFy film that raised enough money to put Frank Grillo and Bruce Willis in it, which i am pretty sure their scenes were added post production. Yes movie is that bad.
Awful. just awful. I was hoping this would be good entertainment. complete disappointment.

Honestly, don't watch this one. It will only makes you sad.Well it makes you wonder - is age all it takes for you to drop your expectation and dignity bar low enough to accept a role in a hollow movie?Make yourself a favor and watch The Fifth Element instead :-)

reviews.review_title: Another worst action film! Full of boring conversation, and annoying overuse scene! Avoid at all cost!
reviews.content: This film start with a man with armor "James" landing on the ground, and two people kissing scene! As turnout, this film is about James need to team up with Ryle to defeat the alien colony in planet "Ellora" to save earth! Entire film full of boring conversation, and annoying overuse scene! Such as, overuse of the calling names scene, overuse of the drinking scene, overuse of the walking scene, overuse of the monitoring scene, overuse of the flashbacks scene, and overuse of the arguing scene! Make the film unwatchable! All the shooting scene have blood at certain point, but overall portray by sideways, messy, have slow motion, and just hear the gunshot sound! Make the film frustrated to watch! The only intensity of the film is the explosion scene! At the end, Ryle sacrifice himself to save earth! That's it! Wasting time to watch!

Everybody who was involved in producing this masterpiece of crap should instantly end his/her career.
What a waste of money (but not talent).
They should be sentenced to watching this masterpiece of stupidity for 100 days in a row. Actors included. Shame on all of you!

It feels like some low budget fan film that is so bad the other fan films don't want anything to do with it.Plot sucks, directing sucks, writing really really sucks, acting really really really sucks.Why Bruce Willis would want to be involved in this pile of poop is beyond me. I'm guessing he lost a bet or was heavily medicated at the time and had no clue what all the cameras around him were for.
I thought I'd seen the worst streaming movies until I saw this. I could make a list of its many flaws, but it, like the movie, would be pointless. Just go watch Star Trek -any of them- again.

reviews.review_title: Not good, but better than my low expectations
reviews.content: You see a newer Willis film, you expect it to be terrible. He didn't really act at all in this film, he was just kind of there, repeating his spoon-fed lines. Frank Grillo is hardly even in the film, he has about 4 scenes.The supporting cast is terrible and forgettable, and the aliens/villains are just crap, and are very clearly just people in a robe with a hidden face.What I will say is, the CGI is surprisingly actually decent. Biggest surprise from this C movie.The plot is simplistic, but the ending is terrible and rushed.

reviews.review_title: Definitely a sin of cosmic proportions
reviews.content: There's already plenty of reviews to let you know this is the greatest disaster mankind has faced on this world. This is Covid, Ragnarok, and the Sun going supernova all rolled into an aluminum foil-wrapped hot pocket in a microwave. How this ever made it from script to production is a question to which the answer, if there even is one, I can assume is safely tucked inside Pandora's Box, never to be known lest it lead to more abominations like this being made on the regular.Completely bland and boring, from the dialogue to the set pieces. Scenes just come and go, offering no substance other than merely padding the time. Anyone giving this high marks because it's "hilariously bad" is doing a disservice by inflating the overall score (currently 2.5).The only thing that could be considered slightly decent quality is some of the special effects work, which is still outclassed by most tv commercials. Everything else will leave you wishing you could go back in time and stop Bruce from destroying that asteroid so the world wouldn't have to suffer this.

This movie has the budget of a high school drama production, and the writers are volunteers. So many errors from the year 2500 time line with nothing more advanced than a few cgi cut away scenes.The acting and dialogue are impressively horrible. It's like they were trying to write a Razzie award winner, and they got it. Congrats. Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo should retire already, along with Mel Gibson. These actors have long since passed their prime and not just put out low effort tripe. They have to know how bad the movie is while filming.

This movie was absolutely horrid from start to finish, Bruce Willis brought absolutely nothing to the movie...In fact he was hardly even in it. The small amount of screen time he did have he was half asleep and really gave the impression he never cared about the role and putting effort into his character, it was like he didn't even want to be on set.I was extremely close to just turning off the movie half way which takes me a lot to even get to that point. The story line and plot is laughable along with the snooze fest acting. Most of the viewing experience was me and my wife going ''huh?" "what?" "This makes no sense." ''Damn this is bad''.I wouldn't even recommend this movie to my worst enemy. It was painful to watch. Don't even waste your time, the only thing you will be missing out on is a painful viewing experience.

Avoid this movie at all costs. I've seen some pretty bad sci-fi movies, but this might be one of the worst. There are numerous plot holes in the story and it continues going downhill scene after scene. I love Bruce Willis, but this movie was pathetically bad.

reviews.review_title: It's official Bruce Willis is DONE!! the 1 trick pony done out lived his welcome, now GO AWAY!!!!!
