reviews.review_title: How the F is this even rated 2.5?!!
reviews.content: This movie is terrible!!!! Actually I don't think we have made up a word that describes how bad this movie is. I would rather listen to "this is the song that doesn't end" over and over for eternity than watch this movie again. I would rather hang out with Barney and Blues Clues. I would rather sandpaper the a$$hole of an alligator in a phone booth. I still don't feel I have expressed myself enough on how much this movie was an utter disappointment. But that's all the energy I have left. I wasted the rest on hoping something would get better in this god awful movie!!!!!

It's a low budget sci-fi film but it has an excellent cast and I liked some of the scenes, I think they did well with the low budget and it was a lot better than the other Bruce Willis sci-fi anti-life.

Remember the 2000 frames of film Bruce Willis appeared in in the planet terror segment of grind house? Better to watch that 125 feet of film over & over... & over, than to let precious seconds of your life slip away one heartbeat and eyeblink at a time watching this dumpster fire on a train wreck.I keep telling myself this isn't actually Bruce Willis, this is early prototype deep fake tech. Or somebody near and dear to Bruce was kidnapped and held in a cage over a pool of sharks with a candle burning through the rope to force him to participate.I can't imagine anybody watching this on purpose twice.

If this was a final year cinematic school project, only the casting guy would have passed. Everyone else would have failed. This looks like they had a $ 10,000 budget and only used $ 5000 of it. 2** for the casting guy, 0* for the rest.
If you have read any of the many lengthy negative reviews you will only have gotten just a small inkling as to how bad this movie really is.

What's wrong with the streaming services paying money to create crap like this. For the money they spent on this dog they could have brought us another season of Marco Polo or Altered Carbon both light years better than this piece of crap.After watching Frank Grillo in numerous low budget dogs and he kept it together but, this one went off the rails from the moment the opening credits started. I'm sorry for the actors in this because it's quite apparent that some of them were hired for their names and not their acting ability. Bruce Willis being one.I think this should be mandatory viewing for anyone who thinks that making a good sci fi just requires the same tired old concepts and a few big name actors. Because this gong show is proof that you can't make a silk purse out of a sows ear.

I truly don't know where to start. The beautifully crafted dialogue? The Oscar worthy acting? The stellar directing?No. Let's start with the special effects budget which, if I were to guess, came from a small town high school that had surplus funds of about $250, because they had to cancel a play. Nice of you to donate, Rural High (go Tigers)!Next up; the gruff security sergeant who wears a beret like my girlfriend wears a rubber swim cap. . . Wardrobe department can't let the FX crew outshine them.I could go on (AND on), but suffice it to say that you're in for a cinematic treat my friends. I wish we could be together as you discover that the futuristic Q bomb from 2524 is a clear plastic tube, with the sophisticated inner core being made up of (drumroll, please) . . A bronze colored screw, air gapped with a copper wire wrapped in electrical tape. . . I kid you not. . . You're mouth with gape in awe. I'm not with you, so you'll have to close it yourself, buddy.These few tidbits only cover the first 17 minutes!WHY? Did I rate this movie a 10? Because I used to cut myself as a teenager. . . Major corporations frown upon constantly bandaged wrists, so as a responsible adult, I have to seek out alternative sources of pain to maintain gainful employment.God Bless you Bruce Willis, God bless you.

The Earth looks very much like it does today minus the robot bar tender. Slang terms like "Secret Squirrel" is still being used. The character development was light and I had flashbacks to Willis blowing up an asteroid. I understand the lack of love. It is an action film with lots of gun fighting and C.J. Perry. Not the best, but strangely I enjoyed it a bit.Guide: F-word. No sex or nudity.

reviews.review_title: I am an hour in and I hopped on here because I can't believe this is real
reviews.content: I am so lost. Who am I and what is this???I am very tolerable of "bad movies" because usually there is something to take away from. Costume, acting, dialogue, jokes, concept, action, storyline, a twist, suspension, soundtrack, vibe ... like literally anything can make me think "oh sure, yeah it was alright".The clunking sound of their armour made me laugh. I am an hour in and I still believe this film is a prank.

reviews.review_title: Biggest bruh moment in cinematic history.
reviews.content: Pure cancer.Looking at wall drying is more fun.Doesn't even work as comedy.

I turned this movie on with some expectations -Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo, right? Shouldn't be too bad? Unfortunately, ten minutes in and I was already discovering how wrong I was. Some B and C grade actors have been thrown in the mix, I guess the movie makers decided to throw a few unknowns in because they had to fork out a fortune to get Willis and Grillo- but the acting talent definitely ends with the big guys, and so did the budget. This claptrap recycles old Independence Day troupes and doesn't even do a good job of it. Bruce Willis is the same character he plays in every movie- world weary, hard-done-by, ex expert at everything you can name, reluctantly dragged into a catastrophe so he can rescue everyone. You've seen it all before a thousand times.

reviews.review_title: I'm glad this is getting the rating it deserves..
reviews.content:
It's hard to pick a place to begin on how bad this movie really is...I don't consider myself the type who just can't wait to trash a film... and I'm pretty sure you'll have to look for yourself, ANYways...
It seems to be written by high school students...the dialogue... the discombobulated story, overall...
The cliches...
How do scripts like this get funded?PS... many others keep asking how Willis can participate in such trash...a) none of my business. Literally...
B)ut... alimony and property taxes... tuition, cars, insurance, clothes for the kids... not sci-fi...

The end credits are good, the font they used for the credits is ok, the rest of this movie, looks like 2 bored teenagers grabbed a few friends and filmed it during lockdown in a garage. Somehow they got Bruce to appear. I can only think, lockdown got to him, and he thought "hell yeah, I can get out the house for a few hours"0/10
I really don't know what I just watched. So awful total garbage..couldn't finish watching it past 15 minutes of this crap. I will watch Sharknado over this garbage any day.

reviews.review_title: Ok, it is not that we have one bad movie, but 3 or 4... what is going on here?
reviews.content: Please tell me how Edward Drake gets someone like Bruce Willis for not one incredible bad movie, not two incredible bad movies, but 3, and counting..Breach, Cosmic Sin, Apex, and likely more we don't know about. Someone has money to play with, and Bruce is taking it gladly no matter the hit to his reputation at this point I guess... three incredible bad sci-fi movies. No doubt the cg is decent, but the story and directing is so awful, that you have to think there is more to this picture then meets the eye..What is the thing that is missing from this picture, how much did Bruce make on this little deal......

How did this guy get any writing or directing gigs? More importantly why is he getting more? Why is Bruce Willis? Had more questions, but that is a better summary, I watched all of Breach, they owe 1 hrs 32 min, now add 37 more minutes because I am not investing anymore time into this sad duo. I thought no matter how brainless the plots at least Willis entertained, not anymore. Retire already if you don't want to work. You couldn't land Moonlighting if you got the shot and the youth somehow.An insult to movie paying public!The question asked at the end of writing the review is are there any spoilers, I will answer no, but it has spoiled my evening and any future hope of a GOOD Bruce Willis movie.

No comment really, except to say these big names will sell their soul to the devil for a few quid!! The only reason I watched it was because the reviews were so bad that I had to check it for myself! Well, you lot were on the ball with your comments. Hollywood has desperately lost the plot AND it shows big-time with some of the crap that comes out of La La Land nowadays!!

reviews.review_title: A terrible movie... Bruce should fire his agent
reviews.content: From the first 30seconds of the movie, I already knew this movie was going to be trash, but I didn't realize just HOW trash it was going to be. This is a 3rd-rate movie that hitched their ENTIRE wagon onto Bruce Willis' name... without him nobody would even have bothered streaming this movie, nevermind watching it at the theatres.This movie HAS TO have had a budget below $15mil..... it would be an absolute travesty if they spent anything more than that on this terrible movie. And I'm sorry but if you're going to attempt to make a 'sci-fi space epic adventure film' on a budget of $15mil or less then you're just insane. 1 or 2mil probably went to Bruce and that left the rest of the movie with an already shoe-string budget. The CGI is bad. The editing is bad. The majority of the movie takes place in darkness, so they didn't have to spend money on set-pieces. There's an INSANE amount of vignetting, lens flare and vaseline-lens going on as well, which is a huge indicator of a terrible production. Easily 30% of the movie is show with vaseline on the lens, I'm certain of it.There's SO MANY things that this movie COULD have done differently to make it seem like it had a bigger budget. Upgrade (2018) is a FANTASTIC example of how to make a sci-fi film with NO budget. I mean Upgrade (2018) had a $3mil budget which is absolutely insane, and if you watched that movie then you'd know that it certainly didn't seem like a shoe-string budgeted movie. Really the fault comes down on the bad director of this movie and just the whole production team as well (since the editing and framing of this movie is terrible too).This movie has no real redeemable qualities and I'd HIGHLY recommend that you watch something else instead. This movie is literally a waste of time and the only one who probably benefitted from this experience is Bruce Willis since he can walk away with a cool couple million (although I respect him less as an actor because of this movie now).

reviews.review_title: Had to make an account to warn you
reviews.content: This is the worst movie I've ever seen, and I've seen a lot of garbage.Not only is this film stupid, derivative and criminally badly done but for some reason they tried to make it about a very clumsy but very disturbing apology of genocide.I watched this wondering all the time what the few dozens of people making this trash were thinking at the time of making it. Is it possible a single person here believed in this? How did anyone even agreed to pay for it?

reviews.review_title: Willis proves over and over that Drumpf lovers are nót hated in Hollywood because of their politics
reviews.content: The special effects are shoddy and cheap. They actually pull that trick of shooting a scifi/futuristic movie in a forest, because hey, forests in the future and in the past always stay the same: loads of trees standing up straight. But then, they also wanna convince us that after four or five centuries in the future, warehouses still look like they did in the 90s?Goo ole' Brucie, a self confessed Reich!!!Winger, who even openly admitted he voted for the chief Babies-in-Cages-Stuffer #DrinkBleachDonnie is on a losing streak of movies, but he goes even beyond the gutter that Charlie Sheen went.And no, it's not because of his politics. This is just a bad, lousy scripted movie, of which Frank Grillo should be ashamed of. The production values are so low, one thinks about Death Valley. Or the Mariana Trench.This is what you get if an actor turns to the Dark Side and supports a teen-girl-groping inject-bleach-adviser like trump: puke worthy crap. It's sad, more than anything. Let's all recommend Samuel L. Jackson for being magnanimous.1 oth 10 The Melancholic Alcoholic.

reviews.review_title: The making of this movie was a 'Cosmic Sin'
reviews.content: Plenty of CGI here doesn't save the weak storyline, script and direction. It had plenty of money to work with, yet the result is hackneyed (The hero pulled out of retirement. The alien enemy inhabits humans they encounter. The military bungling primary first contact. The Vader-esque enemy to battle near the end.). It's another pay day for Bruce, but his star presence lends an air of credibility that would not otherwise draw in viewers.

.. i mean, it's no masterpiece, but as a popcorn scifi flick, it was decent. What were you expecting.Bruce Willis is a (old looking) future-guy in power armor who shoots aliens, for the government.
Lots of co-stars with badly divided screen time, tons of technobabble, mediocre "modern" photography, terribad camerawork, "actually passable" acting, not-bad-at-all dialogue, the real culprit here is the direction. Oh and the soundtrack is amateurish.
The special effects were not terrible either. The power-armor suits were bad, the enemies are just makeup zombies, and the story isn't much, but Cosmic Sin doesn't deserve 2.5/10 - i've seen stuff MUCH worse than this with a far higher rating. And, no midichlorians.My rating 6/10 - a vaguely-futuristic soldiers-on-mission B-movie.

1 point for the main actors

1 point because I like space operas

reviews.review_title: OMG, what are you thinking Bruce?

Those days are gone, Bruce has decided to take any role at the cost of destroying his credibility as an actor.This movie shouldn't have even been made, it was a low budget heap of dung, bad actors, low budget and poorly written, I almost burst out laughing a few times at how bad it was, give it and Bruce a miss.

reviews.review_title: Hour and a half of my life lost
reviews.content: I love lt SCI FI and though skeptical I figured a Bruce Willis movie can't be that bad. Boy was I wrong. This was one horrible piece of trash movie. Complete waist of time.

reviews.content: Wow! What a piece of anachronistic garbage! 500 years in the future and they still drive 2019 Toyota pickup trucks and use conventional guns. Not to mention the Harley. Plot was pointless, dialog horrendous, acting was wretched. Nothing fun or redeeming about this movie. Absolute of time.It amazes me to think someone actually green-lit this garbage!

reviews.review_title: Really bad. Among the worst movies I watched in 2021
reviews.content: The idea was pretty cool, but it just came together so poorly I wish I'd turned it off.Tropey in an extremely unfun wayBoring characters and storyAwkward music and actingDialogue was just awfulThe whole thing felt like it was a big joke to everyone in the cast, that we weren't in on. It was 100% a cash grab for the studio and people involved.

So bad it's worth watching as an anchor experience, so you know what kind of film rates 1 on a 10 point scale. 1 actually seems a little generous. On the plus side every other film you watch will feel slightly better because you'll have Cosmic Sin as a contrast.

Please do not spend your time and money on this movie. I cannot recall ever being this disappointed by a movie. The production quality is painfully low, acting is terrible, the story is cliché and uninteresting, the pace boringly slow.

reviews.review_title: Awfull even for a b movie i'd rate as a d - film.
reviews.content:
Plot - sounds interesting, but is so poorly executed even bruce just couldn't be bothered to try to raise it up.The aliens - you see none of them. just a couple of 'turned' people.The big bad - some guy in a cheap cthulu mask and human style war armor ?
carries a large blade that clearly is made of tin foil. and he puts up no fight what so ever after being shot and stabbed.the time period of 26th century seems like a typo, because it's implying bruces character is over 500 years old ?The city scape shown is distinctly 22nd century at a stretch. and people still drive cars we do today ? no hover cars or anything actually futuristic.a few space ships that seem ripped out of any cheap sci fi show.cgi effects are so poor it makes the cw look good.the guns are using stock effects and any close up is cut out for some rando angle and then the aftermath, dumb soldiers who spend all their time in cover talking or looking hard, and then stand up and run at the enemy to die.to top it off the film makes a point of 'tachyons' and time travel and then completely forgets about it other than oh they are blocking our signal so we gotta use the bfg 10k rip off gun to get away from it.
Rather sad I know but I usually like Bruce Willis films, not this one however, I found it boring and it didn't hold my attention.

reviews.review_title: Bad in most ways with a few good ideas but not enough...
reviews.content: I hadn't planned to watch this but as I was scanning movies it was in the list and I stopped scanning to do something else and it started on its own. So I said I should watch this movie that had terrible reviews. After all I do know how to fast forward.The funny thing is that I never fast forwarded which is something I do on many bad movies. Normally I go through the major parts of the movie in detail but that is not necessary here as most are bad.Acting. Bad. We now know Willis's medical condition and indeed we can see his earpiece in several scenes. That's too bad but he is still bad. The fact he pumped out 18 movies or so in his last two years to grab cash does not mean we have to accept the acting job. Grillo is also barely in it so it is left up to the other actors, most of which are just okay.Plot. On paper it looks good but it doesn't flow. We go from potential first contact to a major battle scene to wiping out the enemy all in less than a week.The reason I gave it a two instead of a one was that there were a few things I think they did different and well.KILL THE ENEMY. We often see movies where humanity is fighting aliens. I can't remember one in which humans made the decision to attack first and wipe out the other species before it became a threat to humanity. And while there were a few nay-sayers to that policy in the movie - overall it stayed on point.QUANTUM JUMP. We've seen this before in different ways but I liked how they had suits that allowed them to jump, survive in space, "fly" in space, and land properly. It would make travel very fast allowing for much exploring. There was no discussion about how you got back home.MARS COLONY. Earth lost the Mars colonies and it seems like a throw-away piece of information that has no relevance to the story line. Yet the fact it is in the story makes you wonder why and how the Mars colonies were not part of the Earth alliance. I suspect it was not thought out but it makes us wonder.Q-BOMB. We've seen small explosives before but this one seemed especially dangerous. Although you had to be careful carrying it but it was okay to shoot it out a cannon.ENDING. In some ways a terrible ending all around. Yet I liked that Willis finished his drink, had the flashback of his ex-wife and then just walked out alone. It re-enforced what he said to the engineer, who now seems to be in a relationship with the jerk soldier. Might have had more impact if this was the last of the Willis. Aphasia - earpiece movies.Far too much wrong with the movie to go over but one thing that irked me and it could have been good filler would have been to see the black hole develop and watch all those ships get sucked slowly into it. They took the time to give us a huge cut and paste space fleet, they at least could have shown us the fleet's demise.

Thought that this movie had a rating of 4.5. I was wrong: At the present, the rating is only 2.5.Thought that this movie with among others Bruce Willis could not be so bad that it only deserved a rating of 4.5. I was wrong: The actual rating of 2.5 is closer to what it deserves!Thought that since it could not be so bad bad that it only deserved a rating of 4.5, it would at least be worth seeing to spend some time. I was wrong...The ONLY positive that I can write about this movie is that the visual effects were OK. They were not bad, they were not good, but at least they were OK.The sound quality was OK, but music/sounds were at times badly chosen. For example, the sound on top of a fight scene towards the end was a harmonica playing...The acting was between OK and bad. The most of the time it was bad. The manuscript and the directing was mostly really bad! Several scenes were more or less over after a few seconds without any build up before, or any follow up afterwards. Leaving the viewer with no explanation to neither why or how things happened!! Several scenes and lines during the movie was just cringeworthy!Do not make the same mistakes that I did: This movie IS as bad as the rating of 2.5 indicates that it is, and it is NOT worth the time watching it!

reviews.review_title: This is NOT a 2.5 rated movie!
reviews.content: First, I am giving a general rating system below for the idiots who think this is a one. This isn't the best movie ever but if you like SyFy it is a good movie. It is entertaining.I almost didn't watch due to this being rated a 2.5 overall. I mean that rating would make this a steaming piece of garbage, which it is not! I was curious how possibly bad this could be so I watched the first 10 minutes then watched the whole movie. Yes, the special effects aren't that of a 100 million dollar movie but they aren't too bad.Overall this is a good SyFy movie, definitely watchable if this is your genre. Aliens, military, action and a good enough plot with dialog. Better than the movies the SyFy channel puts out themselves. Honestly I would have rated a 6 to 6.5 but since everyone rated so low I rated it a 7. Don't rush to watch it but if you like SyFy and Bruce Willis then a good way to kill some time.I wish you could only rate if there was proof you watched the whole movie or series.I want to make this clear. Here is how ratings should work! Since we can't give a zero an average movie is 5.5. So a 5 is a little below average and a 6 is a little above average. I just jotted these all down so I am sure they could be tweaked.1 Is totally unwatchable. Complete waste of time and money! I want my eyes and time back! These are movies Elvira said no to! Burn all of these as they have zero cinematic quality to anyone!2 - This movie was rejected from the B movie festival. I would not watch again, I would never recommend and I am upset I saw it! The only reason it might do well is people watch these because they are so bad it is funny.3 - This is a B movie and not a good one at that! I was at someone's house and I could not escape. Good date movie so they might like to do something else. ^ ^ Would not recommend and I am upset I watched.4 - Ugh, This wasn't very good. I watched too much so I felt obliged to watch the rest. I am not super happy I put it on! I guess B movies fit in here.5 - Slighty below average. Watchable and okay but would not watch again.6 - Slightly above average. Watchable and a enjoyed a few parts.7 - Good movie. Happy I watched it. Some good parts in it.8 - Amazing movie. I greatly enjoyed this movie! Very happy I watched it!9 - Wow. Not a blockbuster but really enjoyed this! I would tell anyone to watch this awesome movie. I will watch again! Great job!10 - One of the best movies! I would love to see this movie again! I would like to own this. Great piece of cinematic art!
I understand the wobbly camera "style" used for action sequences, but why on earth deliberately wobble the camera in close up non action sequences! I could film it better. Makes me feel dizzy.

reviews.review_title: Sad Film 2 End With: Ho Hum
reviews.content: Will miss Bruce as he faces a terrible disease. Seriously great actor.The movie is truly weak but, some moments r great. Mostly disjointed, lacking ANY interest. Why bother.

reviews.review_title: ANOTHER CHEAP 'N' CHEESY SCI-FI B-MOVIE WITH WILLIS!!!
reviews.content:
EDWARD DRAKE who directed this very low-budget t.v series like Sci-fi Thriller also had written it & also had written the other Bruce Willis Sci-fi Cheapy ANTI-LIFE (2021) also & that explains why both films are so similar & i thought that as I watching it, i actually said to my wife that Willis must've gotten Deya Vu making this!!!
I actually liked ANTI-LIFE better of the two but to be honest they do make a chilled evening of a Double Bill of Willis Sci-fi Thriller's.
Now COSMIC SIN is set like it's other half of the Double bill, in the future but this time the world isn't destroyed but just very futuristic (with what the small budget could do) with flying cars/vehicles as well as normal cars too still & robots for a barman in the bars (Similar to Will Smith's i,Robot 2004) & lots of glowing Neon lights & things & for the most part it looks good!!! Yes it's very low-budget but i gotta admit i was impressed with alot of the look & technology they pulled off with cheap c.g.i & practical effects & the basic story is our planet has finally made contact with Alien creatures but they're hostile & when a team return from another planet that they've been stationed on, they come back possessed just like in it's close brother ANTI-LIFE & start killing everyone in the station base & here we get our team of soon-to-be heroes with the rugged old infamous ex-Commander Bruce Willis known as a warmonger due to his brutal past & it's just nice having the old skool Action legend here in such a low-budget production, even if he's only here for the paycheck!!! Willis plays his part like most these days with a calmness & a Coolness & a bad attitude just like he did in Anti-life & many other of his DTV films but i like him here & just by having him lifts its quality.
We also get the great B-movie legend FRANK GRILLO who i have loved since THE PURGE: ANARCHY & his Cool, rugged & no-nonsense toughness is on display again in a leader role but to be honest he doesn't get to do the action i expected & wanted but again it's great to have the veteran side by side with Willis.
There's a few other familiar faces but it's these two stars is why i wanted to even watch this.I will say this though that i would rather watch this flick or Anti-life over any of the ridiculously mega budget TRANSFORMERS films & more so than many of the over-blown budget trash that is put on the Cinema, Cosmic Sin is small scale but crams in a fun little Sci-fi action story with a Cool Willis leading it all even if he's not exactly giving it his all, still miles better than the usual Steven Seagal DTV flick.
Small minimalist budget yes but i see alot of creativity went into creating the look & it's futuristic technology & it does look Good for it's budget!!!
At times i got the feel & vibe of a POWER RANGERS episode or movie, especially when they gear up with body armour suits & when they fight the Alien beings (that seem like possessed humans as you Don't ever see their faces or what they really are) the villains come accross as the type that the Power Rangers would battle but hey it's a Low-budget slice of Sci-fi Thriller cheese so i just took it for that.
Our team are power boosted through space & land on another planet that is fine for Humans & the rest of the Cheese fest plays on the forest planet with rebels (like STAR WARS) & the action is fine for a cheap flick with laser guns & possessed warriors that also reminded of John Carpenter's Ghost's of Mars just like ANTI-LIFE did too!!!! Many Sci-fi flicks enfluenced this as did ANTI-LIFE & like i said both written by Edward Drake but only this one was directed by him.Cosmic Sin just like Anti-life is a cheap, trashy & cheesy but fun B-movie that's nothing special or great but an easy watch & does make a nice Double bill with ANTI-LIFE. Entertaining & fun.

This movie definitely lives up to its title. The acting is abysmal, the story is TOTALLY uninteresting, Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo are barelye even in the movie, and overall this movie just blows. It's sad to see Bruce Willis' career take such a decline in recent years. I hope he finds a project worthy of his talents in the future, but as for this stinker, well, it ain't worth watching, even if someone offered to give you $50 to watch it.

We are still using fluorescent light bulbs, neon, gas powered pickups, and guns designed in the 1990's. NONSENSE!BTW - Bruce Willis is not now or ever was an actor. He is a former bartender who was a "type"with 2 expressions: a dumb smirk and a confused/concerned look. He is a notorious denier of serious acting being a craft and a jerk to work with.

What is wrong with sci-fi these days? Where is the imagination? Asylum movies are pretty bad but watchable and this didn't come remotely up to their standard. Who on earth thought the script had merit when characters struggled to string a few words together. Why do writers think the 'f' word has to be in every other sentence?
Near instantaneous space travel.Pick up trucks.Shotgun shells.Parasite waring aliens.Alien force fields.1 bomb.We win.They lose.End of story.

Whoever directed this, and shot this, should be shot. the nausea-inducing photography is just the tip of this pile of space trash. Bruce must have been an absolute pleasure to work with here, he doesn't seem annoyed AT ALL. wanna actually GREAT brand new SCI-FI movie?? try space sweepers! p.s. 400 years in the future aaaaaaaand... a 2016 motorcycle, makes sense. honestly looks like a fan made movie that somehow blackmailed BW into starring, it's 2021.... how does this trash still get made?! looks like there was a sale on blue/pink/red stage lights 😂

Ok. That's one word repeated 3 times. But it's still better than this excuse for a movie. The script was written by monkeys who saw other bad sci-fi's and the producers got a desperate Bruce Willis to agree to star in it thanks to a Netflix paycheck (it's become like the democrats feeding money to people to keep them compliant, and like this movie they don't work either). At least Mandylor suffered an early exit. The biggest "sin" is this is what is getting funded. That and I forced myself to watch the whole thing so I can leave a verified viewer review.

PLOT: The plot was as hastily shown as it was written. No depth, no message, just a sloppily pieced together non-story. 100% predictable. Mediocre. As if the director was just rushing to tell and go home to sleep it off. No effort to make a compelling story.PROPS: Power-ranger class "villains" with some sort of rubber-plastic "armor" that looks 100% pointless and silly. Ive seen better costumes in that D&D movie with the purple moron evil magician. The planetary defense cannon looked like a 60s carnival ride.DIRECTION: The director lacks a basic understanding of how physics works in space or low-gravity. Heck, he doesn't even grasp earth gravity.PLOTHOLES: Beyond count...Bruce, what the hell are you thinking? That some sort of a sad attempt for one last big job before retirement? That was SAD! That movie made me feel SAD and ANGRY! That was horrible! Awful! You should feel ashamed!
That says it all. So bad it's like watching a train wreck. Can't stop watching it. LOL.

reviews.review_title: 10 minutes in and turned it off
reviews.content:
Bruce Willis will take any acting job seriously he will. To be fair, I can't give a review since I didn't even make it past 10 minutes. What happens in the first 10 minutes?A small bomb lands in a forest. People talk in front of a Walmart parking lot. We see a dive bar with good ol aluminum siding on the outside. The patrons are dressed in flannel shirts. People pull out pistols during a fight. This is not a scene from 1982...this movie is supposed to be 2542 or whatever date that is 500 years from now.According to the writers, rednecks will survive through the next 5 centuries. Pitiful start and I didn't care to continue with it. I hope you value your time more than Bruce Willis.
Did the writers even bother

reviews.review_title: how did this garbage hit the big screen!!!
reviews.content: I cant believe there were ads for this pile of confusing oozing poop of a movie across social media, its so far below a B-Movie its astonishing it got funded ...every aspect of this movie is sub par...what the hell happened to Bruce Willis!!!

One of the worst movies I've watched in years. Boring script that made no sense. The actors looked as if they were as bored with making the movie as the audience. Whoever signed off on making this needs to find another line of work.

Come on Bruce I generally love your movies but this one is the pits. I gave it 2 stars only because you're in it.Tip to viewers. Watch the first 10 minutes.... If you like
It keep going it doesn't get any better but no worse either. I watched the whole thing. Lol.

reviews.review_title: The glory days of bad sci-fi movies are upon us.
reviews.content: "Cosmic Sin" is set 500 years in the future, where seven rogue soldiers launch a preemptive strike against a newly discovered alien civilization in the hopes of ending an interstellar war before it starts. This movie feels like nobody wanted to do this, but they were forced to do it. There is almost no story, and the low-budget effects have nothing else to add - so why even make this movie? Yes, it has Bruce Willis in it, but he seems to be lost between being high and dementia. Amazingly this film fails at everything, not just acting, sound, music, lighting, and directing, but even with something as basic as an idea - there just isn't any. This truly is a cosmic sin.

reviews.review_title: LoFL. Oh how the mighty have fallen
reviews.content: Bruce, buddy, as a friend... I'm telling you to pull yourself together big guy. You're better than this, you see that don't you? You see that, right? Bruce? BRUUUCCEE!!Omg it's so bad though/10.

Wow, simply spectacular. One of the best sci fi movies ever made, and probably Bruce willis top performance to date. Makes you watch this movie again, again, and again.Spoiler Alert: Why should I suffer alone

There is no point to add another review but here are my 5 cents worth! I didn't even watch the movie just forwarded it and that can give you a pretty good idea of what's going on! In a sci-fi film you expect action but from what I'm seeing there are little and few scenes with it! Mostly there are human interactions and conversations! My suspicions were confirmed after reading the reviews. So glad I didn't waste time on this!Sorry Bruce Willis but you must really need the money but surrogate and vice both sci-fi flicks were superior to this!

reviews.review_title: Soon Bruce Willis will make Movies with Steven Seagal
reviews.content: Yup, here I said it. Bruce Willis' career or what remains of it is faster and faster circling down the drain to Steven Seagal bad movie levels.What the hell happenend Bruce? It's pretty obvious now that he is not even pretending to care anymore.Is that man so desperate for a paychek that he even outdoes Steven Seagal and Nicolas Cage in terms of bad One Dollar Bin flicks?Jesus Christ Bruce, what the hell happened?
That movie sucks, dont see it. My eyes is still bleeding.

reviews.review_title: Just bad! Really bad and gets worse!
reviews.content: With an impressive actor line up, I was expecting something good! Nope, not here! Not at all.The sound editing was weak and awful at times.The suits were horrible. The flying through space scene was horrid and then the acting got super horrible.

reviews.review_title: The movie no one wants to be in.
reviews.content:
I have the feeling that the producer/directors
Were at several partys and got talking to all the people there who were drunk and said do you want to be in a film, and drunkenly went, yep sure why not, to be woken by a call 3 months later to be reminded they said yes.

I don't know what was worse, the storyline or the horrible acting of the wannabe actors. I think I'd do a better job as a director or as any of the actors of this movie with ZERO experience. It is supposed to be a futuristic movie with a military campaign, but having been in the military myself, I'd probably throw everyone in the brig for insubordination.
Do not waste your time, worst movie I have seen in a very long time
Crikey Bruce what are you doing??? Why are you making complete turds like this??? This was painful to watch. It's worse than crapping out a knotted rope... flush.

This would probably have made a better series for sci fi newbies because it necessitates inference ( had to know what is happening based on lore and my other experiences.) for example at times my roommate had no clue what was happening . But I like how it cuts to the chase , I like the way it looks and the soundtrack. I think this is special and maybe ahead of it's time in the way the story is presented. The concept is solid and the viewer is not coddled in the delivery. With the whole production , costuming , concept , entertainment. I just can't see how anything about this is a 2-maybe Bruce Willis drew a different demographic. He is however perfect in this and for this.
What a piece of cosmic Shxt!. Poor visuals, it's like this was created on a $20 budget.

Whoever green lighted this film should be thrown out of the film industry and never be allowed back in. Who at Netflix was actually dumb enough to paid for this total waste of time. This could actually be the worst film Netflix has ever aired. I can't believe that Bruce Willis was desperate enough to make this. He must be really bored.

reviews.review_title: Even some household names couldn't make this good
reviews.content:
Some great actors in this aka Bruce Willis & Frank Grillo but oh my this film is terrible. I'm actually surprised they even agreed to be in this to be honest.
Very disappointing
Wow, the movie is so stupid, that it does not warrant longer review.

Just no...pure nonsense. I watched this based on the fact that bruce willis and frank grillo was in it. Ill never watch it again. The only way id recommend it is if you have absolutely nothing else to watch

reviews.review_title: Low Caliber, Low Budget, Poorly Executed
reviews.content: The delivery of a LOT of the dialog is difficult to watch most of the time, mostly because it feels like out of context each time. Its like they didn't get any military experts on-set to provide guidance. It's supposed to be 500 hundred years from now and I'm watching kids playing soldier with awfully communication skills. The quick explanation of any of the technology also feels like NO expert was available. Star Trek from the 70's did a better job with First Contact than these guys. Only reason I keep watching is hope of improvement by the end, don't hold your breath. Bruce Willis is another reason I kept watching, if he wasn't in it I would not even take the time to write this review.

Frank Grillo was making some great decisions with projects. He has a very likable personality about him in almost every movie. He's very talented and looked to be on the verge of potentially being a leading actor. Well, something has happened as of late because this is like the 3rd DUD he chose. I literally can't believe he would say yes to be involved in such garbage.
Yeah Bruce Willis is long in the tooth but come on, it's Bruce Willis. Well some years ago he decided for some strange reason it's better to be in horrible movies. Why??
Frank Grillo better change his direction fast before there's no turning back. I'm afraid to say it could be over for Bruce.
If I was to say this was trying to be a Halo ripoff, that would be a compliment.
The only way this cast will get to the Oscars will be to park every ones car for them .Properly bad avoid this one

I wish I had a mallet to smash the gong.... kicking the whole movie set off my tv. I'm sitting here waiting for something to happen and get better. I couldn't take this bs and stupid dialogue and stupid music like something was suspenseful when it wasn't. I can see why Bruce sucks now. Every flick he's signed onto since die hard has sucked. I thought this was an alien flick not some vampire zombie movie. Wth? What a pos movie. "Go go go" or "move move move" when getting shot at.....lmao..Believe all the 1s. I shut this off and didn't watch the rest...45 mins in, I turned on my Xbox damn this was painful to watch half way.Example of one of the many cheesy lines:Guy- "who do you think I am?Girl replies- "your worst drinking buddy"Really? Who wrote this stupid cr@pOh and the chick with the yellow and black pig tails? Listen to her cheesy laughable acting and lines. How the hell could this acting get past the producer and director? Hope you have a backup job :DYippee ki yay Bruce.

reviews.review_title: A movie that makes you question your own life
reviews.content: When a bad movie with aliens can be so bad, this is a great achievement. So at the end you look to screen with end cridits and think "Why?"
If you want some good fantasy stories, check out some of the 10 star rating reviews here. They are all more inventive than the movie.HOW COULE ANYONE GIVE THIS 10/10????
There is nothing positive I can say about this movie, Cosmic Sin. Poor acting. Rotten storyline. Overdone special effects. The required Netflix smoking scene. The whole movie sucks.
So we're rooting for colonisers in this one and not the freedom fighting aliens?Weird flex.

reviews.review_title: Bruce, you owe me 90 minutes of my life back
reviews.content: Future? So we still have concrete block buildings, manual doors, dirty windows, pallets, crates, motorcycles, bad make-up, and . . what the heck, why should I take more time to review this.Do not watch it. Go observe the growth of a cactus and you will use your time better.

It's a B movie. It's made to kill time. It could've been much worse ("Monsters of Man", anyone?)... Yes, the actors seemingly didn't want to be there, and the music was on the opposite side from Zimmer... But it's a B movie, okay?!On a bright side, other than presence of a token "female power" character with wielding a BFG, there's no virtue signaling whatsoever, no preaching or lecturing... That alone gets 3 extra stars from me. So, 4 in total. Fair enough?

I love sci fi movies, a movie has to be really bad for me to give it a bad rating, Bruce is washed up he is running in fumes of the 5th element, the alien attire was super cheap they used real people to save money, writing was horrible hard to follow the film seemed more like a high school film project, very disappointing. Who wrote this a high school kid?I have no more words it was horrible, probably 80% of the budget went to pay Bruce.

reviews.review_title: Can only have been made for tax relief!
reviews.content: Wow, there are bad movies and then there are those that are abysmal. Incoherent and painfully tedious to watch, Cosmic Sin feels like a first edit of a student film in a rural high school. Not sure what leverage someone had on Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo, but the debt paid isn't worth it at all because this film should not be released and be buried by anyone associated with it. Cheap costumes and sets, hammy dialogue, poor and horrible support cast coupled with a story that is so painfully written and edited that even the z-grade effects and stunts can't save it as being one of those guilty pleasure bad movies. Avoid like the plague or at best watch it during Covid lockdown when you've exhausted all other media options. I'm genuinely hoping this was made purely to get some tax credit in Georgia because it is the worst I've seen for some time.

This movie is yet another sci-fi with B. Willis. And again a boring and lame b-movie. I had to stop watching halfway, because its just so boring and lame. Its a lot of shooting and bad acting, and nothing else. Why does Bruce keep getting involved with these b-sci-fi movies? He used to be in great movies, but that has been a while now.

It is bad. It is really, really bad. I wonder, none of the production team could even bother saying a word of reason? It is so bad that 500 years in the future and all the context looks and sounds like some sort of 1990 idea. My gosh, what an awful movie! Even the aliens fight with axes and swords. Please, don't even waste your time.

I'm a proponent of reading reviews on a film, then basing my viewing in an effort to confirm or dispel the posts. Sadly, I agree with the majority of the reviews on this "film". That being said, still a Willis fan. Grillo? I thought Boss Level was incredibly violent and cheeky; so I believed this would be around the same "Level", alas... I was again incorrect... munroe will always be in need of more credit than he gets. People don't realize just how many films and shows he has added to! He is extremely underrated and deserves more. But his role here was that of a typical soldier-grunt that I believe put a glass ceiling on his acting abilities. All in all, I had to turn this off when he got called in the coconut... no other reason to watch this mess...
If anyone is looking to make better movies, my nephew has his elementary school Christmas pageant coming up in a few months. There may be better talent than this debacle..

I'm guessing the budget for this movie was spent on Willis' salary because everything else was obviously done without any money.Directing, embarrassing. Acting, amateurish. Costumes, cheap. Design, basic. Music, nails on a blackboard. Script, woeful.There was seriously nothing worthy in this crap.
Ok honestly, hmmmmm sums up this movie in every aspect. There is simply nothing positive or even neutral to say about this thing.

reviews.review_title: Works only as a warning to film students on what NOT to do...
reviews.content: The last few Bruce Willis films have been terrible, but this is exponentially worse than anything that has come before it.This will be used in every film studies class to highlight what never to do in a film. It's a great piece to use for this, because it fails at every single aspect of film making. There is literally no redeeming element in this film. Truly and spectacularly awful.
Title says it all. This movie makes me sad in pants.
This is a total mess from start to finish. No story and no explanation of what's going on. The acting is atrocious and aliens awful! Rubbish!!

reviews.review_title: Unfortunately, they do not have negative rating stars!!
reviews.content: This is the worst film I have watched -- EVER.The story line was extremely thin and badly played out.The cinematography was absolutely appalling, the director should hang his head in shame.The script, well, let just say, my cat (Loki, a very vocal feline) could have created a better script. He only just meows and yips and clicks. Would have been so much betterThe local, land based CGI was diabolical, however, some of the space based cgi was quite good. (the only good part but not a saving grace)Did they find the alien weapons in a Battlestar Gallactica left over bin?Bruce - what were you thinking, I really thought more of you!

It starts okay, and then 40 minutes in I'm like what the hell is this? I don't get it, I have no idea what's going on. The script is garbage, it's soooooo boring and there's nothing out of this world high teck to make you believe it's the yr 2500. I didn't finish it it's that bad.

I've got a pretty high tolerance for schlock(I've seen all 7 Tremors movies, AND the Show. I'm a huge Resident Evil Film Franchise fan. I could go on.) and honestly even I had a hard time getting through this one. I expected Bruce Willis to be sleepwalking his way through, like most films he's done in the last decade, but I didn't expect Frank Grillo to be pulling the same stunt.The younger less known set of actors try to put some flavor into it and the script seems to be trying for some sort of "is war just" point, but the nebulously defined zombie/fantasy/scifi aliens make any ''''''deep''''' quotes feel haphazard and pretentious.The sets are basic, all of the action taking place on either A) a greenscreen, B) cement bunker or C) A rough greenscreen trying to approximate space. In still images, the sort of armor suits the characters wear look cool, however any time an actor moves, it's clear they're just plastic shells hastily velcro'd onto the actor in some sort of wetsuit.All that would be entirely excusable if the actual plot, or characters, or world was engaging. It's not. It feels like a lesser Halo plot only with less nuance, less character, and unfortunately a very "Kill them all" attitude.Skip it.

Sharknado absolutely destroys this movie in acting and in cgi. You're better off paying an anaesthesiologist to put you to sleep for 2 hours, that way you don't have to feel any pain while you watch it. I should have listened to the reviews but just wanted to see for myself because I'm an old school Bruce Willis fan. I just can't believe this is the same Bruce that was in die hard....

reviews.review_title: I wanted to make a witty review title...
reviews.content: But this piece of absolute garbage doesn't deserve it. I actually created an account so I could write this review and try to help warn anyone in the future to avoid this at all costs. The only thing that got me through this "movie" to the end credits was complete blind rage. Love yourself and don't do it.

reviews.review_title: Why isn't there a zero rating?
reviews.content: Ooh how the mighty have fallen, Bruce has done great acting in some amazing movies so why did he sign up for this complete flop? Was he just board or broke? The script is almost to Saturday morning cartoons standards. The dialog is so week a grade schooler must of written it. As for the acting,,,,my grand kids can do better.I really can't understand if this movie was intended to be a comedy or were they purposely going for the razz award?This definitely goes in my top 10 worst movies ever made.

reviews.review_title: Bruce Willis takes money over integrity.
reviews.content: They must have paid Bruce Willis a good amount of money for him to actually agree to do this movie, or maybe he lost a bet. I suppose we will never know.I've already put in more effort reviewing this movie than the writers, actors, and everyone else did making it, so there you have it.

reviews.review_title: 90 minutes of my life I'll never get back.
reviews.content: I have, sadly, seen Paris Hilton act. I'm sad to say, that was better than any acting in this movie. Even a well versed actor like Bruce Willis have no chance of saving this pile of dung. A plot thinner than paper, a script that a kindergartner could have came up with and acting that is on the very bottom of the scale. At least the effects looked nice.
Terrible. Awful Awful dialogue. I've heard grotty old man farts that sounded better then most lines this movie vomited out. I will always love Brucey, but Cmon, are his bills that bad?
Watched for Bruce Willis, who almost sounded like Vin Diesel one-liners throughout the movie. Acting was not credible at all for everyone. The CGI was probably the only part worth watching.

So, in 500 years, we'll all still be driving petrol/diesel vehicles that look a lot like models seen on the road today. Despite fossil fuels being phased out now...Guns - well, a lot like those we have now, and seems somewhat unlikely the technology.of weaponry hasn't improved somewhat in 500 years.Incandescent light bulbs that are pretty much already phased out, and neon galore.Within a few minutes it fails to suspend your disbelief, but I persevered and watched another 20 minutes before I raised the acting, the script, and the entire premise doesn't offer any reprieve from the pit of crap you already found yourself in.And come on, Bruce Willis playing an action role? Still? Because when you run into an aggressive alien species, we're going to need a geriatric has been to save us all...I watch a lot of sci-fi, and I'm prepared to forgive a low budget production if the idea, the story, and/or the script have some merit. But there's nothing at all here to commend it. Nothing.

A pretty decent b-movie, ten years ago this was on the same quality level as many blockbuster. I think the score is so low because many had rated the movie for Willis, before knowing these were the last shots (as we found later, he cannot act properly due to sickness).Back to the movie, we could say it is not innovative in any way, but it contains many of the pattern we usually find in this kind of movies. The guy, the strong woman, the heroe, the bad enemy, the final monster, the good guy some died breaking everyone heart, the guy who had to sacrifice himself, and so on.But I think the special effects were pretty decent and with some good ideas (compared to the budget).So I wrote my minimum 600 chars to say: give the movie a chance and enjoy the last sparkle of a star.

I dind't make it very far. Right from the start wooden acting, cheap production/sets, poor dialogue...It's kinda like that Hercules TV show in terms of production, but with worse acting and story. Make a mental note, Bruce Willis = B Movie. Not sure if he has financial issues or what but he's obviously taking any job he can get.

reviews.review_title: They're just using him now, and he's letting it happen.
reviews.content: From when he was, a Hollywood star, to this. I remember a TV interviewer once saying to Michael Caine "Your last movie was bad" to which he replied "Yes, but the house I bought with the money I was paid was wonderful", I only hope your house is beautiful Bruce because you've certainly paid for it with your credibility.This film and your last film are really bad, there has to be alternatives to this for you.
I liked it. People are a little to overly critical of scifi. Good flick give it a shot. Glad to see Bruce back in this genre

This movie makes battlefield earth look inspired and artful.Yea I said it..This has no originality at all.the acting sucks.
the scriping/writing sucks
plot is BAD
production/effects/props are all horrible.
music and sound is forgettableI dont know why the robot in the bar was so well done for 10s of screen time but yea..had high hopes seeing this come up when I saw bruce and frank ( coming off a great sci-fi movie right before this)but sadly this is trash.GO WATCH Boss Level !! if you want sci-fi ( non space)

reviews.review_title: The lowest rating I've ever given (and I gave Barb Wire 3 stars!!!)
reviews.content: Fell asleep during the first twenty minutes the first two times I tried to watch it. Finally watched right through. The most entertaining thing about this movie is the IMDB and Rotten Tomatoes reviews! Avoid.
I think this was the worst movie I ever watched. 1.5 hours erased from my short lifetime, I really regret the time sacrificed for this movie.

It's horrible. Worst. Movie. Ever! Worst movie I have seen in ages. The script sucks. The acting sucks. The effects... yeah, they suck too. Whoever wrote and directed this movie probably won't be making movies for much longer, so that's cool.

reviews.review_title: You don't know what a 3/10 is...
reviews.content: ...until you've watched Hick TrekThis isn't great. It's a decent syfy movie.I've seen comments about the "money was spent only on actor's salaries" (The sets were well done) - "it's not futuristic" (There is no promise of plasma weapons in the future) - "12ft sniper rifles" (Don't exaggerate reviews) - "I want my six hundred and sixty six hours of my life back" (Everyone wants time back) - "I didn't watch more than the opening credits".This movie doesn't deserve the hate or 2.5/10 rating. The absolute lowest it should be at is 4/10. It's watchable, at least one time.These 1/10 reviews are dismissible. I'm giving this a 10/10 strictly because the ratings seem to be made up of people who don't actually rate movies based on what the film offers.I'd give this a 6/10. It's good enough to make me watch it again.If you want to see a move that is less than three stars, go watch the worst of Troma's home video releases.No this isn't a masterpiece, I'd argue it's better than The Hudson Hawk, which I can't bring myself to sit through again.

I don't even know where to begin. We're the actors even in the movie. Did they just sit in 2 rooms and speak lines into a mic as if they were annoyed to be getting a pay check. The amount of poor video quality, props, poor directing because, what you have a-list celebrity telling you "it looks good to me". I mean I'm glad this was free on Netflix and I did not see it anywhere I had to waste anything more then time. I feel bad Netflix had to prolly pay money to get this gem for us the stream. To the 50 people that made money on the movie. Congrats, to the millions of us suckers who had to watch it. Chalk it up as a bad meal.

Getting a little short of cash, Bruce? Cosmic Turkey...
BREACH gobbles just as badly. I sincerely hope this wasn't part of a three picture deal. Please,,,, No More..
It pleases me to see that all of us humans can agree on something ❤
Everything. I mean EVERYTHING was bad. The effects were garbage, costumes were cheap, so many "wtf is going on" moments. Script was bad. This movie should not have been made.

reviews.review_title: How old were the children that made this?
reviews.content: I'm sorry, I'm going to give this three seconds of my time as it's wasted 30 minutes of mine before I had to give up on it. All over the place. I know there is a plot. But everything about this movie is, why? why, why!? Why is Bruce Willis in it? Was it his child producing it?

reviews.review_title: Jason X meets Riddick. Why not a Fifth Element 2?
reviews.content: The characters aren't relatable. Camera angles are terrible. I swear most action movies since the 2000's are solely based on getting the camera as close and shaky as possible to disorient the viewer.Creating convincing action scenes doesn't require CGI every time, all the time. Believe it or not, some of the most loved movies of all time had wide camera angles that didn't change every 0.3 seconds. Like Die Hard...Bruce Willis already did 5th Element. Unless you wanted to try to beat it, this is a waste of time. To involve him and make him the prime poster cover when really he's just a cameo most of the movie, is poor salesmanship. You would have been better to try a Fifth Element 2 than this Jason X meets Riddick.The directing was just awful, the lines were COMPLETELY unbelieveable from the start. The action was garbage mostly because of the terrible camera angles and frequent changes.I don't direct movies, but I know good ones from bad ones, and no offense to one of my fav actors Bruce Willis.... but this movie is not worth watching.

The opening scene had promise, it diverted from there.It seems an alien race that "reproduces" via a zombie virus (?) has decided to make its presence known to humans.I am an hour in and I still don't know any of the lead actor's names. I barely have a back story on any of them, maybe Bruce was married to the annoying Dr?! At this point I don't care who lives or dies. I am not sure what planet they are on, or what the deal is with the previous war. A Q-bomb is referred to constantly and talk of killing millions of humans in the past, but no explanation as to why or how or where apart from the preamble text in the opening scenes.I wanted the Dr to die the second she uttered her first lines, not sure if that was good acting or she just was so incredibly unbelievable as an educated physician.Its 500 years in the future and not much has changed bar some flying cars, and neon lights are all the rage. Obviously Elon Musk's intracranial interface must not have taken off, as they still appear to be using apple watches to communicate. Pity.I love a good sci-fi but this is not one.

reviews.review_title: It was A cosmic sin making this pile of cosmic poop.
reviews.content: I gave this pile of garbage a 'generous' two stars cos Brucey was starring in it. So I automatically assumed there would be lots of action, tongue-in-cheek humor, and silliness but there was none of the above in this bland vanilla movie. The money should've went to a better cause I E charities I automatically assumed there would be lots of action, tongue-in-cheek humor, and silliness but there was none of the above in this bland vanilla movie. The money should've went to a better cause I E charities. The production value was very very cheap and this was before I Wikipedia the movie. After I watched the movie I checked the movie budget which was $7 million but the production felt like it was on a $700,000 budget instead! The characters were as exciting seven day old puke. Tbh I can't remember much of the movie but I am not watching it again to understand it. I really don't care. Did watch another great movie called Odd Thomas. I will definitely be writing a favorable review on that movie. Ab Fab!Back to this POC.There were No laughs. No character building. Cheap production. Bad script. Bad everything.Please don't waste 95 mins like I did.I did watch it all the way through. Had to.I do hope the next Bruce Willis movie will be redeemed.Ciao.

reviews.review_title: My Gawd, Bruce has hit bottom...
reviews.content: ...and for a long time I thought he was really good in action movies...but now...???This one is supposed to be an alien war kinda movie, but it starts out with lame dialog and intentionally unfocused camera work...unfortunately that is the best of the movie. There is no build up at all, no back story, and apparently no script either, since all the characters seem to be winging it, dropping one liners into every scene in a lame attempt to make this outing interesting...it didn't work. Bruce, please get some better scripts and stories that have some substance...and action!!! You used to be a rising star, and Tears of the Sun was really good but...not now...

reviews.review_title: I watched this so you don't have to... where's my medal.
reviews.content:
Oh dear... this is what happens when careers die. Bruce Willis what the hell man. I would rather pull my finger nails off than sit through this mess of a movie. Every actor in this thing did it for the money and nothing else. It's just s#*t plain and simple. Why can't we give 0 scores. I am sci fi fan and could not tell what this is about. It's that much of a mess. Seen better special effects in old Dr Who eps from the 70s.
Avoid like the plague.

reviews.review_title: Cosmic Sin Vs Breach. Why the same movie?
reviews.content:
This review will be as sporadic as the this movies script.I love Bruce Willis. However, either his agent or Hollywood is trying to end his career. He still gave a solid performance, but the script was not put together well at all. Certain lines and scenes lead to nowhere. I mean, really, the sunglass scene with the kid and Dash? What was that? At least the sunglasses weren't on General Ryle like they were on Admiral Adams in Breach.SPEAKING OF
Breach vs Cosmic SinWas this Edward Drake's and Corey Large's attempt at redeeming themselves from Breach OR just another attempt to ruin Bruce's image.Same movie, swap out actors center around Bruce, and make another bad film. At least the F/X were a little bit better (and that's not saying much).So Bruce still plays the same role. Clay young becomes James Ford. Former Hard Charging Military Combat Officer reduced to drinking but still a bad arse.They swapped out Thomas Jane for Frank Grillo (without shades but same disposition) and gave them the same fate. AND I mean THE SAME FATE! Instead of giving Grillo a daughter, we gave him a relative in Braxton (Brandon Lee) to be over protective of and with reverse love interest with the Fiona. Swapped out Timothy Murphy for Costas Mandylor (with accents) and slightly different outcomes but still the SAME FATE. And we are ready to ... Not do much but the same as before.PLOTS: Okay slightly different plot where we in Breach mess up the earth (which we are doing now) vs Aliens coming to claim us and the earth/galaxy. BUT still based on Aliens able to inhabit human bodies. I get why in Breach, but what was the point in Cosmic Sin? They already have bodies. Again BAD Alien visuals. Okay Horrible. The Cosmic Sin Aliens were in plastic Priest outfits. And please explain to me why a highly advanced alien race chooses to charge into battle with sometimes swords and other times guns? This contradicts earlier when Dr. Lea points out, "they learned how to use our weapons in seconds"? UHM, they looked just like the ones they were firing later on.Again please make up your mind about the weapons. Bullets or Lasers (same issue in Breach)?Noticeable mention/shout out. I carried a SAW in the military, and to see CJ PERRY (AKA LANA) one-handed carry around that cannon laser made question if i ever lifted a weight in my life. She was a beast.Scene transistion:
When Ford went to the armory to get a weapon at the beginning of the movie, how did he end up with NOT what he grabbed in the next scene when he uses it? He grabbed big laser rifle but instead showed up in the following scene shooting what looked like a Rocket Launcher when he took out the initial invading force on the base? Not even going to get into the scene where he is escorted into a cave with the cast of Cirque Du Soleil at the entrance. Tell me why the one alien is one arm and foot hanging on the tree? Where the hell did Braxton come from? Oh and what was that fight scene about between Braxton and the Alien?It's as though the directors did not care about the set, yet again. We are five centuries in the future using quantum physics to transport people hundreds of thousands of light-years away, yet we are still showing 600-year-old technology in the form of combustible engine pick-up trucks. Couldn't borrow some vehicles from Elon? Oh, let's not forget the motorcycle. But yet we have scenes of flying cars in the skyline one scene then a freeway with old vehicles the next. Speaking of transporting. Those "space suits" are able to allow you to survive in outer space without any form of Oxygen tanks (must be that 500 year new tech) And allow you to zoom through outer space, re enter another planets atmosphere not burn up and LAND the perfect landing that would make any gymnast blush but not correct when you bump into your fellow soldier? This was a mess.. Clearly they haven't read recent headlines FC has already happened according to the US Airforce.

I've rated over two thousand movies. Out of those two thousand, I've only rated five that are either a 2 or a 1. 'Cosmic Sin' is one of those five. It's a cosmic level sin in the world of movies that this was even made. The effects, the acting, it's just all very very bad. Even 'Battlefield Earth' got a 3 from me, that says a lot.However, the biggest sin that was committed was straight up plagiarism. 'Halo' is my favourite franchise when it comes to movies or games. This movie was a copy cat in many ways, from the look of their armour suites, slipspace travel, and overall whole setup. In 'Halo' they encounter the alien threat in the year 2525, after years of military government fighting rebels or insurrections in their outer colonies. And wouldn't you know it, in 'Cosmic Sin' they have first contact in 2526 after years of fighting rebels.Bruce and Frank... you two do not need to do this. Please don't sink to these levels, you're better than that. Bruce may be a little washed up these days as he's done far too many of these types of movies in recent years. But Frank... I just watched 'Boss Level' which came out this year, and it was great! Do more of that, not this.

So dudes, like there's aliens dude. We don't know what they want but lets like kill them dude. OK, how, we're not sure, we will edit some scenes together and then boom they will die. But what is their motive? No motive. They just want to kill. How do we know? We don't but Bruce Willis and Frank say so, so it must be true.What a horrible piece of trash this movie was. No plot, no characters, no anything. Made Michael Bay and Jerry Bruckheimer look worthy of an Oscar.Do not watch this, ever!

This show has a few great actor's in it, so I was expecting something reasonable. It's very confusing and the story is disjointed.It's boring, slow and really bad.I absolutely love Brice Wiillis
and we are seriously thinking about turning it off 30 min in.

How is there a legend (Willis) and a upcoming star that's on fire (Grillo)... I feel like this should have starrred Nicholas cage And Andrew Garfield... The acting is sub par only to be out done by the science jargon they are obviously making up... This movie belongs on scifi channel in the nineties.

I didn't watch the entire movie. I just couldn't take it anymore. Really bad plot with a lot of information thrown in at the beginning. It's movies like this that make second guess my Netflix subscription. Bruce, you can choose better movies to be in.

Sorry no spoilers, the cast and crew were responsible for that.The year is 2524. We have cars. As in infernal combustion engine driven cars. We have guns. And...We still have Bruce. This guy just doesn't know when to quit. What? Another part shot in a day?This all just results in someone asking, Really...?Bruce! Retire.......!

reviews.review_title: Great movie to fall asleep to!!
reviews.content: Proves that Hollywood makes movies like these to write-off on taxes! From the first minute in, it was obvious it was gonna be a piece of s**t .
What's happening that Wills have been accepting to do such bad and low budget movies?

reviews.review_title: Was this written by a 10 year old?
reviews.content: Seriously wanted to like this, I like Bruce Willis,I like sci-fi, even b-grade stuff ....but this literally feels like someone tried to make a movie from a ten year old's poorly written homemade comic book. Everything is just cobbled together pieces of dead horses that were beaten apart years ago and half the dialogue and concepts seem outright random and senseless. Also they should have called this "Tachyon Interference" since it's said so many times; apparently that was the only science term the writers knew?

reviews.review_title: I can only assume this is some kind of tax write off
reviews.content: It's not even a nonsense plot. It's no plot at all. Terrible acting. Abysmal script. Special effects that look like they were done for a 1990s computer game. Sound mix all over the place so you can't hear half the dialogue (which is a blessing in this case). Music composed by someone who was watching a different movie. Costumes leftover from a Buzz Lightyear cosplay convention. Locations scouted from a 1980s episode of Doctor Who. I bet even the on set catering was dreadful. The only good thing about this movie is that it's fairly short.

reviews.review_title: It was a Cosmic Sin" green lighting this movie!
reviews.content:
"Cosmic Sin" is not the Original Sin, but green lighting this movie was.
Here's what the makers of this movie would like to tell you:
Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo star in the new epic sci-fi adventure set in the year 2524, four hundred years after humans started colonising the outer planets.
Retired Military General James Ford (Willis) is called back into service after soldiers on a remote planet are attacked by a hostile alien fleet.
The threat against the human race escalates into an inevitable interstellar war. General Ford teams up with General Eron Ryle (Grillo) and a team of elite soldiers in a race to stop the imminent attack before it is too late.Now heres the truth: This is the biggest sack of doggy doo to ever make it to the big screen with name stars like Bruce and Frank.
These guys are just phoning in their performances from another galaxy that doesn't even have 5G.
Their pay checks are only boosting their Superannuation funds and not helping the cause of cinema one bit.
I'm a big Willis and Grillo fan, but guys you should be ashamed.
Instead see Grillo in "Boss Level" that's a fun SciFi movie with a sharp sense of humour and remember Bruce from his Die Hard days.
"Cosmic Sin" director and writer, Edward Drake should also be ashamed.
Rotten Tomatoes are having a field day with his gem.
I believe this is his directorial debut on a major motion picture and mainly hired for his writing, which on this occasion is one of the lamest scripts I've ever heard uttered on the big screen.
Did they not do a table reading before shooting?
The movie was also co-written by Producer, Corey Large, who handles the sidekick role of Dash on screen.
Sidekicks are meant to be funny.
At one point this sexist pig of a character points to a female soldiers' huge phallus type gun and says, "Candle you handle that?"
To which she replies (cutting him off at the knees figuratively), "I've had bigger!"
It's supposed to be an Action, Sci Fi, Mystery And Thriller, but it's NOT!
The movie riffs off StarGate science and technology and the space armour is clearly spray painted plastic and awkward.
Bathroom time would be a challenge.
The film features a cosmic cannon which would have been better used to shoot this movie into outer space where it can become the Space Junk it was truly meant to be.
I wanted to walk out, but it was 90 minutes in air-conditioned comfort during a stinking hot March day in Queensland, Australia and besides I had a good supply of popcorn and drink and was curious to see if it could get better.
It didn't!
Launch your own preemptive strike and save your money for some really good films from this genre coming soon to a cinema near you like "Godzilla vs Kong".
I only gave this movie ONE star, because the rating system doesn't go to zero!
Worst movie for 2021....so far!
I know I shouldn't hold back, I should tell you what I'm really thinking, but swearing isn't good form in a movie review.

reviews.review_title: What's going on with Bruce willis?
reviews.content: I normaly love Bruce willis movies, but the least years he made on trash movie after the other. I don't know what is going on with Bruce willis, I am not in his head, but especially in this movie he looks so uninteressant, no desire to act and apathetic. I hope he is not depressed, cause he kinda looks like in the last movies, like he doesn't want to be in the movie, I like Bruce but I find it awful to watch him in the movies. The movie was really not good in my opinion.

Every cliche in the book. I think this was written by a 10 year old whose dad is a movie producer that gave him something to do to keep him out of his hair. After watching Kingdom with Frank Grillo as the lead and excellent in the role, I was intrigued. I guess he and Bruce Willis either lost a bet or came up short on child support and needed quick money. Count how many times you hear quantum or tachyon. You might make if further than I did.

First, I saw Bruce and I was like, WOOHOO another alike awesome movie like Armageddon!Soon, I was like, WHAT!?I mean literately like WHAT?!Like WHAT, the Q bomb is made with a wood screw?!Like WHAT, you can flight in outer space but your suite is not a fully enclosed suite?Like WHAT, you can fall in atmosphere without burning like an meteorite?You, know, WHAT???That is exactly this movie.

Hopefully I can save some people some time here. Don't bother. Completely disjointed, terribly scripted and there are multiple scenes that go on and on, when they should have been left on the cutting room floor. Feels like Bruce Willis got roped into this as a favor for someone.Terrible movie.

This could have been a decent movie in competent hands.
The idea was reasonable, but the acting and script were atrocious.Don't waste your time watching it.

reviews.review_title: The idea wasn't bad but everything else was.
reviews.content: There should be quality control for movies so this kind of crap won't be allowed release to the public.

reviews.review_title: This might be his worst piece of trash to date.
reviews.content: What happened to Bruce Willis? Never again will I click on a random BW Netflix movie. Hey Netflix.... Bruce Campbell belonged in this one.

Yes it's B grade but I only watched this film due to the bad reviews, to see how stupid it is.It's actually not that bad. Starts off actually pretty good and yeah there are some stupid things (Like in the future and drive the same cars).Also the acting is a little off.The special effects are not the best, but what do you expect.(Its low budget).

You get actors such as Clint Eastwood, al Pacino, Robert deniro etc who have all carried in and chose food films to be in. Bruce Willis why oh why has he jus t fine from bad to worse shame on you taking an easy buck. And a career now that is dead.

It is like someone took an episode of the Outer Limits and tried to stretch it to a film, but missed out some big chunks of exposition on the way. Also something either went massively wrong with the writing, or editing, as characters leave and enter the story at random and not just as a result of the chopped up timeline.

Actors trying to do their best. That are the two stars. But actors can not fight such a senseless plot, mostly bad effects, absurd costumes.Year 2500, and humanity still uses assault riffles against zombies and Freddy Krueger talking rattlesnake-language. There are so many scenes where you just think "?????". And others on which you wish fast forward.

reviews.review_title: Don't believe the hate - Good Scifi movie
reviews.content: Seems to be alot of hate for Bruce Willis - as this and last move 'Breach' had bad reviews.Yet both i found good Scifi movies. Story, acting, and sets good to great.Maybe people expect something original in 2021? Or compare to Bruces older movies. Whatever grab the popcorn and enjoy!!Really i found this movie made my Friday night - And makes you think what if we're not alone and not friendly?

I saw "Cosmic Sin", starring Frank Grillo-the Purge movies, Captain America:The Winter Soldier; Bruce Willis-Breach, Glass; Costas Mandylor-Born Champion, the Saw movies and Perrey Reeves-Old School, Child's Play 3.
This is a bad 'B' sci_fi movie with Bruce Willis getting second billing-you know there is something wrong there. He just recently made another cheap sci_fi movie, Breach, so I guess he must like them-either that or maybe he owes somebody money or a favor. Anyway, this one takes place in 2524, when the earth has colonized some other planets, some of which were inhabited. Bruce was a war hero-he killed a bunch of aliens-but some people didn't like the way he did it, so he was discharged unceremoniously. Some aliens attack a group of earth people on a remote survey planet and Frank-a general-calls in Bruce to do what Bruce likes doing; putting the aliens in their place. Costas is a Sargent in the squad that is assembled and Perrey is a doctor/former love interest to Bruce. Some of the story is a little jumbled and hard to make sense of at times-the aliens are wearing long blazers with hoodies to probably hide the low budget. There are even times when it's hard to tell exactly who the good guys are-the humans or the aliens. Of course, that might have been the producers objective in the first place; to have a debate on war.
It's rated "R" for violence and language and has a running time of 1 hour & 28 minutes.
