I like bad movies-at times-but they do need a coherent storyline, at least. I wouldn't buy this on DVD. I wouldn't rent it either. If you really want to see it, I would wait until it shows up on cable.

reviews.review_title: So bad we stopped watching midway
reviews.content: Why is Bruce Willis in this appalling B grade movie?

reviews.review_title: Absolutely nonsense and garbage but I loved it
reviews.content: Bruce Willis what even is this???? Literally one of the worst movies I have ever seen, it got so bad to a point that I thought I personally could make a better movie with an old camera I have, the acting is stupid and unbelievable, the year is in the 2500s but there's almost nothing to indicate any progression from today's world?? I thought sci fi movies are supposed to be a bit creative in that sense but this one what just ridiculously stupid, you could see the crew in weird shots sometimes and this whole thing just feels like a money laundering scheme it CANNOT be a seriously made movie, but it's fun to watch cuz they make so many ridiculous mistakes in the storyline too, it feels like a 5 year old wrote it!

Love the idea of the movie, which why I watched it. Saw Bruce Willie in trailer, "can't be bad". Didn't look up reviews, it was bad. I have never written a review until now. I don't know how many movies ive seen. I honestly think that I can write a script/shoot the idea of this movie better, and I suck at most everything in life.

reviews.review_title: Woah, I really didn't expect a Bruce Willis film to be this portly done
reviews.content: Geez, I'm really surprised how poorly executed this film was. Bruce Willis usually does much better stuff. Some cool big budget CGI though, but doesn't make up for poor scripting, goofs and continuity fails in the first 30 minutes (before I gave up). I love dodgy b-grade sci-fi (even low scoring ones) usually, but this is too bad.I think the kicker for me was being hundreds of years in the future but the roads being filled with petrol cars and trucks from the 90s. I mean really, someone driving a 300 year old petrol pick-up truck as a daily drive. Nope. It would be in a museum.I could go on, but no need. I wish I had bothered to look at these IMDb reviews before losing 30 minutes of my life. Lesson learned. Trust IMDb users scores people!
What is Bruce Willis broke to do such bad film ,the worst ever 👎

reviews.review_title: Why do we think everything has a message
reviews.content: I have seen far worse movies with higher ratings. Bruce Willis played exactly the part they wanted and he may have had to fulfill a contract so he made this. If it wasanyone but Willis, it would have a higher score but the prejudice here is obvious. Is it a good movie? No it isn't, but it is not that bad. I think it will do better on Netflix than anywhere else and I like Willis. Critics will take the opportunity to slam him and the movie, but critics mean very little to action movie watchers.

reviews.review_title: When old actors prostitute their name for money
reviews.content: This looked like the sort of cheap children's programmes that used to be on at tea time. The camera work looked like it was filmed on a camcorder. Each line was a cliche stolen from other films. The plot, well there wasn't one. The so called aliens wore hooded uniforms and thus no money needed for fancy makeup. Bruce, what has become of your integrity? Did you get a tax bill and have to find money fast, so popped in to film this rubbish. I'm guessing it took about a day and a half to film the entire thing, so a quick buck for you. It was almost awful enough to be funny. Was this film made as a joke? Because just watched it and I don't get the punchline.
It's just poorly directed. The movie itself is quite good. Nice space armor and good visuals. Good cast. Good characters. It's a bit B-grade but so what it didn't cost $100M did it.

This was a b movie. Bruce Willis must have need some money. His character was a throw away character. The aliens? Are they parasitic or are they aliens? This movie is all over the place.Also. They don't know what a "kill box" is.

reviews.review_title: It makes a much sense as a harmonica in an echo chamber
reviews.content: Disjointed storyline is not interesting.Lame dialog is lame.Physics fantasy coupled with very unrealistic soldiers is so disappointing.
Where to begin? Sloppy writing. Amateurish CGI in spots, a mostly incomprehensible ending, phone in performances.... skip it, folks, look for something better.

Come on- Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo in a futuristic, Sc-Fi invasion film. What do you expect? Bad, but in a good and watchable way. Decent special effects. Mediocre supporting cast. Passed the time.

Let me say, I often love low budget sci-fi and fantasy movies. I have done since the 80s, but it's usually when you can see passion and effort put into something, even if it's rough around the edges.What makes me not only disappointed but a little sad about movies like Cosmic Sin, is that you can tell most of the people behind it simply didn't care. It's either so cheap that with a name like Bruce Willis it becomes profitable regardless of effort, or it's some kind of tax write-off.Of all the amateur writers and film-makers out there, I'm sure they could have found someone looking for an opportunity to make the best of a low-budget, and see it as an opportunity to make the best small movie they can. The resources are there... A few of the actors in Cosmic Sin are actually not bad, and known from other TV shows and small movie parts, and some of the visual effects actually aren't bad, so it's a shame to see the talents and skills of those people wasted on this dire effort. I suppose at least a couple of the effects people will have something half-decent for their showreel...The scriptwriter/s, director and editor/s should frankly be ashamed of themselves. A low budget does _not_ have to mean a bad film (not this bad, anyway), and when you have an opportunity and squander it like this, you should do the honourable thing and find a new career. Or at the very least step back, take a long hard look at your work and then take the time to do something you can have even a little pride in before churning out something like this.
Nicola Cage don't worry.... Bruce Willis is following your steps.

reviews.review_title: Wahahaha Bruce is taking on anything these days!
reviews.content: Bruce is becoming Steven Seagal, he's got bills to pay and it shows in his acting nowadays! The passion is gone but as long as i can get paid, who cares (attitude)! Give it a miss, its terrible from start to 10 minutes in (is all i could handle)!

reviews.review_title: "All of our shots are lucky shots...."
reviews.content: I tried watching this. I really did. That woman doctor at the beginning with the dreadful lines and crap acting set the tone for the rest of the movie. Cool idea poorly executed rubbish script...

reviews.review_title: It was a cosmic sin to make this movie
reviews.content:
500 years in the future and they are driving cards and shooting regular guns. And that might be the most logical thing about the movie. The acting was atrocious. The writing horrific and the plot made zero sense.
Just say no
Boring Crap with a Boring Crap bruce Willis, usual bruce Willis Boring Crap then!About time you give it up bruce your a has been.

reviews.review_title: C'mon, this was probably the worst 20 minutes of absolute chaos...
reviews.content: I'm usually giving a chance to any movie, but this was just an utter mess, and till now wondering, why Bruce Willis or Frank Grillo, think themselves, yes, this sound really cool, let's do this, but after a flying through asteroids, battle ships, explosions in space just in space suits, I just switch it off. So many things going on in those 20 minutes that you don't really know, what or why, proper mess, so don't bother
This is not a movie you would expect Bruce Willis to be In ! It's dire , it doesn't even sound like his voice , I'm off to watch my paint dry !
Script, acting, everything was just bad. Not even Bruce Willis could make it better. He must have owed someone money or a huge favor.

What a waste of a good idea.On the whole this is a good story line, the trouble is they didn't spend enough time and money on it.As many critics have said, The film is based 400 years in the future yet they still use petrol cars and gunpowder powered bullets.I would only recommend watching this film if you want to see just how bad it really is.

reviews.review_title: Power Rangers TV Quality DVD Movie - In Theaters...
reviews.content: This is a SABAN film, whose most famous property is all the Power Rangers shows. And this is straight up literally a power rangers TV quality movie. TV quality costumes, special fx and makeup, cosplay EVA foam "space armor" straight out of Comicon cosplay. But even more than that, the "alien bad guys" are straight ripped from a Power Ranger TV episode. This should have been a direct to DVD movie, but I can only imagine during the pandemic lockdown they were like, "hey, there's no competition, so let's put it theaters, why not". Even for Bruce Willis who has been doing straight to DVD work for years, this was beneath him. I'm really surprised Grillo and Willis attached themselves to this, although their parts were relatively small in the grand scheme. To be completely honest, I went to see this mistaking it for "Breach", starring Willis and Thomas Jane, which I will still see and hope is better.

I am a fan of B grade sci fi but this caught me by surprise like farting and realising it's not a fart. The biggest sin here is the directing. I cannot believe someone actually funded this project let alone let it be published. This is one of those movies that can end a career it is that bad. Bruce Willis is in it yes.. but I was sure he could act ? Right ? And then there are a few B grade actors as well as some who look like other actors. The scripting was perhaps the worst I have ever seen. They clearly had a budget so why not make a half decent movie ? This is fighting for top ten of worst movies ever watched and I only let it get to the end to see what happened and even then I regret it. Watch at your own peril.

reviews.review_title: It's a Sin alrighty... But not quite Cosmic...
reviews.content: It's a typical American, aliens are bad guys movie. Despite having the acting God, Bruce Willis, and a smattering of other named actors it was still stereotype blah. If you ok to just waste some time watch it, but if you've got other things to do, like clean the gutters, etc. Then it's time you won't get back.

reviews.review_title: So bad it's good, except it's not
reviews.content: This stinker is going to walk The Razzies.It looks as if all the worst Sci-fi films ever were cut into 10sec lengths, mixed in a tumble dryer and randomly stuck together.Incomprehensible plot, costumes rented from the local fancy dress, acting as wooden as the forest that much of it has been filmed in, Bruce sleepwalks through this nightmare on Mogadon.Surely he does not need the money this bad and even if he does he could do something less humiliating, TV Adverts for feminine hygiene products or pills to help mens' bedroom difficulties perhaps.It gets two stars because ,mercifully, it's only 88 minutes long.
This movie should be erased. Horrible from beginning to end. I shouldnt even make it on the rating board.

I had high hopes for this movie when I read who the lead actors where. But sadly, the star power didn't translate to a good movie. Bruce Willis should get himself a better agent and stop acting in B-grade movies like this. If he's not careful, he'll follow in the footsteps of Nicholas Cage and Steven Seagal.The movie started out well enough. It built tension and had a unique story - First contact with an alien species. But it went sideways from there. The movie for me had too many holes in the plot. I didn't like the slow-fast-slow-fast-slow pace of the movie. The director for some reason, like to cut into looooong meaningless dialogue that just slowed down the pace of the narrative. If the purpose of these slow parts was to build backstory for the characters, well it didn't work. It was just annoying. I found myself yelling at the screen "...get a move on already..."SUMMARY: Too many holes in the plot and the narrative, lack-lustre at best. The aliens where 2-dimensional. They were there just to serve just as the enemy. Not much is shown about them.RECOMMENDED? No.
Truly and I mean truly do not waste any money on this dribble.

reviews.review_title: If I could give zero stars......
reviews.content: I'm happy to watch quite bad films but never seen anything as utterly awful as this. If you read this before watching, take head and watch something else, anything else! Really. I'm not kidding.

I created an account just to write this review so I could warn people not to watch it. It is the worst film I've ever seen (well I got about 45mins in then switched off!).The acting is lame, but it's more the plot and directing, it's just an absolute mess. It's like 5 directors that have never directed before and no nothing about directing were brought in as the previous kept dying through the making, then the new director didn't bother finding out what the film was about and where they were up to, and just did their own thing...then died!And the writers were a bunch of school kids, and nit even clever ones, stupid kids that were bottom of the class.The only positive is that I ended the film early so I could go to the toilet and have a dump which I desperately needed, and that's what the film was...DUMP!

reviews.review_title: Makes you wonder what could have been
reviews.content:
A strong opening act shows cracks that eventually become chasms of mediocrity. The concept is quite good and really feels like the sort of thing you dreamed up in your nerd-driven fantasy of what could happen in a cool sci-fi storyline, but when the budget gets you Bruce "Anything for a Buck" Willis and a bunch of special effects worthy of mid-90s SyFy TV shows, you end up feeling like you've just been lied to. Frank Grillo gets top billing but is on screen for about 5 minutes.
Mid to late movie direction is particularly poor, as you sometimes enter the zone of "spooky ghostly characters in the dark" and dudes in plastic outfits that bear no resemblance or relation to the interesting type of antagonist encountered in the first act.The redeeming quality is that it makes you think about what a cool story this could have been if it had a giant budget. It could have been longer, more fleshed out, and not look like half the movie takes place in a garage.

Why was this made, I have no idea what was going on the entire movie. I tried to like it but holy hell this movie came with a shovel. Every time I thought something couldn't get worse, this movie somehow kept getting under a bar that I thought couldn't get lower.There is nothing to gain from watching this... "Movie" aside from intense feelings of disappointment and maybe a little anger.

The script is c Grade. Good cast but the direction is clearly off. Conceptially also full of holes. It's a pity that great trailers don't deliver on the full product. The first shoot out seen between aliens and main cast is laughable... Nobody is ducking bullets in full dialogue scene through in a bullet zinging scene. Aliens are in full view and nobody can hit them 40 feet away. Seriously... Do they think the audience is that ignorant. Clearly yes. Had to switch off after that scene.

reviews.review_title: No world building at all, thats truly a sin
reviews.content:
Why is this movie set 500 years in the future when everything looks the same as right now??If you look back 500 years in the past everything was different, even 20years ago the world totally looked different.
The have some weird exo-skeleton armor, but it doesnt need leg support for osme reason? It can with stand the vacuum of outer space, but a single shot penetrates the armor. All in all there doesnt seem to be rhyme nor reason, nor logic. Its really terrible.

reviews.review_title: End this Movie before it starts.
reviews.content:
And go do something, anything else.
This movie is bad and Bruce Willis should feel bad.

reviews.review_title: Did Bruce Willis lose a bet or something?
reviews.content: This came on as a suggestion after a "Movies That Made Us" episode about "Die Hard". What a stark difference! This movie is terrible in every conceivable way.

If someone can seriously explain to me what was it about, why was there Bruce Willis and how it ended I will raise my rating to 2 stars ... From the first 5 minutes I knew it will be super crap but it was even worse.

reviews.review_title: You know how when you say a movie is bad someone will ask if you can do better?
reviews.content: If they're asking in relation to this movie you can rest assured that you can indeed do better.This movie could be used in university classes on film making on what not to do. The script is terrible. The setting is terrible (it's set hundreds of years in the future but everything on Earth looks like the year it was filmed). Frank Grillo was the big sell of this movie but he's in it for about 5 minutes. Bruce Willis seems to have decided to not even bother phoning it in anymore.The only good thing I can say about this movie is that its run time is under 90 minutes.

reviews.review_title: B rated Movie at best. Demonizing alien life forms.
reviews.content: Well here we go again demonizing alien lifeforms. Intelligent lifeforms that have the science and technology to travel billions of lightyears and live without dying can also build a dead planet into a living breathing earth. Aliens with that much technology does not need to go around fighting or attacking anyone for anything, they can go anywhere in the known universe because it is vast. Seriously the galaxies are numerous to the point that you can get lost in them with a telescope in one location if you looked far enough and straight enough you would be amazed how many hundreds of millions of planets you can see just from one angle. Yet we still demonize intelligent lifeforms like they are human? We do the same for God, We humanize God by calling God a "He". Humanity is not ready yet! Still an immature infantile without any common sense with ignorance from here to pluto. This movie proves it. The 4 stars goes to Bruce Willis and the Camera Man!

This is probably the worst POS I have ever seen. The whole time I am seating watching this trash, all I was saying to myself was, wtf is this trash. Nothing about this make any sense at all. How the hell this got the green light? This got the Razzies smell all over it. Why Bruce took part of this garbage, I guess we'll never know.

reviews.review_title: This movie would be so much better without Bruce W...
reviews.content: ... and it would still be absolutetly horrible. Bruce is totally irrelevant actor nowadays. This movie offers absolutetly NOTHING, and 10 out of 10 times I would rather go for a walk than watch this POS.
I favorite part was the ending and I could go to the bathroom to pee.

In the past nonsense like this would be hidden on the dusty back shelf of a video store to be seen by only the brave or stupid few. Today it is on streaming services for all to see. Wonder how many careers have failed because of this. Bruce, hang your head in shame and me for watching this "movie". I have read what the film is meant to be about, but still can't really fathom it. Petrol cars, hand guns, worst space suits I have seen, bomb that looks like it came from an old valve radio, acting that all should be ashamed of. They are all the things to be looking forward to if you pluck up the courage to watch this travesty. I think I would have more entertainment cutting a space rocket from the back of a cereal box and playing with that.

You see, if most of us screwed up this bad doing what we do to get paid, we'd be out of a job. But the jokers who somehow conned their way in to funding this project and hiring the worst teams of writers, producers, editors and actors (with a couple exceptions) will be allowed to continue working in show business. After that ridiculous decontamination scene, I knew this was movie was a mistake. Stopped watching after 45 minutes. For what this movie cost, it could have paid for a couple episodes of real sci-fi entertainment in the caliber of Dark Matter, The Expanse and Firefly. So in summary, booooooo...you guys suck. Find a different career and stop making movies.
Better than Battlefield Earth which I gave one star but not by much. Filmed almost entirely in space with heavy CGI and clunky space suits. Like Armageddon without the asteroid.
Bruce is barely in this movie.. don't blame it on him. I'm not sure if the director is terrible, or the writers here, or both.. probably both. I wouldn't suggest watching this.

reviews.review_title: A must see movie - or else you'd never believe how truly bad it is.
reviews.content: We had hoped this would be so bad it's good, but no. Every single element from the script to the acting to the lines - painfully cringe worthy awful.Did Bruce lose a bet or something?My wife just told me she wants a personal apology from him for subjecting her to this.Fortunately, after watching this we can now both start collecting disability as we've said goodbye to countless brain cells.

reviews.review_title: I ground my teeth for the entire movie, now I need dentures.
reviews.content: This movie was a grueling experience. Bad acting, bad dialog. I watched because of Bruce Willis, but his performance was underwhelming. He was there, just to bring in viewers and nothing else.Funny how it was supposed to be set in the year 2524, but yet on earth, modern era motorcycles and cars can be seen. Many scenes, it appears that actors were taken of the streets in their original closes, slapped on some plastic armor and started filming. At every turn, there was something noticeable, and made it very difficult to sit through.

Bruce Willis was one of my favorite Action stars and he turns more and more into a joke. Most of his films lately are pure garbage and Cosmic Sin is a perfect example for that. I don't mind watching B movies, sometime you can discover a hidden masterpiece. However, Comisc Sin is the opposite to that. Cosmic Sin is among the worst films, I have ever seen so far.

reviews.review_title: I knew it was really bad, but curious still
reviews.content: The acting, effects etc is really really bad. I already knew this. With that said, I was still curious on Bruce Willis part.He don't say or do so much throughout the movie, and I have all respect to that he have health problems. I read he stopped all movie making shortly after this movie due to early dementia problems. What I don't understand is why do this horrible bad movies !?? He have a solid stack of good action movies behind him, why let people remember him like this?I am also curious, how do they get financing for such bad crap? This can't possible break even?Well, the entire movie is a cosmic sin, that they got right 😊

reviews.review_title: A Cosmic Dud featuring a miserable Bruce Willis.
reviews.content: This might be the worst film of 2021....A non-sensical story, non-existent characters, cheap visual effects, lazy sound editing, inconsistent production designs, badly edited action scenes and a miserable, half-dead Bruce Willis sleepwalking into another pile of cinematic dirt with even less dignity and charisma than Steven Seagal.The plot involved something about space colonization and an army fleet of alien parasites from a distant planet that could wipe out humanity (how original), and Bruce Willis plays a retired general who's called back to help stop this threat (how exciting). I barely remember anything else about the plot but it doubt any of it was important. It was so lazily written that it might as well have been auto-generated by an Xbox 360.I don't know what anyone was doing or even thinking while they were making this lousy attempt of a film. Every single component of the film just seems so lazy and uninspired that its likely everyone involved was half asleep during the production process. From a technical standpoint its almost as bad as Snyder's Army of the Dead (I honestly don't understand the appeal). The film looks ugly in parts. Like AotD a lot of the background is out of focus, but here it appears to be an attempt to block the cheap production designs. The visual effects had the quality of a 10 year old episode of Doctor Who, and the sound editing was flat and lifeless. This is bad even by DTV standards.As for Bruce, what the heck has happened to him?! He looked tired and worn out, like a retired has-been who's desperate for money. There's one line of dialogue that summarizes Bruce's current state. When he puts on an exosuit and one of the characters say that it "belongs in a museum", he quips: "They said the same thing about me." And he's not wrong.Just stay retired Bruce, nobody wants to waste 90 minutes of their time for useless fodder like this.
Apparently we shouldn't let Bruce Willis make first contact!!

reviews.review_title: This is why tigers occasionally eat their young
reviews.content: Somebody lost a bet, somebody owed someone money, Bruce Willis confused his incredibly lucky career with actual smarts, a toilet flushes and you have Cosmic Sin. Being associated with this film should be a career ending injury. 12 Monkeys and the 5th Element never happened now.

Did the producers spend all their money on Bruce Willis? Because the production quality was extremely subpar.Most of the reviews here are spot on. This movie is filled with cliches, no clear direction, uninteresting acting, and terrible special effects.If you're a sci-fi fan looking for what to watch, there's so many movies to rewatch - pick one.

The premise was decent. Kill or be killed after FC. Use the most deadly weapon known to man to disable an alien world through a time portal. It falls down at times, seems rushed, and the conclusion screams of, "we ran out of money.". All that said, I've seen much much worse. The acting was palpable.
It's been a while since I saw a film so bad. Terrible acting all around. Even the cliches are rubbish. Plot is utter nonsense. Poor music. Avoid at all costs.

reviews.review_title: Even well know actors gotta eat
reviews.content: Despite the decent graphics and special effects, this was a waste of time. I found it disjointed and struggled to watch it to the end. Bruce Willis, if it really was him, mailed it in. Personally I think they used a body double including the voice.
Shame on you Netflix! Terrible! Bruce Willis should be ashamed of myself To need money that bad to make this crap!
Did anyone else have trouble finding any sensehow was this authorized lol.

reviews.review_title: Investors In This Project Were Clearly Duped
reviews.content: Although this film isn't quite as bad as Ariels (2016), it's a very close second. Cosmic Sin is director and co-writer Edward Drake's second production and makes it appear most of the budget likely went to the actors, such as Bruce Willis and maybe Drake, himself. The highly recognizable and capable talent pool is obviously there, but a poorly crafted script, almost nonexistent production values and bad direction makes everyone and everything appear utterly amateurish. The cinematography is OK, but there's minimal green screen usage. It's as if they intentionally spent absolutely as little as possible on sets and props; literally a shoe string budget. A minimalist approach would have likely been more impressive than this. Investors in this project were clearly gaslit by producers. I'm utterly amazed this project was ever green lighted in the first place.

Briefly, the prologue is the first indicator that the quality of the film is very low. Bruce Willis entrance is pathetic (why Bruce... Why?). Nothing makes really sense in this movie and I could not make it to the end. Sorry, nope, there is so much to watch out there that I am not giving any chance to products like this. Ridiculous.

reviews.review_title: Who thinks it a good idea to write and make this trash?
reviews.content: Wow I saw the bad reviews but went into this open minded as I like sci-fi movies of all types, but I can honestly say it is 100% terrible. I think it was suposed to be "clever" but it comes across as simply terrible.This is without a doubt one of teh worst films I have ever seen and I even love some "bad" movies! Save your time and money and really avoid this film at all costs.Its full of bad acting, badly delivered lines, one liners that simply dont work, poor story, slow and boring and pointless.

reviews.review_title: I have to delete my brain now
reviews.content: I have to erase this movie from my mind. I have to find some intergalactic cosmic gin. They should warn you to do that before you watch just five minutes of this psychological horror on film. Did Bruce Willis make a pact with the devil and now he has to pay the price by decimating his career? Or why does he hate himself so much?
This movie should be taken off the shelves, lowest budget futuristic attempt of a movie I have ever seen. Who goes to war with aliens in 2500 with regular bullets!!

The graphics are beautiful but the storyline and conversations of 'Cosmic Sin' are unfitting and out of line, to a point where you're wondering why a specific line is said or a scene is shown because it just does not make any sense. Without Grillo and Willis the whole movie would've been even weaker.Why they did it this way? Unknown. All I can think of as an explanation is that someone knew someone or that one of the (B-)actors or others involved in this movie had an idea or a wish and they hastily started filming instead of properly writing a good story with the result being a total waste while there was so much potential. I cannot rate lower than a 1 here on IMDB.
Looks like people are just trolling or someone some people are just trying to bomb the movie. Give it a go. You'll see one it starts its not as bad a they're all saying.

reviews.review_title: a film for MAGA people or Anti MAGA
reviews.content: This a middling political retelling of starship troopers. It is up to the viewer to decide if it is propaganda for or satire against hard right politics and populism.Except for so medium CGI special effects this is a paint by number zombie film.The scenes on earth are as though it is 2020 not 2054.A few good performances but this not going to be a highlight of anyone's career.

reviews.review_title: You Go In Thinking: There Has To Be Something Worthwhile In Here...
reviews.content:
There isn't...
One of the worst movies I've ever seen... And I like Sci-Fi, Bruce Willis, and even Frank Grillo...
I kept waiting for it to be some sort of self aware joke...
But no...
Horrible directing, horrible dialogue, cliche upon cliche...
Just don't!!!

This movie made me sad for several reasons.
I feel Bruce Willis will never be the action hero he once was.
I feel bad for my friends who have won major cosplay contests, not getting hired over the person who made the laughable armor.
I feel bad I don't play Warhammer anymore because the writer clearly just rolled up some characters as enemies.
And finally, I feel bad I can't get someone to give me a bunch of money to make movies because someone, somewhere gave this guy money to produce this awful, boring, sluggish movie.
Here's hoping the 6th grader who made the SFX at least got paid.

In the year 2524, four centuries after humans started colonizing the outer planets, retired Gen. James Ford gets called back into service after a hostile alien fleet attacks soldiers on a remote planet.The threat against mankind soon escalates into an interstellar war as Ford and a team of elite soldiers try to stop the imminent attack before it's too late.....Cosmic Sin is a very bizarre film, if you can call it that. It's terrible, don't get me wrong, but because of the recent news regarding Willis, I'm going to omit him from this review (he's barely in it, and his character serves nothing to the films narrative).What we get is a film about some people who get possessed by something and shoot black goo at other people, whom then become possessed. And this has something to do with other people dressed in black.It's as if the makers have filmed a lot of scenes, thrown them together, and just released it without nobody proof watching it for consistency and narrative flow.Frank Grillo is first billed, but he's hardly in it, and ends up in space, doing something that makes no sense at all. The same goes for Mandylor. He pops up in the first act, gets shot, and then he gets killed by one of his allies, because 'he was going to die anyway'.It's a seeing is believing film for sure, you have to see it because it makes no sense at all, and thats the reason why the film is terrible. Somewhere in this atrocity is a half decent film, begging to get out, but it's beyond comprehension, and it just finishes, and you are left agog, at what you have just experienced.Yep, it's a sin alright.
The playbill of the movie is more paced than the movie itself.

Don't waste your time on this trash ..I am a big fan of sci-fiction movies and i slept 4 times while watching this ..very bad acting..very bad story...very very bad scenario and very very very bad direction ...
There were so many people involved.How any of them did not ask: "This does not make any sense?"(Had to register an account on IMDB to warn you.)

I honestly had no idea what was happening the entire film. Mediocre SciFi CGI which kept me interested. Bruce Willis was typical Bruce. But Frank Grillo. I love that guy. To see his talents reduced to this. The suits were cheap and poorly done. Im not costume artist but I could tell these suits were made foam board. It's like they spent all the budget on CGI and thought 90's props and actors would fill the gap.

reviews.review_title: What an absolute joke! Don't bother
reviews.content: I get annoyed when I start to watch a movie and have that feeling I'm wasting my time. In the old days poor directors used darkness to add to the effects. These days it's moving the camera around incessantly to somehow add to the "realness". This alleged movie has garbage direction, has-been or no-named "actors" and a rubbish story. That's 45 minutes I'm not getting back! Glad I didn't pay for it; I'd be REALLY upset.

reviews.review_title: Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo can do much better.
reviews.content: The premise has been done in other horror sci -fi films that where much better than this, I'm sure we remember Aliens(1979), hardly anybody here grabs your interest, even the Bruce Willis character who looks barely awake through out most of this, looking like he hasn't slept since Glass(2019), appears he did this movie for a pay check, other than that he looks very bored through this whole thing.Now the effects are pretty descent, and Frank Grillo and Costas Mandylor seem to be only actors giving it there all, cause neither one appear to be sleepwalking through this, even though both probably know this film is gonna be bad, but glad to say the both where being professional. But the film seems edit down, not giving enough time for anything for the plot to evolve.
Production, acting, the "aliens", and the plot...pretty much overall was super lame. I'm disappointed in Bruce Willis for being in such a low quality movie.

reviews.review_title: Better than Breach but a wasted opportunity.
reviews.content: Set in 2524, the human race has began to colonising planets but after first contact with an alien race dire consequences ensue, forcing a disgraced solider back into service.Thankfully Cosmic Sin is more enjoyable than Breach Bruce Willis' previous sci-fi outing with director Edward Drake. Here he offers another low budget-feeling sci-fi action. The score, some sets, special effects are impressive but it's execution is a little stilted along with the script. That said, there's some breakout moments from the supporting cast, notably Costas Mandylor as frank talking Marcus Bleck.Boasting the likes of Frank Grillo and Willis, both actors are under-utilised. Cosmic Sin works well enough as an Aliens come Star Trek, even Ghosts of Mars derivative. That's said, it's reminiscent of a late 80s, early 90 direct to video science fictions, Nemesis, APEX, Terminal Force etc however, many made during that period were usually innovative, regrettably there's very little to write home about in the case of Cosmic Sin as it meanders from location to another, jumping from one scene to another. In between borrowing lines from other movies. At one point a character says, "This is crazy, I don't need this..." which is exactly how I felt watching. Viewers maybe left wondering how Drake managed to bag such talent on a seemingly lacklustre science fiction as Willis fires bullets into the infected.Overall, if this was made 25 years ago it may have been a VHS DTV hit but despite Drake's efforts and crisp visuals it sadly feels tired and worn.

The only sin here is the lack of any cohesive thought in writing producing and directing this awful movie. Sad to see good actors and actresses get handed a script of crap. There is.evidence that the writers may have read Starship Troopers by Robert A. Heinlein (GOAT of SciFi authors) and used his Nova bomb as describe in Starship Troopers 3: Marauder and Starship Troopers: Traitor of Mars; "There has been controversy on Earth over the use of the Q Bomb: Religious fanatics say that the Federation shouldn't decide what planet lives and dies; politicians don't bother; and military officials think that since the Bugs don't use a Q Bomb, why shouldn't they?" This sad movie attempts to be part HALO, part StarShip Troopers, part Astronaut's Wife, part I don't know what the Fubar. It rambles and stumbles it's way across the screen like an alien bug shot so full of plot holes that it's raining blood and bad lines till it finally collapses in a fit of flatulence, writhing on the theater floor, spilled popcorn and milk duds scattering in all directions, like sparks from a broken dynamo. The green screen, is cheep, the FX only add to the unrealism, there is no sense of immersiveness, and Bruce delivers his worst performance since Hudson Hawk. Spare your eyes and ears and move on from this cosmic cosplayed out weirdness.

reviews.review_title: Bruce how now out caged ' The Cage'
reviews.content: While Nick Cage still puts out some decent films ontop of the dead pile of bodies he also stars in every year. It seems Bruce has taken it upon himself to tear down the cages, sit on a lot of chairs and take the lead from 'The Cage'.Soon I'll have to send my sister another novelty pillow case, the last was nick cage many years back. Now a new pillow case will rise up and ruin her artsy nice house.

reviews.review_title: VIEWS ON FILM review of Cosmic Sin
reviews.content: "It takes a monster to kill a monster". Guess what. It takes a miracle to believe that 2021's Cosmic Sin would be viable, sci-fi fare. By the way, Neil Blomkamp called and says he wants his lauded integrity back.So yeah, "Sin" was released in March of this year (its title in India is actually Worthless Rip-Off). It's a direct-to-video flick that also poses as something you'd see on well, the Syfy channel. Cosmic Sin tries to be part Blade Runner, part Ghosts of Mars, part Elysium, and part Aliens. Sadly with its characters bickering back and forth like the Bickersons, "Sin" feels more like 2000's veritable bomb, Supernova.Cosmic Sin is poorly lit in a soft bulb sort of way. It also has action scenes that are choppily edited, actresses you feel sorry for (I'm talking about you Perrey Reeves), and a script that contains enough sci-fi mumbo jumbo to denounce any normal ritual. Bruce Willis stars in "Sin" and you know what that means. Aside from unloading a rifle, projecting his last shred of screen presence, and looking like Iron Man without full headgear, Brucie appears like he's in a coma with no chance of reverse stupor.Taking place in the year 2524 (that's random) and directed by Australian Edward Drake, Cosmic Sin is basically about Gen. James Ford (Bruce Willis) trying to stop a fleet of aliens that I guess look like humans. Willis doesn't do or say much but hey, he's Bruce "I used to be a beast" Willis. He probably got paid by the line (or any catatonic facial expression).Bottom line: Any way you cut it, I probably should've avoided watching Cosmic Sin. Its intentions are good considering but come on, it's more like "cosmic" debris (no pun intended for the late Frank Zappa). Forgive me for I have "sinned".

Giving a ten for Best Bad Reviews Of The Year. I had to watch it.I suspect this movie was meant as a comedy. I laughed till the end in disbelief.The script is non-descript, on a par with the dialogues. Insanely poor. Random editing spices it up. A special mention goes to Mega Boobs In Armor With Yellow Braids, but overall the promise falls flat.My guess is that the little girl popping out of nowhere is actually the illegitimate child Bruce had with the Queen of the aliens, which he meets in a cave, where they both get high. Refusing to pay alimony he decides to nuke 'em all for good measure, in typical BW fashion.I hope there will be a prequel.
Bad writing, bad directing, bad acting. Most of the budget was probably spent on Bruce Willis! No flow to the story and was cringe worthy. Don't bother.
Bruce - what the heck, bro? This movie is an ultra lame attempt at showing how a group of soldiers stop a galactic war. The fight scenes aren't even good.

In spite of the negative reception for this "gem", the visuals as seen in the promos intrigued me. And while being no masterpiece, the VFX in the film is actually pretty good for the story. This is the only reason this misfire gets a one-star rating out of five. Everything else is just... meh. It was hard to tell what stars like Frank Grillo and Bruce Willis were doing throughout the film. While Grillo delivers whenever he's on screen, Willis just doesn't seem interested. Also, while the film initially moves at a fast pace with some good action, it goes downhill the moment it tries to inject emotion through bland character conversations; not one of these scenes contribute to the plot and are merely a failed attempt. Even most of the action is dull. The second half is where it loses its only chance to end up a watchable film. Cosmic Sin is disappointing, and its poorly written plot could've been better if it was trimmed to a 1-hour TV film duration. Scenes to remove? Plenty.

Whilst Bruce's career is like a damaged satellite out in space, there may be moments of sparks but more often it is on a downward trajectory heading to crash land into the dark abyss.This is not the worst entry to date but it is sad to watch a once Hollywood A Lister descends into less than B Movie star.Anyway this Martian film has a basic storyline that is very predictable. It delivers what it set out to do. It reminds me of Armageddon (when Bruce Willis was at his peak of Hollywood stardom) & Mission to Mars. This is a personification of a Alzheimer's disease in film form in that is tragic & it will soon be forgotten but for the right reasons: it adds nothing to this genre of films & the idea that aliens are all evil is so generic. The scenes in which Bruce Willis sits at the bar hits hard as it juxtaposed the idea of character procastinating their time on drinks & how Bruce is now wasting our time on things he must signed in on for the paychecks!

reviews.review_title: Cheap crap.... a Willis pay day
reviews.content: How much alimony does Demi Moore need?Interesting premise, terrible execution. Don't waste your time.

I am only writing to warn others to avoid this. It's a mess. I just don't know where to start. Set 500 years away and the props seem to be left over from a low budget 80's sci fi tv show. Story line is messy. Characters don't gel and all over the place. Soldiers travel 13,000 light years into battle with a glock??? I could go on but I want to wipe this show from my memory ASAP and just get he message out - just don't.

Why is Bruce Willis still working? Especially on these dodgy sci fi flicks. Sure, I'm still watching them so maybe that answers that but I mean the guy is worth 250 million dollars! How much did Demi Moore get in the divorce?! I can't remember anything from this movie and I only just finished watching it. It was a sin just watching this.
I can't describe how bad this movie is. I mean you won't feel sadness during emotional scene and it is also hard to tell who is true and who isn't.

reviews.review_title: Wow this is how low they have sunk
reviews.content: I can't believe this, Bruce Willis from so much fame to this piece of junk.I know that Frank Grillo made some bad movies but he is also an excellent actor.This movie looks super cheap from the set to the way its shot.... wondering if the whole thing is a joke... with bad dialogues.
I was excited by the premise of this movie and extremely disappointed by the execution. Seemed disjointed, context was lacking, script was so odd at times...
The acting was terrible the story was even worse. With actors like Frank grillo and Bruce Willis behind this I had hope but 20 minutes in I was already done I had to force myself to finish the rest.

This film is.not quite an A, more like a B+, and worth aty least one watch. Nothing about this scifi is "bad", it is just never GREAT.Bruce looks tired and bored, but perhaps that is his character. Within the first 20 minutes of the movie, I had him pegged as some kind of highly functional sociopath, then he seems just sad.Effects are just decent, acting is acceptable, storyline has empty spaces in it, the science is almost believable (most scifi's science is stupid), but it is worth a watch.

Ugh there is no logic in the movie, also bruce wills every step he is taking it goes worse and putting good actors does not makes the movie good. It is so pity because acting is good only the story is so bad. They have put money into it only the execution of the movie is just bad script is bad..... It seems like the actors are happy as long as they got paid for it.I could not finish the movie because it was bad, just waste of time. What is pity because could have done so much more.

reviews.review_title: There are a lot of bad movies, but this one...!!!
reviews.content: The word "Bad", doesn't even approach to reality when you describe this movie. If I challenge my 4 yrs old nephew and my 6 yrs old niece to write a Scifi script and make a movie using their neighbors as actors I can guarantee that they would make a better movie. This is so bad that there are no words to describe it. Bad acting(Bruce Willis acts like he has just been dragged out of his bed in the middle of the night) , annoying storyline and dialogs and unbelievably bad special effects (I think the 1966 release Star Trek had better special effects). This movie can't even be used as a parody. I wonder who allowed the release of this piece of garbage.??He should be eliminated from his position.

reviews.review_title: Worst sci-fi movie in the past decade
reviews.content:
Clearly the writers and producers didn't put much thought into this movie. 500+ years in the future and people are wearing the same clothes and drive the same cars that I do. Seems that the tobacco companies are still selling cigarettes and the decontamination process they use wouldn't even stop covid-19 and there are probably better guns available today than are used in the movie. After the first 20 minutes it was obvious watching this movie would be a waste of time but I persevered :-)
3 stars for the effort.

I never ever stop to leave a review. This movie was so bad I honestly had to make a review. It shouldn't be cosmic sin but cosmic $@#t. If he made $20 bucks in this movie Bruce was overpaid. I cannot get over how bad this movie is. I swear it was made on one set with some awful CG. I couldn't go negative stars for rating or I would have. Attack of the killer tomatoes was better than this.

Cosmic Sin? Well, okay! I was going to say colossal error, but your title describes the same failure! And a failure of so many dimensions!The wooden, lifeless dialogue performed by equally emotionless characters, as it would be a dishonour calling them actors, befits the empty plot. The bodysnatching aliens had more support from this audience than the Empire's henchmen...oops, I meant the Alliance's! Maybe the biological bacteria would've had better one liners!The fragmented storylines all fizzle out of view, with no heart, brains nor yellow brick road, it's a film that only a crackhead junkie would understand, like the writer, I presume! An absolute cocktail of crap stuck together with whatever those ugly suits worn were stuck on with! Watch at your own risk of losing some neurons!

reviews.review_title: No Research Was Done for this Film
reviews.content: I'm only 15 minutes into this movie and i think i lost 15 percent of my brain cells already. The director must have serious connections in hollywood to have gotten this made.

I wish that I was writing about "that" movie, but sadly, I am not. Hell, I don't even want to attempt to review this pile of dog poo. Three times I tried to watch this, three times I fell asleep. Does this make me qualified to review this, hell yeah, save yourself and do not venture down this path. It is funny that one the definitions of "cosmic" is "inconceivably vast" add "sin" to that and you get the movie. No recommendation here, shame on you, Bruce.

reviews.review_title: You can tell they really tried...
reviews.content: It really isn't as horrible as a lot of people are saying. It's obvious this was done on a limited budget but most the time it feels like they knew how to work on a limited budget. Most of the CGI is passable considering current state of tech. The costumes have a good amount of detail but it looks like a bunch of cosplayers were hired out to make them, painfully obvious EVA foam and thermoplastic. The "futuristic" armor pieces are almost comically ill-fitting and awkward but have enough detail to make it tolerable. Combat is rather non-sensical, they clearly did whatever felt cool and didn't cost any extra and paid minimal attention to any kind of real tactics or gunplay. The story progression makes sense if only by a thread. Nothing wrong with the acting. Cinematography absolutely feels like it's done on a budget but it's done well enough. Foley is well done if not a little too clean sometimes. Music is quite possibly the highpoint, absolutely spot on.

reviews.review_title: In the 2500s people inexplicably drive current-era cars
reviews.content: If you like plot holes, cliches, corny dialogue that is not funny, and some pretty good special effects...this might be a movie for you. This movie is as dislikable as most of its characters and as confused as most of the actors seem to be.

reviews.review_title: Willis phoning in his performance. Extra point for SFX
reviews.content: Far better than Breach but sadly Willis is phoning in his performance and thinking of the money.Ge must have Bill's to pay or something as recent films all sucked.Karma for voting Trump? Ha ha maybe.Character may as well have been the same kne as Armageddon.Zero character development. Occasional attempt at making us feel for a character.Lazy plot, plot holes and the usual failings of a budget film.Far in future and nothing looks that futuristic at all. Cars etc!?The effects were better than expected for budget, and skne actors didnt get enough screen time (Grillo).Bruce's best is far behind him.He should stop as all he is doing now is crapping on his legacy.

reviews.review_title: Makes no sense what so ever 😕
reviews.content: Has absolutely no substance to it the story doesn't go anywhere, It hasn't come from anywhere its just there to fill 1.29 hours.

This movie. This movie is less than 1 star. Disjointed. Unwatchable. Stupid. Appalling.Just some of the words which apply to this mess.I still don't follow some of the "storyline" and I use that term loosely. But I'm not prepared to watch it again to try to understand it.

Bad acting, extreme cliches....just a hot mess. 500 years in the future and they still drive vehicles of today and use guns with bullets?? Over the top with machismo and hubris. Just a bad, bad movie. I gave it 2 stats instead of zero because of Bruce Willis and Lochlyn Munroe....two actors I've always liked.

They seemed to have a budget for a big ish cast, all wasted with very poor dialogue. The acting seems very poor because of bad direction.The plot follows a cheap rip off of 'Doom', the crap one from a few years back (not the one with 'The Rock' starring, which was actually pretty cool). Again, the dialogue is so poor it makes everything very tedious to get through.2/10 Very bad movie.
I cant believe mr. Willis has accepted to be in this movie and congrats to the editor😂

Well, nothing much to say, though at least on the technical level it at least works on a basic level.But it was interresting to see "WWE Lana" (C. J. Perry) in a wildly released role. I wish her luck with her career - while this was very cheese performance, it wasn't bad.

reviews.review_title: So I guess this is what Bruce Willis gets for not being like all the other actors.
reviews.content: I have watched 3 Bruce Willis films in a row that were absolutely unwatchable for the simple fact that they were all poorly written, and worse, the supporting cast was all phoning it in.I want to know when is Hollywood going to stop punishing Bruce Willis for not being a communist? When is Hollywood going to give the man his real job back? Is he waiting for another Die Hard movie to come along so he can do the whole "Old Guy Still Has It" thing again?While I get that he probably doesn't need the money and may just be slumming, I can tell you this much that having gotten through this travesty, I deserve at least a free month of Netflix.Maybe with a little luck, Quentin Tarantino will cast Willis in the last film he makes in order to close out both their careers with a win.
I gave it a one because it would not let me give a zero. Bruce Willis must really need the money.
The movie started off pretty good. Then the last 30 minutes was really bad. Overall, I found it an average space flick. 5 Stars.
I have no words to adequately describe what an utter waste of time this movie is.What a terrible movie.

reviews.review_title: Previews looked very good, movie bad!
reviews.content: Burce Willis is a power house actor that is not being used in the last few decades. He was the only interesting part in this and didnt get the lines he should have gotten. The special effects and science fiction is very well put together for this film but the story falls short. This movie is a poor remake of Armageddon and SGC put together. I do not understand why he does not produce and direct his own movies that draw on his talent.
Bruce, what the hell is wrong with you?! Come on man, get it together! This is one of the all time worst movies ever made!

This should be shown to acting students, on how not to act. One of, if not "the" worst films I have ever seen. Is this really all Bruce Willis can get now?I'm guessing all the actors budget went on him, and they picked random people off the street and explained the scene and filmed whatever they did....

I haven't written a movie review on here in years, but really needed to for this one. I saw the trailer, read the reviews and thought "nah, no way Bruce Willis would go down in a fiery crash with his acting career doing below F grade movies." Well, I was wrong. So VERY wrong. The reviews here are point on. I wish I could give this a movie a zero. It was the worst crap I've seen all year.I don't know if Bruce owes someone money or everyone in this film is hurting for cash because of COVID. It sucked BADLY. Seriously save your time and skip this one. It had everything bad that you could think of in a movie.The plot was weak and missing any details that would've made this movie somewhat interesting. The actors looked like they didn't care to be there, especially Bruce who seemed drunk or stoned most of the time. Also, the actions of the characters made absolutely no sense "put your hands up" to people that are decaying and zombie-looking. What the hell?!The editing was nauseating at best. The dialogs, oh god the dialogs were long and boring. Yak yak yak with pointless fillers that only extended the torture of trying to watch this.The CGI was mediocre at best. My pre-teen daughter plays with Blender and can do a WAY better job that what they did in this movie for CGI effects. The props were also pretty bad. Someone on here stated their suit of armour looked like plastic. No, it wasn't plastic, more like spray-painted foam with two colored LEDs mounted on each side of their heads. I have a 3D printer and I can make way better props than the ones used in this film. The music kept repeating the same annoying rhythms and drowning out the dialogs at times (may be I should be thankful for that).I found myself fast forwarding a lot through this movie HOPING for something good, for ANYTHING to redeem this crap that was wasting my precious time, but I was sorely disappointed. I can go on and on about how bad this was but I feel I've ranted enough. Please trust the reviews here, they are right. If not just trust me and avoid this one like the plague.

reviews.review_title: Garbage - IMDb has to introduce negative votes
reviews.content: A deception for the viewers. This movie is a scam. I don't know how Frank Grillo could have been involved in this mediocrity compromising his reputation. I hope he could join a movie or a series as Frank Castle titled "Frank Castle".

I watched this before I read the reviews. I wish I'd done it the other way around. We paid $7.99 to watch it onDemand and I wish there was a refund policy.Read the negative reviews and I ditto all of them.Bad acting. Plot threads going nowhere. Awkward writing. No sex appeal from anyone. Non-imaginative derivative ... you get the idea.My advice? Look at your toenails for 1:28mins and you'll enjoy that more.
What a waste of time to produce something like this or watch it... nuff said.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely abhorrent sin against the movie industry
reviews.content: Word has it that aliens saw this movie and blacklisted our planet for another 40000 years. This is not even a movie, this is more of a group of kid's backyard movie project. The only thing i cannot figure it why is willis in it. There is no way this had the budget to pay him, so i suspect it was a case of a kid asking him to stand in front of their camcorder and ponder upon his resume why he is doing this.Acting is terrible, script is terrible, plot is copy paste, design elements are not even questionable, but downright hilarious. The aliens are apparently wraiths from lord of the rings franchise. Brilliant!This is not bad in an entertaining way. This is bad in a bad way. You will have absolutely no value from watching this.
Wow I cannot begin to imagine how Bruce lost a bet this big!!!!Worst film ever!No story.No acting.No score.
Cheaply made, poor story, dodgy acting - nothing to see here, but for all its cosmic "sins", I've actually seen worse recently - at least its not too long.
Most definitely a sin to have produced this, and on a scale that's cosmic. I got to about minute 12. Enough said.

It's impossible to describe how bad this movie is. It's like a reverse Anselm's ontological argument. This is the movie, than which no worse movie could be conceived--- and it exists in reality! It had to exist, because of the reverse Anselm's ontological argument, which I just discovered while watching the movie.

reviews.review_title: Looks worse than a fan made
reviews.content: Worst film I've ever seen in my entire life it's hot garbage, so bad I want my money back and I watched this for free lmao. Makes Battlefield Earth look like Blade Runner.

Did they just take lines from other scripts and put them together?I worked as assistant propmaster on The100 for 4 years. If I were to use camera tape to fix or build a space suit, I would at least clean up the edges.It's really bad. And hard to watch.
Come On Bruce, You dont need the money that bad!And Who cam up with the "Ed Wood" costumes ????Missa.

reviews.review_title: Save your time watch something else.
reviews.content: I wanted this to even be B movie good... So many plot holes and just horrible dialog. I watched it yo the end but I wish I could have my time back.

reviews.review_title: Wow, I struggled to watch this
reviews.content: I made it 34 mins before my gag reflex kicked in. It's only an 88min movie and I couldn't find the energy to last.Everything that the other reviews say is true. Gas cars, 2010-era motorcycles, bullet-firing guns. Etc, etc. The simple fact that humans would still be around in 500 years was laughable at this point.I started to channel Wesley Snipes: "Where's all the phasers and s%^&?" No one has cybernetics, bionic limbs, or nanomachines built into them?Seriously bad movie. Bruce Willis seems to be on a bad roll lately, with Breach and this disaster.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies ever
reviews.content: Back story was pretty great and this had a chance to be great but they released an epic disaster. They spent way too much money getting Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo. They were barely in any scenes and they clearly skimmed in other places.Bruce Willis's right hand man was not the army type at all and we get one of the weirdest scenes I've ever seen where he is talking to a young girl who apparently appeared out of nowhere that he's going to "save" her. It was so uncomfortable. Before that we get about 45 min of one on one side conversations between characters that were just awful.The scene where they are flying through the galaxy I absolutely started dying. They looked like Power Rangers!! They travel 13 light years in minutes but when two of them crash into eachother they just go off course a little. Lmao. Who was their physics consultant? Joe Biden?There's reference to the Alliance govt but that is never shown. So the biggest event in human history is fought by a handful of rag tag military guys. Ohh and the Aliens sent a handful of soldiers to fight initially rather than send their ships through immediately and keep the element of surprise. They ran out of money for Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo so they kept them in those absolutely laughable Quantum suits and just used their voices. This could have been good. The set, the acting, the CGI all awful. Even the Entourage and Old School actress was awful in her role.This movie is a jumbled mess. It's so freaking bad but not even funny bad. It's mostly pointless side convos and horrible special effects. We never really even get to see the aliens and what they actually look like! Pathetic!!

This movie had made my day! I laughed long and hard ... and I honestly, considered creating a "go fund me " page for Bruce, because the guy needs to be in some serious financial hardship since he agreed to stare in this glut.
The " he was going to die anyway" scene is a ultimate proof that a good movie is not only made by good actors...
Spaceballs is like a an Iliad of space movies when compared to this abomination. Hats down for anyone who can make it past 30 min mark.This movie is so bad! So bad I dedicated 15 min of my life to create this account and post this review!
Unbelievable!

With the money you spent and the cast you had, it requires special talent to come up with such a scrap. The director and the script writer should share all the credits. Just cant believe what I saw. I thought of giving up midway but then continued just to find out how worse it could be. I have seen plays in school more organized than this. I will recommend everyone to watch this movie and promise no other movie will disappoint you then.

reviews.review_title: Bruce, what are you doing dude?!
reviews.content: You know how boomers get scammed on Facebook because they don't understand how modern day technology works? I think that's how they got Bruce Willis signed up to this crap. He got roped into an inescapable contractDon't give up on Willis, but be wary of anything the producers and director (whoever they are) try to rope you into. Make sure if you did sit down and watch their flicks that you're budgeting the time you're willing to waste because even though there's a chance it'll pay off you're still more likely to be ripped off (old trick I learned from problem gambling)

reviews.review_title: I watched it because I could not believe the bad ratings
reviews.content:
I have seen worse, but not really much.I was actually hoping to give it a 6 or 7, because that happens sometimes when the ratings are that bad. This time, I was trying to find something to pin at least a few stars to this movie.
Well, one star for the sergeant that died to early. Good acting, compared.
One for the terrific suits that others hated so much, though it's more half a star since I have to deduct for the nonsense helments.
And one star just for not giving a 2.After watching Boss Level and praising that one so high, I was deeply shocked. Well, I survived. You cannot always make a brilliant movie like Boss Level.
Bruce Willis is never tired ! I liked this movie as I like his previous.I don't understand the negative reviews.
No plot, no action, bad acting, worse writing, crap editing, this burning bag of dung has it all. Stabbing yourself in the leg would be less painful than enduring this junk.

reviews.review_title: I agree the movie is a cosmic sin
reviews.content: Good on Bruce for trying to help a friend.Why else would he be in this film unless it was a friend's film?Maybe a friend's child is in film school?I don't think I have seen worse though.

reviews.review_title: Waste of time, money, and talent
reviews.content: Why in the world was this movie even made? Did Bruce Willis suck up the entire budget? Will likely be the worst movie in 2021.

reviews.review_title: High School film club is getting better.
reviews.content: Don't ignore the other reviews and ask if you have c.88 minutes to donate.This film would be greatly improved by using real actors. Having the bloke who looks like Frank Grillo was a great idea (I'm a Frank Grillo fan), as was using a cut-out of Bruce Willis. Special effects are good, even the Bruce Willis cut-out had moving lips.Which brings me to the script. If you find a 'script' in a bin, it's been filed there for a reason. No amount of 'special sauce', extras in bikinis or a high body count will make up for a crap script. Trust me, I saw "Batman vs Superman" twice.Special effects are pretty Amiga. Maybe school film club should upgrade? Just a thought.And this film does give you lots of time to think. It does not try to monopolise your attention like "12 Angry Men" or "One Flew Over The Cuckoos Nest". No sir, this film lets you indulge your free-thinking gene. Lots. I even finished my 11-year long Rubik Cube session and completed my tax return.Before I go, let's look at the positives, besides the special effects moving lips on the Bruce Willis cut-out...And that's it.I hope you enjoy your movie.

reviews.review_title: What? Is what I said at the script.
reviews.content: Seriously, what's this script? Like what? The script. It's giving me a brain aneurysm. It's that bad. Random voice lines. Everywhere. Can't take it. Must live. Nooo. My brain.If you are confused by that start of the review then you feel what I felt like watching this movie. Completely random script and someone saying something completely random at the wrong time. Also the armor things. Like low budget Spartans. Plus, why does everything look like 2022 when it's supposed to be 2521 or something. The set looks like some old house somewhere. Some parts in woods somewhere. This brings me back to the Stargate SG-1 era stuff. Like every planet was set somewhere in the USA. But tht show had much better script and the actors could actually act. Either Bruce Willis is handicapped by the awful script or he just gave up at some point because he knew this was going to be a piece of poop movie.

reviews.review_title: Newsflash: no new fashions for humans in the next five hundred years.
reviews.content: Okay - it's not a scifi in the true sense, more of a space battle, but if you are writing a story set five hundred years in the future put a teensy bit of effort into it. Maybe hire a costume or set designer. I hope we aren't still wearing jackets from nineteen ninety, going to crappy dive bars to watch crappy hologram garage bands in five centuries.Maybe get a scientist to tell you why you can't launch individuals into the middle of space, fly them through a space laser battle, then crash land them in their space suits onto the surface of another planet. A planet that looks remarkably like Earth - couldn't you have made the trees blue or something?Thank God I won't be around to see this sad future.

Ohmidog!!!Bruce and Frank can't see dead movies. Prolly didn't read the script.Bruce to his agent via phone: "What are they paying?"
"Same as the last one, Bruce."
"Okay, but for that kinda gelder, I'm not going to read the script. If they want me to read, I can't just phone it in. They'll have bump it up 50%, at least."
"I'll be honest, bumping, not gonna happen."
"Good to know, Barry. One more thing, what's Grillo getting, then?"
"25% less than you, Brucie. He's been to Vegas, needs a cash flow hit ASAP."
"Well, okay, then. I'm on board. Say no more. . . Hang on, don't hang up. Last questiong, it that next Die Hard gonna happen or what? After this covid crap I need to make some serious money. I can't live the life I'm accustomed to on just pocket change."
I know. I feel ya completely. Same here. Keep ya posted."

The thing about this film that excelled was its adherence to cliches.... too bad that's not a good thing.Stereotypical hot guy and gal are alone and going to have sex when alien species approaches. Hey... if they're all alone, why does he have a machine gun? And why does the gal only get a pistol? I guess that's the rules of Hollywood cliches.The space suits were laughable... sure dudes, you look really cool with your little heads poking out from those NFL shoulder pads. In fairness, maybe that was a metaphor for our nation arguably using its military might more than thought. That's a fair point for discussion but i doubt anyone watches this film for political insight.The shootouts, the aliens, everything was cliche and the movie was formulatic. The aliens are BAD. /s So KILL THEM. Not exactly Close Encounters.Oh, and this is Stargate rules, not Star Trek.The cliche comic sidekick was good for one or two chuckles. Two, I think. No badassery, no epic shootouts (neither deafening firepower like Aliens nor thoughtful suspense like Clint and Eli clearing out the ghost town on the Good Bad and Ugly). Nothing at all worthwhile to an adult intelligence in this film. I'm actually laughing at the thought that I watched it.

I had a long day at work and decided to watch a movie and rest a bit, it made me feel worse. Pure trash.I mean I'm not a picky person but oh.my lord this is the worst thing I've seen in my life.Watching it was even worse than torture it was soo bad i wish I worked extra just so I don't watch it. Skieodpdldjdospsjnekejdksodujdleiejndlaos.

reviews.review_title: Expect improved ratings in the years to come...
reviews.content: When it comes to this genre (Sci-Fi / Action / Alien Invasion) of movies, the film industry has been spewing out cookie-cutter, worn out garbage for nearly two decades, feeding us one lame cookie-cutter superhero remake after another after another.Those of us who love this genre of movies have been begging for new movies that surprise us and capture our attention. We want movies that require real thought to understand and use our imagination. The issue is that many people had very high expectations for this movie, due to the casting of Bruce Willis as the main character.In contrast, if the movie was cast of main characters that are not well known, people would have no real expectations for a top shelf movie, and would be impressed by the visuals and originality, and would have a rating in the 5.5 to 6.5 range.That being said, here we have a movie that gives us what we have been asking for... but how did we respond? With hyper-critical disdain and complaints, and worst of all, a 2.5 rating. Come on now people.. Don't be so hard on this movie. Also, Willis has been in serious mental decline since this movie was made, and he is now in a serious condition, and he is nearing the end of his life.Cheers to Bruce Willis for all the amazing work he has done over the years. What a legend.

reviews.review_title: So Bad with no redeeming qualities.
reviews.content: I Thought this may have been written by a bored 12 year old, trying to entertain his 10 year old brother.Some times dreadful films have a certain charm. This is not one of those times.

Well Bruce Willis has really hit rock bottom this movie like his recent movies are absolutely rubbish.
Some of these actor seem to make any old crap now just for a few dollars.
I think his die hard days have gone forever now.

The distant future has vehicles from the 1990s and props from Walmart. That doesn't scratch the surface. There is so much wrong I can't waste time listing. Apparently 90% of the budget went to pay Bruce Willis. How he could read this script and take the project is mind boggling.

reviews.review_title: Why did Bruce Willis make this!
reviews.content:
I can't understand how or why Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo, 2 super actors agreed to be in this.
I can only think it's a favour to a friend. Or a dodgy accountant lost their money.
I'm shocked. Had to switch it off after an hour as couldn't take any more.
I usually love Frank Grillo (ever since the grey and the 2nd purge film). Watch those instead.

1/10Boring dialogue, B-grade acting, boring antagonists, B-grade special effects with a boring story. Not suitable for children because of the eff word either.The pros were using my free ticket & leaving after 65 minutes before my brain disowned me.

reviews.review_title: I was able to endure 30 minutes of this crap
reviews.content: After the 30 minutes, I watched the rest on fast forward... I'm very patient when it comes to watching & rating a movie, but this one was BAD to an intolerable extent.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst, but pretty bad
reviews.content: This could be one of the most uninspired movies I've ever seen. The plot goes something like this. Willis' character is supposedly the notorious character who followed orders to release a 'q-bomb' on another planet and killed lots of beings. Suddenly on a planet which is supposed to be uninhanbited, a few members of the "alliance" are attacked by an unknown source, believed to be an alien and no one knows for sure. And then, when it becomes apparent that there are problems, grizzled Willis must be brought back one more time to potentially do the dirty deed to protect the world because they think they need to... because it's an alien group.Frank Grillo enters and brings his usual A-game and is fine. He does what he can with his part to at least look interested and try to be convincing. The bit characters are mostly OK with some rough edges. Willis looks tired, annoyed and like he couldn't be more disinterested throughout the film. Even during one of the most "intense" parts when he could be destroyed, the camera pans on him and he's got a look of boredom.The problem is that most of the film feels like total filler. Characters use terms you've heard in numerous other space movies to describe stuff that is supposed to be "space cool" to make you buy into the fact that wearing spacesuits (and only spacesuits) to travel millions of miles is a good idea. Doesn't quite work.To sum up how poor the dialogue in this film is, one of the characters has problems with the space flight path. So he says "AI, adjust flight path." Why would a human need to tell the AI to adjust a flight path? We don't even do that today, and certainly not hundreds of years in the future, which looks a LOT like it does today.So how does the story resolve? Like numerous others you've heard before, just far more talky, which is a very bad thing, and without much of it really making too much sense to be believeable. It's watchable for the laughs but totally pointless.
Bruce Willis is on point! i hope he got payed a bundle for this one because he is worth every penny! didn't phone this one in at all! amazing complex story with believable and well rounded characters

Terrible writing, terrible plot, terrible acting... just completely awful. Weird long shots on peoples faces. Irrelevant dialogue...how did this even get made into a movie??? I'm confused why I watched the whole thing. Kinda annoyed I paid 5.99 to rent it and wasted 90 mins of my life.

reviews.review_title: Not great but Bruce is great in it.
reviews.content: Not a great movie but at least an ok one to pass 90 minutes, Grahics are good. It has a mixture of various things but seems to have borrowed ideas from Stargate. We have an alien portal that looks like the giant Stargate that was used by the Ori. The aliens are parasites that take ove the control of the human bodies like the symbionts in Stargate. The humans have a Q-Bomb that creates a black hole to destroy enemies and they use it at the end of the movie. Not great but not too bad.

Now that you've read my headline, stay with me for the review.You probabaly read it and thought, "what the hell did this spam stick find to like in that movie"...Nothing, the answer is nothing (well almost...but we will come back to that). The film made almost no sense from start to finish. The plot was paper thin, the characters were bland and undeveloped, the visuals were crappy and the dialogue was terrible.I was hoping this film might reach 'so bad it's good' territory. My hopes were in vain! It dipped below bad, hit terrible...and stayed there for the entire remaining run time.I get the feeling some scenes were cut; because the story seems to know what the hell is going on and what the characters are doing. Unfortunately the audience is non the wiser...and they will stay that way, because precisely no one is comming back to this movie for a 'special edition'.I did say there was 'almost' nothing to like...the costume design was pretty cool. But thats not going to save this steaming turd of a movie.

It seems like there's a great story buried somewhere here, there are some actors we know can be good, and the special effects are mostly quite decent. But it just doesn't work.Hard to say exactly what went wrong, but the three I think might be key reasons:* The camera shots are frequently messed up. Sometimes you know something's supposed to be happening, but between awkward angles, blur effects, and darkness, you don't know what they're trying to show you.
