This is as bad as it get folks.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the worst Sci-Fi for Willis.
reviews.content: Granted, Willis is a star, but his shine is fading, and it's very obvious. This movie would have done much better without him. There were some young actors that show some promise. Willis said less than 50 words throughout the entire film. How can you justify, paying this guy a ton of money for a nothing part. They could have hired someone coming up that could have filled the space. Willis is one of my favorites, and like John Wayne, loved him but just doesn't hit the screen with that POP. I would much rather see Willis doing more drama, romance films, maybe. He really looked tired in this as well. Give him an early retirement. Go fishing Bruce, and leave the movie business to the new kids.

reviews.review_title: Ignore the haters - fun wild ride
reviews.content: It seems that the haters who bad mouth this movie are a bunch of whiny babies with short attention spans and no imagination. If you like sci if and Bruce Willis this movie is for you!

SO lame, I still don't really know what it's about.
Fell asleep watching this, just avoid.

From his first appearance Willis appears bored, saying his lines as if he said them for the first time. If the director had balls he would have addressed this, even if The character was a "Star". Budget film, badly made.

Wow. Similar to what someone else said, I don't know if the Cosmic Sin is making the movie or watching it. And what's Bruce Willis doing? Did he not manage his finances well? Why doesn't he retire & travel the world? It's so painful to watch. To see one of your favorite action heroes die a slow death.We've achieved quantum leap travel, but no advancement in handheld weaponry? Our on suit computer can't navigate a safe flight path?Here's my analogy. Load a shotgun shell w/ lighting, special effects, dialog, etc. Then fire. The scattered pattern represents the movie.Is it ironic that this "parasite" comes in black goo, which is also represented in another Bruce Willis bomb, "Breach"? At least Breach was more coherent.

reviews.review_title: I want to put 0 star but I can't
reviews.content: It's literally a Z movie with some money, everything from the CGI to the dialog is horrible, for a minute I have think this was a 2001 film, horrible anyway.

reviews.review_title: Seeing that it is a movie advocating for war crimes
reviews.content: I guess the fact that it managed to get EVERYTHING wrong was not such a bad thing after all.
What the heck was wrong with Bruce Willis? Why was he talking like that, such a strange way?

reviews.review_title: How the mighty Bruce has fallen
reviews.content: Oh Bruce. Did you not learn anything from the career of Nicholas Cage?A free good movies and then trash. Well buddy, you've hit the TRASH phase of your career. This movie has everything: bad acting, bad dialog, bad story, bad directing, horrific editing, absurd monstersIt;'s SO bad people are giving it 10/10 as a Comedy.

For a movie like this one it's a loss of energy also type into another language!Unconnected dialogs, total absence of a general vision, full of bad words ( useless ), no "glue" between characters, film director not present ( or drunk) ?We have to thank virus cinema are closes... TV is much more than enough for this movie!Hei Bruce, what hell happened?

I have reviewed many films and TV series produced by Netflix. I am sad to say this one of the most poorly financed and improproperly produced films in years. Why? What happened ? The story was there but nothing more.

reviews.review_title: Don't, just watch anything else, really.
reviews.content: I thought Bruce and Frank will make sure this rocks, but I was completely mistaken. Usually I do watch movies with bad rating like Uwe Böll's, Tunnel Rats was actually a good one... and I don't mind the Far Cry one that much. But this movie makes no sense at all. First, we advance 500 years into the future, but still use keyboards, mechanic guns that fire bullets? And that's the theme of the whole movie, there is barely anything that relies on those 500 years, I could just have been 20 and it would be the same. The story is even worse, an attack on another planet, you immediately get some The Expanse vibes like the attack on Ganymede, but nope they just fly to another planet and then even have hand-2-hand combat with an alien, it's just so confusing and completely unreal. If you want high quality sci fi, watch The Expanse, or Altered Carbon or one of those good shows... and to Frank Gallo, dude if you need money that desperate, just ask for it and don't sell yourself for something like that.

For movies like this you should be allowed to give a negative score. The only use this movie had was that the production of it paid some peoples wages. Bruce Willis whats happening? Anti-life and now this. Elon Musk do us all a favour and put Bruce on the next test flight if he wants to be in space this much.

In our world of science fiction, we have Marvel and Star Wars type, A rated movies; and, we have Cosmic Sin, C rated movies. The movie is so badly developed, I felt sad for Bruce Willis for agreeing to be part of it. He's a nice guy, made enough millions, he needs to stop doing these low quality movies, otherwise people will remember him as the guy who did a garbage movie!From story, to cinematic, to ending, everything is out of sync and out of connection. Save your time, watch something better.

Either this was written by a bunch of students for fun, their fun, but still can't explain those who put money on it. Spoiler alert: really simple plot, fine by me, but the whole thing is based on some "heroes" willing to sacrifice themselves to save the human race only minutes after a first gruesome contact with aliens. And they aren't even sure of what is going on. They run for a nuclear bomb just because they've got a gut feeling. You don't get to sympathise too much with the carachters cause you don't get to know who the hell they are apart from military grades, so the suspense about their destiny gets killed too. There are some injustified "visions" implied. The aliens looks exactly like Lovecraft's Chtulhu, I mean, at least whip up something new. One of the final scene it's just unbereably stupid as it was written by an unsecure kid who represents himself as a big hero engaging a fist fight and then violently stabbing a nearly dead alien. For revenge. Really?!? Cringe. I respect all the talents but it looks like they picked the nephew's script and put his friends to shoot it and act in it. Frankly the message is for flat brainers.

They tried so hard the first 20 minutes. Then the first line of bad acting, the director said to the staff,
'Whelp, we are not doing a retake, is what it is.'Wonder when Bruce realized; before, during, or after, that this movie was a mistake.
I made an account just to say this movie is pure utter trash. Whoever green lit this needs to be locked away so they don't allow another abomination like this movie to be made.

reviews.review_title: Pretty much as bad as it gets
reviews.content:
I have no idea what Bruce Willis is up to but this movie is awful. He manages to mumble his way through a script written by a prepubescent school boy. The year 2500ish and they use equipment that is old by today's standards: but they do have a faked tanned duck lip actress playing a role: giving hope to all of today's influencers that there is a future for you.Sadly I am not going to make it to the end of the film to see the outcome, my hair needs washing.
An awful script and I really mean awful plus some seriously poor acting by some of the actors especially Brandon Thomas and the duck lipped CJ Perry.
Avoid this one, it is bad.

reviews.review_title: didn't pass the 5 minute mark! HORRENDOUS LAZY WRITING!
reviews.content: Corey William Large (writer) and Edward Drake (director) both need to find another career- along with Bruce Willis. 500 years into the future we have interstellar travel, flying cars and have colonized several other planets... BUT, we're still driving around in typical 2021 gasoline pick-up trucks, shooting bullets with the same gun powder through the same typical firearms and still have silly spinning mechanical flood lights- this has to be the LAZIEST writing ever! ZERO imagination and clearly a substantial lack of effort and ambition by director and writer! It's hard to think of the right words to fully capture how ludicrously insanely BAD this movie is!

I just wanted to say to all critics of this movie.I am the director of that beautifully written masterpiece and I'm here to tell you you have no taste. This was almost perfect. Not quite there yet but still, very well executed, a Bruce Willis giving everything he had so guys, next time, you're talking s**t about my movie, you call me. You fix the day and the time and I'll show you all the powers that God bestowed upon me. And then, when I'm done after a minute or two, I'll force you to watch this Cosmic sin N° 2. Oh yeah, baby. You're gonna love it.
I can't believe Frank Grillo starred in this pile. It wasn't even up to the SyFy channel quality, which isn't hard to achieve. So so bad.

Amazing fight sequences, CGI out of this world, best actors and phenomenal script. That's what I'm saving for Jack Snyder's 4 hour film.
Now back to reviewing this film... Ehhh somewhere in par with house of the dead.

reviews.review_title: Bruce Willis is an adaption of Power Rangers
reviews.content: Bruce Willis is an adaption of Power Rangers.Bruce Willis is an adaption of Power Rangers.

The only way you'll half way enjoy this movie.......
1. Take a drink every time someone says fu#k.2. Take two for every time someone just has one word to say!You're welcome and I'm now completely drunk!

This was somehow both boring and ridiculous at the same time. Large parts of the plot don't make sense. It feels like entire scenes are missing. At the beginning of the movie we go from first contact to interstellar war but beyond a single throwaway line it's not explained at all.Don't get me wrong, I enjoy a low budget film. Willis was in Breach last year which was a not-terrible 5/10 movie despite it's 2.7 on IMDB.This movie is currently at a 2.5 and is orders of magnitiude worse than Breach.

Yikes! This one is really bad. Not in a 'so bad it's good' way, just bad. I've been working my way through several of the recent Bruce Willis flicks and this one is rougher than the others. Probably because cheap sci-fi of any scale is harder to do than a drama or police film on the streets. Sets, effects, script, acting, direction, wardrobe- all are pretty bad here. Everything about this film screams cheap and takes away from the experience. There are a few scenes I had to rewind because they just plain didn't make any sense. Easily skip this one. Bruce doesn't have much to do and Frank is barely in it. Merciful 88 minutes.
When you see Bruce Willis is in a movie you think that it'll be worth a watch. This was absolute rubbish. Brucie must be really hard up if he has to accept films like this!

500 years in the future and they're still using fossil fuels and conventional weapons? REALLY? I mean.. Really?!Apart from the distinct lack of a "Phased plasma rifle with a 40-watt range", this film has some enjoyable moments, such as Bruce Willis being his usual cool collected self during a bar fight. But the film says nothing. No soul, no real drama. I wanted to be on the edge of my seat having looked at the premise... I sincerely have had more tension and drama on the edge of my toilet seat than when I was watching this movie.Once the aliens appear then it goes full pelt into an alien-zombie type battle that is somewhat reminiscent of James Cameron's "Aliens" from 1986. The cinematography also is worth noting in its a throwback to "Blade Runner" at times, but these are rare and the body of the film looks good and reasonable, but nothing creatively new.Rather long-winded and somewhat boring sequences ensue, some with potentially romantic undertones, along with recollections of past war wounds and pathetic sentimental dialogue that smacks of being added as an afterthought once a first edit was screened, the studio realising the movie has no emotion. Which it still doesn't.Some of it is fun, the special effects although I usually hate CGI are passable, but the lack of humanity and drama, unfortunately, makes the film fail on an emotional level, where it really could have been something that excels.As I have said it also fails miserably on a dramatic level... they just phoned it all in. What a waste of money this was."Die Hard" managed to pack in more drama and emotion, it's a shame that Bruce Willis and filmmakers of today don't seem to be capable or even willing to endeavour to achieve anything that even remotely compares. 2/10.

reviews.review_title: Is this the end of Bruce Willis
reviews.content: What has happened to make a Hollywood legend need to appear in this B movie dross it's just terrible actually unwatchable save you breath and life people it's shocking, I genuinely thing it's a straight to VHS yes it's that bad it's 80's trash

I truly wonder if all the negative reviews are from bots? How can someone be so critical of a pretty enjoyable movie that has a lot of very nicely done scenes and characters. The dialogues and characters I felt were genuine and realistic one might even say noble!Bruce Willis steals the show definitely, but more importantly the director didn't make the movie from one character's point of view, it's indeed from a truly narrative point of view. Which I liked very much. Might be in the same league as Battlestar Galactica, but some profound dialogues with a different focus.Very good movie.

OMG this is embarrassing to watch
How this got past the point of release is mind boggling it feels homemade in a garage over a weekend ... -10 stars.Please stop making this junk.

A 7 year old couldn't digest this..
It feels like it was made by inexperienced college students on a dollar budget.
There are top actors, but the CG doesn't include the story, including the script.

reviews.review_title: Boring slow terrible - would all be compliments
reviews.content: I watched it because of Brice Willis being in it. Was hoping for something fifth-elementish. This movie is extremely boring with uninspired plot, bad dialogue and very slow progression. It's a waste of time which could have been spent watching any other movie. This movie is just awful.

reviews.review_title: Maybe it needs an other director...
reviews.content: So so bad... Some special effects are good but the image all along the movie never gets you to the felling of being there... The story doesn't have a sense... Probability one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I'm really sorry for seeing how low Bruce Willis have arrived.

I had to finish the film, otherwise I won't be able to review it here. And believe me it was a torture.So basically someone blackmailed Bruce Willis with a sex tape or something, he was forced to act in this film. I have never seen such a dull movie since samurai cop. I wouldn't be surprised if at some point I heard "Action!" and "Cut". The dialog felt like they were shooting actors separately. And I can bet they never met each other at a set. Overall, it's a very bad movie. Please don't watch it.

reviews.review_title: Just terrible, I regret having wasted time on it
reviews.content: This was by far the worst I have seen in the last years.It seems like they tried really hard to hit rock bottom.The mostly good actors did a lousy job.The story made no sense.The rugged old misunderstood soldier plotline for Bruce was unconvincing and played very badly. Seems like Bruce has finally lost his mojo.Every move was unreasonable and mostly silly.The gun-battle was among the worst.The cut was terrible, obviously there was only junk to choose from.There was simply not a single good thing to say about this movie.
People should to go to jail for making this movie.

reviews.review_title: The worst film I ever watched
reviews.content: Seriously? Don't waist your time. The actors are so bad, even Bruce. (What is he doing?). The photography instead of showing a high tech civilization of 2500 show a normal city with some flying cars in the background, really? Nothing in this movie looks futuristic.

I love Bruce Willis and I love Sci Fi, so you would think this would be hard for me to dislike. It wasn't, it wasn't hard for me to dislike. This is the most phoned in movie I have ever seen. From the writers, to the actors, to the sound track. Absolutely terrible...

Famously a pillar of good action/sci-fi genre Bruce Willis seems to be doing someone a huge favor here. Cause other than that there is no reason for him to be in this trainwreck of a movie in any capacity. In all honest I was struggling to stay awake while watching this monstrosity. And as much as some movies are so bad that they're actually ironically good. This one's just plain bad. 2/10 - will never watch again.
Or are 90% of the reviewers solely here to trash Bruce Willis?It's not that bad. Nor is Bruce Willis.

reviews.review_title: What the heck is wrong with Bruce Willis?
reviews.content: Another pis by this once iconic actor. It's like he's just there as a name to support a bunch of talentless other actors. This film and others seemed the same. Boring and un memorable.
If you ever want to see how the editing of a movie can screw it up, watch this one. It could have been a good movie, but it's chopped to pieces.

reviews.review_title: I'm a US marine, too complex to me.
reviews.content: I dont undertand the plot and science, but love the dialog, the shooting and bombs. Is´what i do and my drive, kill them all!

I'm the mug who paid to rent this, Bruce reads his lines...in the middle a kid pops out of nowhere for the emotional scene. Fell asleep it was so boring, gave it one star as I can't give 0. Avoid.....

reviews.review_title: Skip right to the 25 min mark.
reviews.content: As a big fan of cheesy B-rated sci-fi and horror films, I had hoped the combination of Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo might give some young director's script life.This is not a script that needed life.The first half hour could have easily been a low-rent zombie flick with not much going for it.Instead, by attempting to create a sci-fi world five hundred years in the future, yet showing an essentially modern earth, and completely failing to pay attention to even the most basic of details like the progression of vehicular or sidearm technology, the world feels weird and imbalanced.After the half-hour mark, we end up with a film that is entirely dependent on having Bruce Willis inside a suit of cheap cosplay exo-armor. Plot points are unclear, storyline progression is scattered.There are a handful of good shots and halfway clever lines, and the sniper character is charming enough, but it easily could have been a 45-min short film, and would have been much better for it.

The film was such a mess I managed to last 15 minutes before turning it off. Luckily I was on a flight so could switch between films easily.A few things I noticed in the time I did watch which annoyed me:
terrible cartoony effectsunnecessary bad language straight offmodern day guns being used 500 years in the futurerobot barman spills drinks in 500 years time... surely that would of been sorted out!visibly old aged Bruce Willis tossing someone over a bar like a rag doll'Marcus' trimmed his moustache between scenesAnd that was as far as I got.Don't do it to yourself. Even if you're a fan of Grillo or Willis (I don't know how anyone still likes Willis after his recent offerings but each to their own). Please avoid.

reviews.review_title: Probably the worst scifi I've seen in a while....
reviews.content: This is a really, really bad movie. Bruce has had better days, and a lot more movies that are better. The special effects are nice, but the sound of the aliens is ripped from another set of scifi movies. A thin storyline, cheap props and shallow dialogies. Some times movies are too long, this one need another 10 minutes to explain the story.

Whoever wrote this and whoever directed it should never be allowed near a movie again except as a paying customer.500 years in the future it is highly unlikely that anyone will smoke. Nor will "specialists" talk back to their leaders and disobey their orders or talk back to 4 star generals in public (even if they are related).It's also highly unlikely that religion will still be a thing either. Or that soldiers would still be using the same kinds of weapons and ammo being used now.And when I saw that "captain" wearing his beret like it was a knit pull over cap, I wanted to reach throw the screen and slap it off his head.I started playing solitaire on my computer about half way through the movie so that I could stay awake.This ranks down in the basement beside "Escape Plan 2" (the sequel you didn't see because it was so bad they never even tried to promote it as a "straight to DVD" movie) !I'm sure this is one that Willis and Grillo will regret making for a long, long time.
Go watch paint dry, it'll be more coherent and entertaining than this mess.
It looks like grandpa Bruce lately hand picks some real A class scripts. This + Anti-Life have been a double disaster.

reviews.review_title: This sucks more than supermassive black hole
reviews.content:
The only thing working in this movie are the special effects.All the rest sucks.Idea: less original than a zombie/vampire movie
Plot: inexistent
Character design: zero
Costume design: as if it was made by a 13yo videogame noob
Soundtrack: probably made with GarageBand.Stay away as if this was hebola.

The cast seems reasonable however never get a chance to deliver. Not a single character or any part of the story ever get a chance to develop. Maybe a very low budget forced directors to paste together what they had without every finishing anything? Effects and fight scenes are average at best and do little to cover the poor writing. Avoid.
Is this going to be a trend now? Bruce Willis will be in bad movies. Even if they have tried they will have not succeeded in making a worst movie. Total waste of time.

As bad as the reviews describe it.
Apart from the indifferent acting... the plot. Is there a plot, or did a random generator tell them what to do? Or did they shot the scenes, that were supposed to be cool (they´re not), and then made up a story around that?
Shabby men in shabby bars and basements are generals that decide to initiate the first contact with aliens by blasting them away with a q-bomb. The dialog is completely non-sensical. A bunch of amateurs on You Tube would have made a better movie.
O, Bruce... I used to look for your name. If it was there I´d watch the movie. Now, it´s the opposite. If Willis is there, avoid it.

I can't understand all the hate at all, I think someone doesn't want you to see this film.Thought-provoking, I liked seeing humans as the bad guys for once. Setting it in the 26th century highlights how far we have to go as a species.
I haven't watch a movie so funny since the anchorman 2 this is the best experience in cinemas for a long time.... Wait sorry I was informed that this isn't a comedy ... Sh85.

This movie was despicable.Given Bruce Willis was in the movie, it makes it the worst piece of garbage I have ever viewed.I remembering watching a movie called "The Bad Batch" with Jason Momoa and thinking that was the bottom of the barrel.Now, this is the absolute bottom of the barrel, given it had a big time star in the lineup.

Bruce Willis rose from his slumber just for this terrible film? Which he appears to be in throughout this terrible sci-fi blunder. The fil is set into the future but people still uses technology from 1990's what a terrible sci0fi movie.
Such a waste of time. A regular B-movie. Crappy setup and even worse acting. A movie like BatGirl is being ditched but something like this slips through? Go figure....

reviews.review_title: Save yourself, avoid this movie at all costs
reviews.content: Science fiction action thriller? Nope, Science fiction borefest. Willis was clearly just collecting a check. Continuation, horrible, acting, horrible, directing, horrible, writing, worse. That is hard to achieve. Only positive note, this movie could cure insomnia.

reviews.review_title: Not what I expected... Truly bad movie.
reviews.content:
After watching Cosmic Sin I checked up on Bruce Willis current affairs and I discovered that he's currently doing a 5-movie deal with Edward Drake?!
Going by the first two it's not looking great for the three to come...I smell a desperate paycheck here but that's just me.Avoid this at all costs if you have the smallest love for the sci-fi genre - and a slightly descent script!

There are no words for the trash that is this movie.
When I saw the other reviews I didn't believe any movie could be that bad. With all other reviewers on here as my witness I have never been more wrong. I mean seriously.
I can't be clearer when I say you will never waste 90 minutes of your life in a worse way. I'm gobsmacked. Even Bruce doesn't make this better, the fact that he stared in this makes it worse.

reviews.review_title: Budget was spend in Bruce Willis and special effects
reviews.content: There was potential, first contact and homo sapiens vs neanderthal was an idea.Acting wasn't bad, I've seen it worse.The subject of attacking another species for fear of the worse was a good start.Politicians debating to make a decision was a good critic of current society, let again the writing fails to address this.

reviews.review_title: Had potential, then tripped over itself
reviews.content: Sign my opinion the first 15 minutes to half an hour were very good.However the movie handsome neutral to give us more storytelling which it then failed to do.So it set a backstory for the Bruce Willis character in him being blood general and about how he sacrificed 70 million souls in a war that was otherwise unwinnable.However it went on, to not explain anything about his backstory beyond this one feature which made him an irredeemable character.So much lost potential that jumped through each part with no linking.

I'm being completely honest, the worst I've ever seen! I've seen short films on YouTube with better quality, story, and acting than this. Even the aliens were cheap like an episode of Doctor Who from the 1970s! Why Bruce? Why?

reviews.review_title: Only watched it cos Bruce Willis was in it
reviews.content: A jumbled mess of a film. Worst sci-fi film I've ever seen.

Saw this on Netflix w/ Bruce and thought why not? What's the worst that can happen?? A LOT!!! I am mentally scarred at how bad this film is... We couldn't handle it and my gf and I had to turn it off before it would permanently scar us. Seriously, who FUNDS these movies?!!?

I like it when big named actors decide to do smaller projects, however I can't help but think that the money spent on Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo could've been better spent elsewhere.The upside is that you will undoubtedly attract a bigger audience, but the downside is that it also increases the expectations massively, as everyone is now expecting a Hollywood level production. And, as good as the CGI is at times, unfortunately for Cosmic Sin it's ambition severely outweighs it's budget making it look unoriginal and rushed. This is also not helped by emotionless acting, lazy story writing and cheap looking sets.

reviews.review_title: Bruce has Become the NEW Nicholas Cage!
reviews.content: If you haven't been paying attention, look at IMDB for Bruce Wilis and observe hire MANY horribad low budget movies he's made. No other "once A-list" actor since Nick Cage has taken this unexplainable route.I also suspect Bruce has a health issue because the number of his speaking lines in these movies is really limited...which would explain a lot, aside of his ego trying to stay relevant even if the plane is going down in flames with these movies.Maybe an accountant has mathematically shown that more money can be made taking this route than making a high quality streaming TV series, but Bruce has firmly chosen this road and is ruining his once admirable legacy.The movie is symbolic of the above....Take into for example the first 15 minutes. Human crew made contact and are infected and are taken into decontamination. No protocol is used as the space ship lands. The wisecracking soldiers walk the individuals inside as if the granma just arrived for Sunday supper...even though one girl is shoulder twerking with a white face and an ugly blister on her nose, another dude has also abnormal veins on his white face, etc. They get "decontaminated" in a shower area that looks like it belongs to a fitness gym by a dude in a painters outfit with a fire extinguisher. When all hell breaks loose and infected start attacking, the base alarm goes off...but no soldiers really come aside of the two that just died and were hesitant to shoot even as base people were dying. The Doctor doesn't want them dead at this point b/c they're beautiful to her. When the base goes on lockdown, the lights go red--the lights are the kind you buy at Home Depot and stick them against the shower tile of this "gym". The battle area now cuts into a bigger warehouse, like the stock room of your local Target.The actors have blooper smirks(!) on their face throughout these scenes even as they're dying. The scene gets resolved with Bruce Willis "John Wayne walking" into the scene with a missile launcher and taking out the brood with an "explosion" that is weaker than a 4th of July kids party. The explosion is so wea(!)but takes out the brood at the extreme ends. LOL! At one point in an earlier scene, the Dr. Smirkingly says "I'm a doctor not a God" when one soldier asks her to fix his friend who's been shot in the head (YES!... Quality screenwriting!)OH YES! I wanna see the Director's Cut and actor commentary!Ok no more piling on the hate. This "movie"(?) is what it is.My prayers go out to Bruce that he comes to his senses and figures out the sunset of his career.
This is just sad, looks like movie made by kids, disaster acting, no story, why they make movie like this?
Why Bruce? This is the worse movie I've ever seen and you're on it!

reviews.review_title: I'm 41 and this is one of the worst films I've ever seen
reviews.content: So much potential from the synopsis, but omg, this was so boring - nothing of note happened, everything was completely vague with no structure or development at all.Bruce Willis is the star, but honestly, this is like a film you make if you've had your whole family kidnapped and threatened with death if you don't do it.Completely, dull, flat, lacking in any development or depth. One of the worst films I've ever seen.Avoid! You have been warned.

Everyone spends too much time "pointlessly" talking about something that you won't even care.Every scene feels emotionless... even Death scene feels rushed as the person who wrote script forgot to add emotions to that scene.Bruce Willis is a Renegade

I thought the worst movie ever would be Green Lantern. I was wrong. This is now the worst movie ever. What could possibly make people sign up for a script like this, with such horrible lines. The acting is completely forced, camera angles, nothing makes any sense in this movie.

This is hardly a B movie. The opening looks promising. But as the movie advances - it all goes downhill. It should take place 500 years from now, but when you see it - it looks like it's about 50 years from now, when there are still automobiles and the medicine is problematic, and of-course soldiers still like to use automatic weapons that fires bullets, and that's BEFORE the bad acting, customs, locations, etc. etc.
I highly recommend not watching this one. Sorry Bruce..Love you !

Are you jobless? Have you been rejected at the school.performance when you were a teenager? Did you ever dream to be a writer but your were constantly failing at school in literature?Don't worry you still have a chance! If they did this film and were able to place it, you can do as well.Probably the producer said "Alexa write me a script for a science fiction movie"I put 3 stars just because the idea of the space travel with the."Robo vest" was funny.

Awesome cast. Everyone had perfect teeth. All the plots shook me to my core. There's love, family members that get sacrificed, the glorious return of a disgrace, and they play lost and found! It had Laser guns, Power Ranger swords, dementors from Askaban, some Tony Stark palladium infection, and even a metal orcish Dr. Zoidberg! What more can you ask for? The Q-Bomb was definitely my favorite character. It's said that some people are still on this planet today (but you didn't hear it from me.) Epic adventure. 10/10: Will become a cult classic.

Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo in a scifi movie with an ominous title and then you start wathing and everthing goes downhill, i acually fell asleep multiple times watching this and didn't bother rewinding to check what i missed by the 1 hour mark i gave up. If zero was possible this movie deserves it.

reviews.review_title: Wow how did this get made?
reviews.content: Started well, good actors, decent set, AND then, they went to a planet, the film lost cohesion. The aliens were ppl in hoodies, they only had a knife yet were the biggest threat to human life? Our humans just shot them, fish in a barrel. Nothing made sense from here, scenes popping up with no reference to anything. What was the young girl in the bar about? From a solid first 10 to the most confusing un resolving mess I have ever witnessed. The directors, editors need to retire.
This movie is more than the tired cliche of bullets and gunfights in future space. It is also poorly acted. I found it unwatchable and I tried. I really tried.

I know, I know, you're thinking "Could it really be that bad?", and "Maybe I should give it a go, and see for myself" and the answers to those questions are 'yes' and 'for the love of God don't'.Performances so bad that one guy actually fails to convey being out of breath. Really? All he had to do was run up and down the stairs a couple of times, instead he looks like he's trying to inflate an invisible balloon.Brucey doesn't give a bad performance, but only because he doesn't even try to act. Instead mumbling disinterestedly through his lines.Can't say I blame him, the script is garbage, the special effects dire, the aforementioned acting would be subpar in a porno (at one point I wasn't sure if there was meant to be a moody silence, or if everyone had forgotten their lines), and the whole thing makes you wonder why anyone involved in the movie bothered turning up.Do yourself a favour, go watch something (anything) else!

The idea of the story is very interesting in my opinion. The costume design and set design are very well done. Although The story is kind of choppy and seems incomplete. Lots of the lines delivered by the actors and actresses seem cut short or to quick with response.There are also lots of pointless scenes. There was a scene out of nowhere or one of the actors talks to a child about sunglasses and nothing comes from it.There also does not seem to be a main character or even an ark for any of the characters.The cinematography is also very cool.

Don't you have enough money to accept roles like that? I am glad I just skipped through the movie, because the 10 minutes I watched in total were absolutely horrible. A set full of amateurs and a fallen action hero who's just there for the pay check.

What a seaming load of 💩, this movie is just terrible. Even if it wasn't all over the place and badly filmed the special effects are just crap.I guess Bruce is trying to get his number of movies his been in up. Give this one a miss.

reviews.review_title: The Japanese Saturday Afternoon horror movies are still better
reviews.content: Very strange movie. Really bad, but it goes really fast. Lots is plot holes too. I'd watch it in a cold rainy Saturday afternoon, just before lunch. Yeap it's a Japanese Sci-Fi movie just not as good.
Terrible movie that fails on almost every level. Confused, rambling mess and poor production quality.
There are 7 deadly sins. This movie just added one more to the list.
I cannot for the life of me say one positive thing about this movie. There is no acting, no plot, no movie. Don't waste your time even clicking on this out of curiosity.

reviews.review_title: Odds on Favorite To Sweep The Razzies
reviews.content: There's some cool stuff in this movie. The idea of the armor they wear is cool, but they do a horrible job with it. At one point in the movie one of the leads looks like he's wearing a Comic-con rookie's stormtrooper store bought costume. The cast seems good enough, even if you consider Bruce Willis past his prime and only looking for a paycheck. Some of the sci-fi stuff is even cool.The execution from top to bottom is absolute horse garbage. I wasn't expecting Armageddon. How this movie got any funding is a great question.It's a very short feature film, I don't it even hit 90 minutes with the credits. Still, it's not worth wasting that much time in. The true cosmic sin would be letting someone else watch this film.

After a wile i was watching this mybe 15-20 minutes... i skip to the end see if they put the good stuff at the end... i was wrong... looks like a bad fan made movie for youtube... people who made this movie should be shame by themselfs..... what a garbage movie.

I gave this 4 stars just on the strenth of the effects and wardrobe, has Bruce Willis fallen on hard times? Was this film wrote by a kid doing a scifi project? Terrable story line whats bits wern't cardboard made no sence..Painful clichés left right and center. Its a shame because they had the budget and with a decent story it would have been a good movie. So glad i didn't pay to see this, it had sci fi eliments that were visially good...So sad about the writing, Edward Drake
Corey Large, "just painfull." you two need to sit in the naughty corner for a year and think about what just you did...
What a Z movie. After 500 years no technical progress can be seen. The film is simply equipped cheaply. Pointless story and really boring. Bruce Willis worst film.

I wanted to like it but Brucie, your days as an action hero we're gone ten years ago. Flabby and tired looking, Willis stumbles along on autopilot and it's a bit sad. He's a great actor but someone needs to guide him to plan 'B', a move to older, deeper characters where he can express his undoubted skills.
Simply terrible.No story, no sense, nothing.I lost 1h my life.I want it back.
No need to waste time writing anything....movie wasted more than enough time of my life...

I mean... If ever there was a term to encompass the scale of how wrong it was to make this garbage... I guess the title says it all.1 star for possible self-aware irony I guess?This is definitely the most disappointing Sharknado sequel yet.
Such a bad movie horrible acting, weird scenes that make no sense expeshaly some of the dialogue.. disaster!!!

Its not bad, like bad awful, can't watch this nonsense bad.Its just lacking. A lot. Its disconnected and plenty meaningless and much unexplained and a great deal that just appears out of nowhere.Which all makes me think this was a 2 and a half hour movie that was deliberately cut down to 1 and a half hours, andf the editor kept the bits he coulnd't get rid of and stitched them all together in a way that leave huge holes here and there that might, perhaps, have turned it into something that might have made more sense.What we do have is a standard sci fi "aliens and man have guns" trope.I'm sure if they had the rest of the movie and released a director's uncut, then it'd be a 5 or 6 out of 10, so don;t get your hopes up that its salvageable, it might have been "meh" instead of bad.
Please don't waste your time watching this. It's not even worth commenting on. The only reason I'm still writing is I have to write a minimum 150 words.

Body snatcher Aliens, snore!Young actors trying way to hard to be 'badass' but look soft and pudgy, yellow hair eyeroll, its more important to look fancy rather than ever be able to use stealth ughg.Ffs this could be a 6-7 maybe even 8 with just a tiny bit of extra time and effort, more time on dialogue, more time on effects, decently threatening aliens that are not human body snatchers, maybe a little mystery and stealth for a horror sci fi effect, cast tough looking people who don't have a big plastic gun that looks like a fairground toy, cast without bright coloured hair giving away there position from a mile away ughg so frustrating.

reviews.review_title: Selling your name was a cosmic sin, Bruce!
reviews.content: Bruce Willis has sold his name and image to be used in this movie. At first i believed that that was a briljant move. Earning money without having to act himself must have looked like very easy money and without any risc.A foolish decision which might prove fatal for his career as this movie is so bad that it defies the human imagination. In some cases using a CGI caracter in a movie becomes essential when the actor dies in real life. That's not the case here, Bruce Willis is stil alive. The acting (if it can be called that) of his CGI duplicate is so terribly bad that it will have a terrible influence on his career.The movie is a complete waste of time due to bad acting all the actors; there's no real story in it, it completely lacks content, structure and explanation.In my opinion "Cosmic Sin" is even worse than "Plan nine from outer space", so it's best to keep away from it.
Slow pace with no action or substance. Third grade Hollywood. Bruce Willis may have done it just for the money. Total crap. Without any proper plot and all acting is just dumb.

This film makes Plan 9 from Outer Space look good.This film doesn't even earn the classification of a B grade film with an A grade budget. I wonder if the only reason Willis did it was because he was bored, which is what he looked for most of the film.

reviews.review_title: It's 2021, how does this pass review??
reviews.content: How does something like this get past a producer? Who sat down and said: "yeah this looks great, let's release it". I've seen better student productions. What a shame.

reviews.review_title: Don't waste an hour and half your time watching this. I'm sure you've better things to do....
reviews.content: Sorry Bruce and cast, but this was appalling the only space this movie didn't occupy was the cutting room floor, where it belongs....

Bad, bad, bad!
Some costumes look like they are bad copies from Edge og Tomorrow, others like they are bad copies from Lord Of Rings, like they are made of plastic from PRC.
Story is unoriginal and incoheren with a lot of skipping.
Acting wasn't as bad (at least from Bruce Willis, others were not good) as everything else is (story, lines, directing and production). To much untalented extras with baaaad actong skills.
This movie is everything but a blockbuster, it's maybe patient-buster because I was so impatient to see it end.
Everything seems washed out, extremely low budget, already seen and C rated at best. You have a lot of student sci-fi movies filmed much better than this.
Hahahhahahahahah.Quarantine really got to these guys.

Anyone who has taken an English or writing class at any level of education will have had the "show, don't tell" mantra drilled into their skulls...but whoever wrote this drivel must have skipped pretty much every lesson. The whole movie people marvel about how much of a legendary badass murderer James Ford (WIllis) is, but it's literally never shown. Nothing about his acting, his lines, or the scenes he's in demonstrate why, exactly, he's the "bloody general." Well, unless you count firing a bazooka with less impact than WW2 counterpart at about fifty feet in a room.The entire movie is directed like a commercial or video game trailer. There are so many great shots with really (and I mean REALLY) good special effects that are framed well and accompanied by meaty, impactful sounds. But spliced between these interesting sequences are minutes and minutes of exposition with dialog that doesn't flow whatsoever. In fact, the whole plot is just five minutes stretched into ninety with almost all filler. The fact Cosmic Sin could be edited down to trailer-length and it would improve the experience a billion times is just sad.And yeah, like most low-budget VODs, Bruce and Frank have about fifteen minutes screen time between them.

What an enormous piece of sh..Guys financing that sort of movies should be banned fm film industry or give the same amount of $ to various charities so we may consider forgiving them.Guys making that sort of movies should spend couple weeks listening to to Trump explaining how he won the elections (kinda cruel right ?)Guys acting in that sort of movies...well...gotta make a living, sure for most of the crew....Now as to to Mr Willis: wtf is wrong with you ? Some producer has pictures of you hitting pandas and threatened to release them if you were not part of the cast ?
What's unforgiving is that you did another film with Mr Edward Drake called "Breach" which is already rated from bad to suicide inducing.
Why again ?Cosmic sin it is
Thoroughly enjoyed it. Always love me some Bruce Willis. Legend.

Ok, watched it. Which says something. It wasn't so bad I turned it off but I'll never get that time back. It felt like watching a mediocre 1980s sci fi movie. No redeeming features- if it was worse it might be funny but it's just meh.Don't bother.

As most of you already know, as of late Bruce has been in some pretty bad (but hilarious!) B level movies, such as: First kill, Hard kill, Survive the night, Breach and my personal favorite, Trauma Center. If you ever need a good laugh or feeling down, I recommend watching this movie. Trauma Center will make you laugh till it hurts. All his current movies have low rent, substandard acting, atrocious facial expressions, the plot is always dead weight and never makes any type of sense. No character development whatsoever, bad bad bad special effects. The list continues. But yet you are glued to the television to see how bad it truly can get. Also, his movies recently have something else in common. Frank Grillo, Chad Michael Murray and Bruce Willis performing like he is three sheets the wind. Does he show up to work on set drunk?? And on the day of filming he finally reads his script for the first time and in 10 minutes they start shooting the film?? Bruce has lost it. It's quite sad but it's hilarious. He has terrible facial expressions, acts like he doesn't want to be there and he is in these movies for about 10-15 minutes! Cosmic sin is the same exact way. Frank Grillo (who's a bad as* in the purge movies) went full Bruce Willis mode and acted drunk with terrible facial expressions and acted like he didn't even want to be there. Everyone in Cosmic Sin including CJ Perry a.k.a Lana from the wwe is absolute garbage in this film and is a terrible actress. 25 minutes into this movie I fell asleep. That should say something, right? It made zero sense. The special effects were laughable and it seemed like they were designed and produced by a kindergartner. The director, producer, and whoever wrote the screenplay should feel absolutely embarrassed that this disaster film was even made. But yet, I look forward to the next disaster in the Bruce Willis catalog. So, if you ever need a laugh, feeling sad, or even feeling miserable, I recommend watching this film or any of his recent films. I look forward to the day Bruce Willis and Nick Cage star in a movie together. Talk about classic!

reviews.review_title: I guess Bruce Willis lost a bet?
reviews.content: This thing is a mess. Hard to follow even with all the sci fi cliches. And the "aliens" look like Star Wars cosplayers. I'm assuming Bruce Willis either lost a bet or owed a favor to get dragged into this mess. Avoid this at all costs.

reviews.review_title: 90 minutes of my life I'll never get back!
reviews.content: Possibly the worst Sci-Fi movie ever made. The plot was awful, the acting was astoundingly dreadful and if it were possible to choose just one movie in your life to unwatch then this would be it. I'd rather try and pass a hedgehog through my internal organs and then slowly squeeze it out than watch this dreadful excuse for entertainment again. Truly awful.
Just a terrible film. Aliens sucked, part zombie. Watch if you want to waste your time!
Reading the reviews where more entertaining than the actual movie.

Is that really Bruce Willis? Did he have a stroke or is it CGI Bruce - or did they just put a gun to his head? Does the female sniper really lug around a 20 foot long sniper rifle that shoots regular sniper bullets when shooting humanoids but can down fighter craft? Why! How do such stupid aliens (dumber than us and we're so dumb it seems contrived for a plot twist) build an inter dimensional portal that spans 680k light years only to let us blow it up with what amounts to a firecracker after letting us send a super nuke through. Oh sorry I spoiled it. Can such rot be spoiled? I mean - nobody reads these to see if they should see a movie. It's not like it's an actual movie we'd pay for at a theater. We come to see if we're crazy. Attack of the killer tomatoes has better acting. The plot could easily have been written during a morning crap. The shaky darkened cinematography wasn't fooling anyone as to the budget or scale of the lack of action or effects. Ok enough.

I have to ask, has Bruce Willis sold his soul? Is he that desperate for roles / cash that he has to stoop this low? I rarely switch off movies half way through but this was one of those times. Beyond awful would be an understatement! The script, effects, acting and editing were just terrible. Set 500 years into the future, it seems we still drive around in pickup trucks, have exactly the same weaponry and pitch tents on alien planets! We also have absolutely zero containment procedures in place for returning space explorers, who have OBVIOUSLY been contaminated with some kind of extraterrestrial virus (haven't we learned anything from Covid-19?) and just stick them in the shower room. The list goes on but after 45 minutes, I couldn't stand it anymore. How this trash was even funded is beyond anyone with half a brain cell. Please. No more Bruce, this is so far from your glory days, you might as well be on that distant planet.

The acting isn't the best but it has some good special and practical effects. The narrative does drift from time to time. It also takes a lot of leaps in logic and doesn't show or tell many that do need it. I did find the idea that they are shooting through space in jump suits when they have large spacecraft passing them in a war is a bit laughable. Aside from that, their is effort in the movie. They did do deep dives into the military and the practical side of soldiering as well as the ethics of war. Bruce Willis was believable as a disgraced and traumatized general still not his best but way better than others.
