It's not about a disaster, but the movie it self is a complete disaster! Don't waste your time on this. There are plenty of better SciFi's out there, who actually have a plot and decent actors.

Full disclaimer, I didn't even finish the movie. So for what that's worth. I just couldn't get through it. I started to push myself, I hate leaving things unfinished. But then, I thought, why? What's the point? It's not going to get better. Will I feel good for having finished it? No, I decided. And that was that.It's too bad really. I love a sci-fi/space movie, so I tend to be quite lenient with them. Having said that, this one: terrible.The acting was okay. Not great. Some terrible spots. Bruce wasn't good. At all. Most others were just okay. Shoot, even the story might have been okay. But the screenplay was just bad. Bad dialogue. Bad scenes. I had a bad feeling when the movie opened up with like 5 F-bombs (just to be clear, I personally have absolutely no issue with bad language). Nothing screams "I'm trying to be an edgy film, you better take me seriously!" like opening up with 5 F-bombs. Ugh. And Bruce. I don't know if he needed some beer money, or this was a personal favor to a friend or something, but I would have figured a quick pass through the script and he would have been like "Nope." But not the case. I attribute his wooden, "I don't care" acting to the fact that he must have agreed without reading the script, saw what he got himself into, figured it was too late to back out, so phoned in his lines.And then right at the beginning when the alien-human things land in the ship (I'm not listing this as a spoiler since it's literally like 20 min into the movie) at the base, and there is literally no containment or ANYTHING between the 5 people that showed up for First Contact (seriously - this is supposed to be a BIG DEAL, First Contact, and there are like 5 people there for it?) so of course when the alien-humans start killing people there is no containment, no quarantine. Just everyone right there, all ready to be infected or something. It's just simply stupid. It's lazy writing, it's clear that the plot requires it for Edgy F-bomb Action and Awesome Gun Shootings. It's terrible. Completely unbelievable.So I gave up. It's not worth the time to finish. But hey, it's nice to know people are driving what appear to be gas powered Jeeps 500 years in the future. Seriously, it's set 500 years in the future (FIVE. HUNDRED. YEARS.!) and the cars they drive on roads look exactly like what you see today. I weep for the future.Give this one a miss. Trust me. Unless you are studying bad films or something.

reviews.review_title: How did this movie ever come to be?
reviews.content: The question that came to mind after the first 5 minutes of this. I admit. Bruce Willis was the only reason I considered watching this. But with a number of actors I did not recognize, and had all the markers of being a low budget looking film. Hmm... Bruce must have been bored and needed something to do and was paid a big chunk of change to do this or was doing a favor for someone trying to get their foot in the door of the film industry.As others stated, the advancement of humans and technology nowhere matched what one would expect for the time period set for this movie. This looks like it is set in say... the year 1994 with the exception of the space crafts.I've seen more futuristic characters, imaginative set designs, makeup, wardrobe and creativity in 22+ year old films like "the 5th Element","the Matrix", "Alien"; a 42 year old movie which STILL holds its own and let us not forget "2001: A Space Odyssey" released in 1968 - a now 53 year old film.All this film delivered were a multitude of recognizable rip-offs from dozens of 90's sci-fi films and TV shows with a script sounding like it was written by a teenager and a forgettable story.Poor direction combined with horrible dialogue and poor acting make for a tedious film watching experience.Any moments that should be suspenseful fall flat and there's no chemistry between any of the actors. It almost feels as if they are all doing a dry run of the script while being filmed and in costume. Deaths and "shoot-em-up" scenes somehow lack any emotion, tension, or gravity; for me they evoked the same emotions as if I were watching a group of people standing in line waiting to check out at the grocery store. I was actually just distracted from the film just now by a number of birds that just flew past our office window and into a bush in the neighbor's yard - "What's going on!" I exclaimed. "8 sparrows just flew into a bush across the street into the same spot!" - "I wonder what's in there and what's going on?". Sorry, now back to my review - which I'm doing while sort of watching the film, but not really, anymore... as I've lost complete interest in it.Is there truly no imagination left in the film industry? This isn't the only piece of waste out there that somehow made it from script to screen instead of going to the scrap heap where it belongs. I'm sorry for being so harsh, but I just don't know how this movie ever came to be.This is definitely one of those films where one would say "That's 43 minutes of my life that I can't get back." *I started doing other things due to how bad this film was, so all told, I saw about 43 minutes of the film.Sorry guys, I'm going to give this a HUGE thumbs down.Save yourself the time and invest your time doing anything other than watching this. You've been warned!

Every scene in this moves makes you ask the question: "Why would anyone want this scene to be in any movie?"Everything the actors say makes you ask the question: "Why would anyone say anything like that, ever?"Just find something else to watch, like drying paint or something.

reviews.review_title: Unbelievable, like a field experiment of making a horrible movie
reviews.content: I could probably write hundred pages detailing why this is definitely one of the worst movies of all time, but I just make it short: "Cosmic Sin" is intergalactic trash.

reviews.review_title: Are you kidding Me??? making this movie was a Cosmic Sin
reviews.content: Another low-quality, low-budget film starring Bruce Willys (who doesn't speak more than 5 words per dialogue) and a host of decadent actors and other strangers who won't make it to the Oscar. A series of soldiers in Plastic Armor who plant a bomb to prevent an alien invasion ... The most interesting thing about the film is to see a 1.70 m tall woman with braided hair, carry and handle a 2.20 m long weapon easier than Harry Potter's wand. I don't understand how the producers plan to make this movie a box office.
Breaks my heart and makes me want to start a GoFundMe for Bruce willis.The movie is so cheap they couldn't even afford to show aliens in a movie about aliens.It's a tragedy not a sci-fi.

If you're looking for something with decent sci fi effects and costumes and no plot (or twelve disjointed plots) this is passable. If you're looking for an actual science fiction movie with characters and plot, look elsewhere.Honestly this movie would have been better on mute as a background visual overall than as a movie I attempted to watch. Stilted dialogue, incredibly implausible plot points, and disjointed action leaves you wondering where at the writers table or on the cutting room floor the movie failed to get put together in a cohesive manner.

reviews.review_title: Its so bad, bad and ones more bad
reviews.content: Poorly written screenplay, poorly written characters. Everything is poorly done in this movie. Don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: We wanted Halo we got Cosmic Shame
reviews.content:
Let me first start by saying I had looked forward to this film. The potential of a franchise launching opportunity was there. The right cast was hired, and the story had potential.I can only assume that director Edward Drake never believed in it, or was looking simply for a quick paycheck. I can say Drakes career can only go up from here.The acting is sloppy, the dialog is 1999. The CGI had to been purchased off Fiverr to reduce costs. What could have been super cool the battle armor, was cosplay if you had a good budget but not skill. The scene where they try and put on their helmets was absolutely painful. They had to cut scene it because the actors could not get it on.As I said by the title we wanted Halo, we had hoped for a character to charm us like Master Chief. Nope. Instead we got a old grizzled character that we are introduced getting drunk and ends getting drunk. So everything in between is a hangover...which would explain the dialog or lack of.I would have like to cheer for some of the characters, but honestly they all could have died and we would have not noticed. The really only important person is the Engineer that everyone constantly puts down. Nice stereotyping in 2500.This is such a bad flick most reviewers never got past the first 20 minutes. I stayed for the whole thing, but wanted to fast forward after 15. This flick will be forgotten by end of the week, but it could have been amazing. I wonder if what was dropped on the cutting room floor could have made it better.One star for making it to the box office
the second star for having the occasional pithy line or reference.

I did not consult any of the available reviews before watching this.... Euh B-movie.Although it had a promising start and a few good scenes and special effects, as a SF fan this was disappointing. A missed opportunity to make a good movie. A little flat acting except from the "wrench" which in my opinion was the best in the whole movie. Bruce was very flat. There were also some really dull and dead moments. Although the special effects were okay the "earth" looked like it is today so I didn't have the feeling of 2500 or so (time period of the movie).Overall I can not recommend this, a waste of valuable time. B-movie is perhaps even overrated while it could have been so much better. If they would make a sequel (and there is enough in this to do that) then please, please, please get in a better scenario writer....
Rushed and unfinished, cut and paste scenes which make no sense. I expected more from a Willis movie.

Set in 2524, 500+ years ahead of the time when I write this review, this movie is a waste of time.We discovered FTL travel, we have colonies, but Earth is still the same. We wear same clothes, drive same vehicles, listen to the same music, use same weapons.Jean-Luc Picard would facepalm right about now.Skip this movie, please. It is HORRIBLE in every aspect.

I really wanted this to be good. Finally some sifi video game action from something like the game "halo".But it was ruined. The worst part THE SCRIPT was just awful. I love comedic lines like from schwarzenegger movies. But 30 min into the film I find myself begging the characters to stop because I just can't cringe any more (But they dont). And the story feels so rushed it makes absolutely no sense (so many questions). I could go on to include the directing as well but I just want to forget I ever saw this out of respect for Bruce Willis.

reviews.review_title: Another Dud from the Willis Production Line
reviews.content: BW must now not even bother to read scripts before agreeing to do them, this at best was awful (& this from someone who defended Sky One's Intergalactic). Clinched, Poor GCI & Props, Even Frank Grillo must have thought that this Turkey was a step back to his pre Purge work.I can see why this went straight to Netflix as no one would pay good money to see this in the cinema... Bruce should retire & let us remember Die Hard, Pulp Fiction & 12 Monkeys not Pap like this.

This movie had potential but fell flat. It could of been at least a 5 out of 10 movie but ended up being a strong 2/10. Bruce Willis just stands around and says some one liners, and all the people that can kind of actually act are killed off, with the exception of the of technician. If she stays away from movies like this, you may see her in future movies.

reviews.review_title: From someone who worked with many props
reviews.content: Just a side note, what makes this movie confusing is Willis and Grillo. This would be a fine sci fi attempt as a budget movie, but having two mega stars brings to light they had money and seemed to use it all on these two.Props: So having being in the prop world for a very long time. In movies using polyvinyl (pvc) is almost a dead method, except for budget movies. Everything from their armour to weapons look like plastic, and no matter the skill of the artist you can't really be convinced it's metal. Willis armour is probably painted the bettern painted due to the use of colour. But everyone else's literally looks like plastic and even with the "clang" sound effects you can tell they're moving in plastic. Where I was done is the small woman carrying a 2 metre futuristic 50 cal sniper with one hand. It bounces around like it's made of foam. It doesn't help keep you convinced this world is real. Also at one point the enemy is carrying a sword and it literally looks like a foam sword used for casting. It's not even slightly convincing or menacing.CGI: Given the horrible props the CGI was actually quite good! I would have rather see CGI armour, while not a preferred practice I think it would have helped.Story: literally couldn't keep up or understand wtf was happening Haha. It was a choppy ridiculous mess.

It deeply made me want to replay StarCraft 2.Bruce Willis NAIIIIIILS his Jim Raynor impression.What I most enjoyed is the fact that story has nothing new to offer. That way, I don't have to use my brain to watch the movie. That saved me a lot of headaches, trying to figure stuff out, and keep track of any kind of story.The little girl with sunglasses needs to learn to act, though!

reviews.review_title: It's so bad, I thought I was watching a Nicolas Cage Movie
reviews.content: Gosh Brucey, another epic fail. What's going on dude? In order for a movie to be a movie, there needs to be a story, good actors and a half decent director This has none! What's going on with Hollywood man, total rubbish time after time.

It makes 'Doom' seem like 'Saving Private Ryan.'The dialogue is wretched. The direction is abysmal. Bruce Willis is bored, and boring-he's uninspired, and barely conscious. The fx are awful. The score sounds like it was composed by Steely Dan and Rammstein on a ketamine bender. The soundtrack is worse than Trent Reznor overseeing Mickey Cyrus torturing Nickelback. The climax is awful-a dude kills the alien final boss to the sounds of a reverberating harmonica. Frank Grillo is a turnip. It makes 'Ghosts of Mars' seem like 'Tombstone.' It makes Adam Sandler's 'The Longest Yard' seem like 'Rudy.' It makes 'Leonard, Part Six' seem like 'Star Wars.' It makes 'Mambo No. 5' seem like the Jupiter Symphonies. It makes Li'l Yachty seem like Rakim. It makes The Teletubbies seem like the 'Reservoir Dogs.' It makes Caillou seem like van Damme. It makes the Care Bears seem like the Avengers. It is the god to whom the watery turds we expel from our sphincters with shame and relief, pray most devoutly. It makes Pauly Shore seem like the Bruce Willis of yore. It makes Dane Cook seem like Dave Chapelle. It is malignant, evil, an abomination to be put down with more prejudice than Ol' Yeller. It is a rabid, flea-bitten, worm-infested, zombie dog like the ones in Resident Evil. Flee from it. Guard your recording devices. Purge your streaming services. Hide yo kids, hide yo wife, hide yo husband, because ain't nobody got time for this stuff.Wu-Tang is indeed for the children, but this? It is destined to be played in the anteroom of hell.It besmirches me to talk about it yet I make that sacrifice for you.Call the exorcist, baby. GET OUT!!!!Heed me. I watched this for YOU, so you wouldn't have to.I imagine being turked by a syphylitic bear to be more enjoyable.You have been warned.

The credits are rolling as I write this.I don't actually understand what I've just watched - like an alien virus or something, and their leader was Bruce Willis' ex, but then they surrendered after some random pulse gun from earth shot something at them?Absolutely awful film, the continuity errors and editing are shameful, and the storyline makes no sense.Avoid!
All you boomers hating on Bruce Willis for enjoying what he does need to get over it. The movie was actually really good.

The only reason I've watched it in spite of the bad (rightfuly) reviews is because it was masterd in HDR10+ and we (Samsung owners) dont get alot of these. The movie is straight forward and boring, acting could have been worse, and the visuals are not half bad, this movie is decent for testing your UHD TV.

Hey, Bruce is there for a check...I get it. However, the dumpster fire that is every second of the movie demands explanation. I can't believe anyone allowed their name to be in the credits. I'm speechless.
This train wreck is very poorly written. The characters are akward at best. After 20 minutes I decided to continue watching just to how bad it would get. It did not disappoint...

reviews.review_title: University Film Students Make a C-Grade Space Movie!
reviews.content: It seems that Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo were somehow conned into appearing in this low-budget, C-grade movie, that was obviously made by less-than-talented University "Film" students. The script is often cringeworthy, nonsensical and cliche, and the lighting, makeup, costumes and supporting cast are really not much better. The sound and occasional CGI scenes are OK, so I'll award one star for that, plus one star for Frank Grillo and the final star goes to Bruce Willis. Unfortunately, nothing else in this movie deserves a star. I actually feel very generous giving this movie this 3 stars. TLDR: It's not great.

reviews.review_title: Please use a Q bomb on me...
reviews.content: This movie is as bad as Starship Troopers was. A truly terrible movie. Bruce must of needed the money. I'm willing to look past a lot of bad smell from a SCI_FI flic, I love the genre but this movie should not have been made.I wish I could give this trite piece of nonsense zero stars.

reviews.review_title: Cosmic Sin - Yes it is a sin.
reviews.content: This movie is horrible, in all imaginable ways. The duo Edward Drake and Corey Large seems to have some deal with Bruce Willis and i guess its plain and simple. "Bruce, i get to direct the movie, Corey gets a part in it and you get 90% of the budget as pension money. Sounds good?"The movie is supposed to take place 500 years into the future. But nothing feels futuristic. Actually the feeling is rather that civilization taken steps back, and some generals and ex generals takes some decisions of erradicating a alien civilization without running it past the government. The future technology has no thought behind it, and seems just play a part in giving the author to this movie loop holes to build their story around.Why Bruce Willis takes part in this crap is beyond me. Once he was a somewhat regarded actor, but perhaps the deal i described above is too good to turn down.Nothing makes sense, not the scenery, not the acting, not the plot or the fact that aliens apparently prefeer to use spears and swords when attacking hoomans with automatic weaponry. Drake, Large and Willis has more projects going on, and my only lingering question is who the fxxx finance this crap? Does Drake or Large have rich family? I cant think Bruce finance any of it. And im not suggesting it has a big budget, but still some money have to gone into it and that is baffling.Dont waste your time on this one. The only reason to watch it is to see how utterly worthless it is as a movie.The only sin here is that the movie was made to begin with.

reviews.review_title: I swear this is "The Room" of sci-fi movies
reviews.content: This movie is so astonishing in the fact that it failed in every single aspect that can make a sci-fi film enjoyable. Story? Bland, uninspired, confusing, and pointless. Characters? Everyone is so forgettable that I forgot Bruce Willis was a character in the movie while he was on screen. Costume design? I've seen high school plays with better quality of costume designs. Prop designs? None of their weaponry make sense in any way shape or form. Cool space/alien battles? Not a damn one, action scenes are supposed to look cool and get your blood pumping however this movie's action scenes made me just want to take an 8-hour energy to stay awake for 1 minute.This movie absolutely the largest waste of time ever.

reviews.review_title: Is it possible to give 0 stars?
reviews.content: This movie is so appropriately named, it is in fact a Cosmis Sin to have made this.It is a first attempt at movie making at a grade school level. And that was being generous.Bruce Willis, please let a consenting adult of sound mind make decisions on which roles you take from here on out.I mean to address the other people in this movie as "actors" would be another cosmic sin.I watched about 2/3 of this when I realized I would rather run into a brick wall head first repeatedly than watch another minute of this.How do you go from. Die Hard, The Fifth Element, Unbreakable to this gibberish? I only hope they paid you so much that it ate into the movies budget so they couldn't hire writers, cinematographers, editors, directors.....

reviews.review_title: A new Star Wars but avec Covid budget :)
reviews.content: That is a new Star Wars film ! But as in the Covid times we all need to be a bit more patient- this one is -300% worse than anything we are used to see.Have just spent 5 euros on paid channel to see that piece of cake.Never ever regretted 5 euros so badly.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I've seen in a very long time.
reviews.content: Cosmic sin is a great name for this movie because making a movie this bad is not just a regular sin it's a sin on a cosmic scale. This movie was absolute garbage. There was no continuity with the storyline. Special effects were terrible. The aliens were just regular people. Nothing in this movie is worth watching.
No one here is lying. There are better things to waste an hour and a half on.
Holy moly. I'll sit through anything sci-fi. I love Bruce Willis. This was really bad. Not in a good way. Definitely a one and done. At least it's not very long.

This movie is so bad!
So much talking about rubbish, weird scenes, no storyline, bad acting, ect ect! It's so bad it's laughable!

Ok, for 500 years into the future things on earth look exactly the same as they do in 2022. I find it strange that nothing has changed or evolved. Still driving the tired gas guzzlers on the same freeways, talking on the same old phones of the past (2022), even the guns are the exact same. I'm only 5 minutes into this show, I've seen enough. Honestly I think Bruce Willis should have thought long and hard before agreeing to do this movie. It's that awful.
How does Bruce Willis go from making Die Hard & Pulp fiction to this absolute rubbish.This film is so so bad.I've nothing more to say.

I wish I could give ZERO star! they should really bring this option.WHY? why did you make this movie? what is the point? why wasting time, money, and energy for such a terrible, terrible movie? it is just sad to see Bruce Willis in such a movie.

If a film, is so bad, It makes you want to pull you're own eyeballs out, then this is the winner!Bruce stop...... if you can't get a good role, 20 bad ones does not solve it, it just stops you're fans wanting to see you!Even Frank Grillo was better than you, and he's not even an actor!

reviews.review_title: Please don't waste your time, I'm begging you!
reviews.content: As a fan or Bruce Willis.As a fan of Sci-Fi space movies.This has got to be one of the worse movie I have ever seen.I checked the review prior to watching it, how bad could it be, it got Bruce Willis, he wouldn't sign on to do F movies (if there is such a thing).Oh man!!!...Did I just wasted 88 mins of my life, maybe not the whole 88 mins since half of the time was spent cruising through social medias, waiting for something to happen.I'm gonna blame the executive producers who green lighted this movie, damn it! It's that bad.

reviews.review_title: Um.... Wow... The first alien movie that gives permission to kill them all??
reviews.content: This is a perfect example of when you can have all the ingredients for an awesome dish except a pot to stir it together with....Good cast, good alien concept, awesome space suits, etc. But honestly have no clue what this was about in the slightest... Aliens that want war so just kick their ass??? Like what???
Could be the worst movie ever. Every scene is disjointed. Acting is as bad as the script, screenplay, and cinematography. And what is with those space suits???

Y'all. I get the reviews. I do.My dad was a B-F movie lover and he would have absolutely adored this.With a budget like this. Spent mainly on cast and effects. I thought they kind of outdid themselves.Are there plot gaps? Yes. Continuity errors? Yes. Goofs? Yes.I actually want to give a thumbs up to the costume department for working with what they had. "This is supposed to be the future?" Well working with what they had...yes.I would rate this a B flick. So if you are interested in a B sci-fi movie go for it. By all means you'll understand the hate, but you should also understand why not to hate it.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: Bruce Willis has lost his ability to act in action movies. This movie is one of the worst movies I have ever seen and Willis performance is one of his worst performances. The movie has a very weak and flawed story, the actors performance is bad and the filming is bad. I would not recommend paying a single penny to watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: A story with great potential but relied on filler to make it a feature film
reviews.content: It carried my interest just enough to finish it but it suffers from what many great conceptual low rating films do. Whether it was budget constraints or lack of depth in story line; it relied heavily on slowing down events with off topic scenes or painfully illogical dialogue and rationale of characters. I get it, everyone has a job to do to tie scenes together and make a product. But it shows that they were stretching to meet the minute mark and that's a shame; it would have done amazingly well as a short film or 2 part mini series. I'm sure that was denied by their funding and producers.

I enjoy Sci-Fi films, sometimes even "low-budget" flicks because they can provide a "once-in-a-while" dive into something that hasn't been thought up. Some independent studios create excellent digital shorts pertaining to Sci-Fi, so I try to give many of these movies a chance. The best part, from my perspective, is that Sci-Fi can provide a deep and interesting framework from which they derive an engaging story, even with a low budget.This film failed to provide the deep and engaging material that one hopes for in a Sci-Fi movie. The scenes were rushed, thrown together, leaving the viewer asking way too many questions about how things ended up the way they were or blatantly laughing at the lack of thought put into the plot. It was empty-feeling, failing to draw me into the film. Perhaps others will experience something different, but this was not a well-made movie. Corny dialogue plagued the film, along with major jumps in the plot or setting with characters just showing up without much explanation.Dialogue - 2/10
Special FX - 7/10
Plot Depth - 1/10Overall - 2/10I did not enjoy watching this film.
This was such a painful experience I stopped ten minutes in, rated it , removed it from my listings & wrote this review,there's a first for everything & let's not do this again.

Wasted about 35 minutes of my life thinking it had to get better, it didn't. The acting is terrible, the plot or lack of is terrible and the computer generated graphics are some of the worst I've seen, don't waste your time.

I cannot believe absolute trash like this gets signed off by studios. I was amazed the writer is an adult and even more amazed to see Bruce Willis is on board to do not one but FOUR films with Edward Drake. What is going on?It is rare I watch a film without reading any reviews, big mistake. My love of sci-fi and a fondness for Bruce got the better of me. I am not sure this even qualifies as so bad it's funny, it is so bad please do not waste your time.

Stilted dialogue, no cast chemistry, thin on plot, low budget sets, costumes and effects. I've seen better home made storm trooper Halloween costumes than these "soldiers" are wearing. Willis phones it in for the paycheck. How could you pimp yourself out like this, Bruce? Who do you think you are? Nick Cage?

One star.I never write reviews. This movie is so bad it needed one. Literally watch any other Bruce Willis film- I guarantee you'll see more of him in the first half hour than you would watching this mess. Guess they couldn't afford for him to have much screen time.Absolute total garbage. The acting, plot, sound (the music pretty much never fit the scene) and the set was all a cringe fest. It's fine if you're going into it with the idea that it's going to be a bad movie. Actually, scratch that. My husband and I knew it was going to be bad and we could barely stand it.Find something else to watch.

reviews.review_title: I forced myself to finish it
reviews.content: This could have been a potentially good movie but it quickly falls flat, it's the 26th century and they are still driving cars and using firearms yet they have fancy suits that have a force field face mask, the "armor" looks cheap like it's just a thin layer of blow mold plastics and styrofoam, the acting was sub par for Willis (knowing what you know about his health in 2023 you can see it) by the end I was just wanting it to end, no surprises I saw it all coming, the last 20 minutes seemed like a lot of filler shots to fill time and was unnecessary, if your storyline is this poor take a tip from the 80s and have gratuitous nudity for no reason.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies ever made
reviews.content: Please don't disrespect it by giving it a 1/10. It's close to -5 in story, editing, acting, but it's a 11 at heart. This is not a bad movie, per say. It's a masterpiece in how awful it is in every department. I don't know a studio can get such a cast, such a CGI crew and fail monumentally in making the film. The acting looks like a workshop rehearsal, although all the CG is top-notch stuff. Watch it if you had a bad day in office, had an argument with spouse, or if your favourite team lost in a sport to your least favourite team. This movie washes away all sorrow in how bad it is. A true idol of this generation. You'll find yourself asking if it's worth being showcased in a museum or give diarrhea to a swamp full of alligators. No one knows for sure. One thing is for certain: it's one of those generational movies that you'll take to your grave.

reviews.review_title: Another Willis movie nott worth seeing!
reviews.content: So sad that he went from an A actor with top billings to accepting lame roles like this. At least the last few movie from him haven't been worth watching.Since I wasted 1 1/2 hour of my time sitting through the whole movie, I'm not going to say a lot. And there's not much to say anyway. This movie bounced all over the place...very hard to follow what and why things were happening. The background sound made the speech hard to hear as well.

To proclaim this as a (DvD), movie masterpiece, would streach anyone's mental capability.Amidst last 4 of 12, (since 2018 for Willis), this Sci-Fantasy film, shows every hallmark of being drastically under prepared once the principle actors were informed of the Pandemic restrictions pending & whole production went into 3 takes only mode.Around which some of the world's fastest editing must have been given only most rudimentary quality control.Real challenge for viewers is to comprehend the plot, and where the movie develops some creative purpose.It's production features elements akin to being a poorly realised 'Steam-Punk', story ineptly re-styled towards a convention centre cos-play re-enactment.Considering the strong evocation of themes within 'Edge of Tomorrow' and corresponding good visuals of Bruce and Frank, in enhanced armour; yet devoid of any true nihilist wit, the weakness surely resides with having a bland script.Putting aside, the main cast, manages to elevate slightly roles that would otherwise go completely ignored. Short co-star parts are common in established sci-fi / action films (especially female), and we are granted here two contrasting women co-stars that have to be given attention otherwise you miss key movie themes.Action scenes vary from generic to plain idiotic, so we can only hope stunt people attached get granted a hefty sympathy vote towards their next projects.Lastly, the soundtrack. Yes, it actually has one. Again, with contracted time involved, sound engineering must've been stressed to amass most basic of effects, such that during the few tracks played through scenes barely any emotional synchronicity can be found.With minimal scenes, the movies bankable featured actor, actually doesn't do himself any harm, nor favours. Placing Bruce's performance firmly aligned with 'Last Man Standing', just below 'Armageddon'.Overall - A par-boiled and half plucked turkey, that stands a slender chance of being that elusive future un-discovered stars mythical rare gem.

Its official, Bruce Willis is now a B-Grade actor.I dont know where to start, I just want to write something here to save someone the trouble of pressing play on this movie.I think this will amount to 150 characters now.

reviews.review_title: It's SIN to waste money producing this
reviews.content: If you wonder how many bad actors they could put into one movie? This one is your answer. Non stop disappointment every movie recently with Bruce Willis name in it. Time to retire Bruce, or you may need up die hard in viewers' reviews.

If there was a 0 rating I'd use it. Complete trash, acting is horrible, story is horrible, execution even worse. I completely lost any respect for Bruce Willis, why not retire as being remembered for your great action flicks, instead of stepping into yet another pile of doodoo like this one. SMH

This is the second recent Sci Fi movie I have seen on Netflix from Bruce Willis and both are awful. Especially this one! Why Bruce? Why make this awful toilet bowl mess when you have so many good movies behind you. Writing is super snot, Acting is as comfortable as a wet fart. Argh!!!!!

Fantastic movie, no bull, no tropes, very interesting story, great cast and acting. You are not privy to a ton of info on the bad guys but that's ok because the story is from humans prospective. More than a few times I though the movie would go for a usual boring cliches but they did not which is refreshing. . I really want to see a sequel! Going into my collection.

This might, no, this IS the worst movie I have ever seen. It was basically a Joe Biden speech, constantly losing focus on the main point, whatever that might have been, and trailing off into another dimension. Everyone in this movie should be ashamed, and fire their agents immediately. I hope nothing bad happens to Bruce Willis before he makes another movie, you wouldn't want this piece of crap being your 'legacy' film.The whole movie felt like a bunch of kids dropped acid, had a bad trip, then tried to recall their trip on paper thinking anybody else would be interested in hearing about it. Costumes were some party city leftovers, the original star trek did a better job of making space look real, and the CGI if you want to call it that could been created by a first year student.All in all, I feel sorry for anybody else who takes the time too watch this abomination. I hope the writers/producers have a back up career...

reviews.review_title: Its a Sin it was made
reviews.content: Bruce must have gone senile or really need to cash. Bad plot ,Bad script supported by really bad acting . If i'd spent to time having my nose hair waxed it would have been less painful.

reviews.review_title: Not good, not great, not worth watching
reviews.content: That's time I just can't get back in my life.Disjointed, lacklustre and mind-numbing my boring would all be better descriptions than this film deserves.If you're into sci-fi and want a good action movie to watch, choose anything but this snooze-fest.Frank Grillo and Bruce Willis steal a living in this movie.Avoid.
Who's back yard was this filmed in? It's taken B Grade to a whole new level. An obvious fail in covid! Not only is it bad acting but clearly a very young child wrote the script..
This must be someone lost a bet or someone owed a HUGE favour.No plot, no plausible characters and cinematography is a joke.I have seen film-school projects much better than this tbh.

reviews.review_title: If you liked Shadow in the Cloud you will love this movie.
reviews.content: Not a good movie. I wish I had read the reviews before sitting through this. Shame on you Netflix for bringing this to my family room.

The only sin here was whoever decided to fund this garbage. Bad acting with terrible writing and no storyline. Honestly, I wouldn't both unless your a masochist aimed at wasting 2 hours of your life.Other than that, it was great 😊

reviews.review_title: there are good times here -- not top, not at the bottom
reviews.content:
Bruce Willis
--- some characters hate him, some don't know. He "dropped the biggest" atom bomb type thing, ever.Story
-- pretty good. Aliens met. Kill them or keep thinking? Soldiers see terrible odds. Quit now or follow your duty? Some risk of ending the human race. Go all in, or wait days and days for the top folks to argue about it. ]
Most of it
--- okay. If you go with the feeling that life is not going to be super different. In 200 years, maybe we will have lots of bicycles for examole.

reviews.review_title: Worst space movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: What the f did I just watch, doesn't make any sense, still using guns with bullets 500 years in the future, cars are the same, there space suits look like cheap plastic kids Halloween costumes. Definitely spent there budget on the actors. Was a good laugh tho, the aliens are some kind of space zombies, complete trash.

reviews.review_title: Giving it one star because I can't give it a zero.
reviews.content: Complete waste of time. As one movie critic wrote ,"the best thing to do with Cosmic Sin is to shoot every copy of it off into space and pretend it never happened."

reviews.review_title: An indie film from an unknown channel featuring Bruce Willis in an attempt to gather some cash for Willis' retirement
reviews.content: I'd start with that I'm a big fan of Bruce Willis, but that piece of art is something. Looks like they even haven't tried to write a scenario for it. The movie is full of classic stamps, cheap graphics, absence of acting, no storytelling and I can go on and on on what is missing in this film, but I won't. Trust me - it's not worth your time viewing it. You better search for Dust (indie sci-fi shorts) on Youtube and they would be better and more interesting than this movie.

reviews.review_title: I really don't know what to say
reviews.content: Tried to watch this on a plane flight and I couldn't finish it... I usually will watch anything especially when I have zero expectations going in. I gave it an honest try but it was terrible.Film/events move too fast, character building is non-existent. Extremely unbelievable even for a fiction, the characters act in a way that is not even plausible. The assembly of the team was way too predictable and beyond cringe. Who the hell put this together and thought someone might like it. Human centipede has better rewatch value and is more entertaining than this.

I was focused the whole movie & enjoy hyperthetical scenarios that could develop in our earth's future.Sounds grim though for our future generations, but who knows what's coming.I noticed a few problems within the development of certain parts of this production....and now I guess I know why.Sorry Mr Willis, I always enjoy your presence in everything you make....but Cosmic Sin's higher point would have to go to Perrey Reeve's character & her incredible voice transformation.The musical score by Scott is also amazing!Good luck & hugs Bruce....x.
Bad plot. Bad acting. Total waste of time. Avoid this movie.

This thing is all over the place. I'm just confused and still watching since it's movie night. I'd suggest getting out early as we are just trying to tough it out until the end. And that camey get here fast enough.

I had the unfortunate circumstance to watch this on a flight. It is definitely one of the worst movies EVER! Horrible plot that never makes sense, bad acting, cliche writing. Elementary school level costumes. Does Bruce Willis read these scripts?

reviews.review_title: I wasted 88 minutes of my life. Really.
reviews.content: I don't know why I decided to watch this movie. But honestly, it was one of the worse decisions of 2021. Performances suck. Plot sucks. SFX are like, ok. Nothing makes sense at all in the film. Nothing. Don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Who had Bruce Willis starring in Cosmic Sin for March 2021?
reviews.content:
I mean really, this story-line is.. Blah...
"I can't actually throw up in my mouth, but if I could I could do it!"

reviews.review_title: I saw low budget movies much better than this one
reviews.content: It feels like the script and the whole movie was done in 1 day because the crew had to attend a party.

I couldn't get past 15 minutes. Worst film I've tired to watch in ages! It was so absolutely cringe. The acting was just so awful and I don't even know where they could go with that plot. I'm sad that Bruce Willis agreed to be in a film this horrible. Did they run out of money once they hired him?
Someone invested way too much money into this youtube movie.

reviews.review_title: What a total waste of time!
reviews.content: Producing this movie in and itself was a 'Cosmic Sin'. Releasing it to the general public to waste everyone's time as well as frustrate people was another 'Cosmic Sin'. Hence, perfect movie title. Mission accomplished!

reviews.review_title: Did Bruce lose a bet or something?
reviews.content:
Oh Bruce, why?Are alimony payments so high nowadays that all these successful actors are having to do dog films just to make their payments?This is one of many Bruce films I've caught lately where there is no premise, no story line and essentially no Bruce, don't end like this Bruce, you are better than this.I'm wondering if streaming services are ruining our movie industry, they make their money by subscriptions, so all they need is a big name and we'll flock to their service, a movie like this would have been pulled from the theatres after one week and would have been a financial loss but on a streaming service it just goes into the pile.These services are turning great actors into money ho day raters, "here Bruce, it's a big pile of money for you, don't ask any questions"
Stop selling out actors, have some artistic integrity for heavens sake.All of these big name dropping dogs of movies are changing the way I feel about the industry as a whole.A good thing though, is TV is filling the quality gap that these movies are missing, can you say Moonlighting 2 Bruce? Huh, c'mon, waddya say pal?

reviews.review_title: For those who have masochistic curiosity
reviews.content: The script is overwhelmingly chaotic and has elements from other sci-fy series like the Helix and Star-Gate Atlantis. Your attention is challenged as you try to keep up with a fast pace of visual effects and fill in (with your imagination) the gaps in the screenplay.It has quite alot of funny scenes and dialogues, but not as intentional as they should, and does not cover the over played gravity of the so called "plot". Visual effects are so erratical and rushed that watching this movie got me actual headaches.Characters endure the harshness of space and travel through wormwholes dressed in a partially closed suit and with a miracle helmet (I suppose the laws of physics does not apply in this movie).Other gap in logic is the planetary defense of a colonised planet made with one "loose" cannon with a big open door that relied on infantery defense.The good thing - it had about 90 minutes.The bad thing - the whole script and the fact that (perhaps) they cut so many things that eventually the movie did not make any sense at all and after you have seen it, you cannot forget it.

This is by far the worst film i've seen in many years and no I didn't have have the stomach to finish it. Everything screams low budget (props. Special effects, the painfully cheap costumes) but the worst is a cpmplete absence of storyline, script or even b movie acting. What the hell is Bruce Willis even doing there?? And who financed this crap?A joke and a waste of time and resources. Period!

They could have hired random cosplayers and have had better costume design. The story is an intriguing concept but it's so badly executed there really are no words to describe it.Sure the acting is not top tier but the fault lies with the script writers, the director and which ever first day intern they had produce this.

reviews.review_title: 500 years into the future and the tables are full of paper files
reviews.content:
Somebody ask Bruce and Paramount also, what the heck is wrong with them????
They should have atleast wear their clothes front side back or something.
If human race in 500 years will continue to wear a 2019 walmart Autumn-Winter collection, and US Army will use Target tents when invading other planets.. We're screwedThis movie is so bad in so many ways, that if I start writing, my review will be longer then the Movie script.. I simply fast forwarded after the first 10 minutes because I couldn't handle it
I do not understand why people hate this movie so much. It is not that bad it is just not what you expect to see.
Extremely bad scripting, and bad story. Can't watch more than 30 min.Bruce Willis could have ruined his reputation for accepting a movie like this.
Wow! Just wow. This movie is so bad. Hey Bruce, blink twice if they're holding you captive.

reviews.review_title: Does Bruce Willis owe Corey Large money?
reviews.content: This is the second "written by" Corey Large movie the Bruce has been in...the first one being Breach. I think that either Bruce lost a bet to thos guy or he is a really good friend trying to help a struggling writer out. Either way this movie is as bad as the former and no amount of friendship should have let this happen.

reviews.review_title: To be or not to be an actor
reviews.content: The oldest job in the world came like a glove for Bruce Willis, in his latest movies. Unfortunately, that's how he will be remembered, by his latest "accomplishments": a Holywood prostitute with a great acting history. What a pitty....

Was anyone really excited to make this movie? You'd think that portraying life 500 years from now would be something so new and different and crazy and.... Anything but what we have here."Mr James Ford...." Is said exactly as it's been said to any of these movies. Ugh.
I can't recall watching a movie this bad before. Everything about it is diabolically bad. And not in a good way.

I've seen better acting in an amateur dramatics production at the village hall. Turned it off and went and cleaned my car instead.Bruce Willis you must be hard up or something. One of if not the worst film I've ever seen!

I know it's not nice to lough at an old man who does not get anymore good contracts, it sounds rather sad, but it's funny. That's if you are in a good mood and enjoy Ed Wood's or Asylum "masterpieces".
So excited to watch & also with Bruce Willis cast it was definitely going to be a winner! Alas! So disappointing, confusing & boring tbh! I wouldn't bother!
The last 4 or 5 pictures I've seen with Bruce Willis he is completely just phoning it in. "Just pay me and let me out of here!".Terrible movies anyway. But he just makes them worse.

The only reason why I kept on watching this movie after the first 10 minutes was because I came to IMDB to read the reviews. While they confirmed what I was experiencing while watching this train wreck and reaffirmed my hope that there is still some intelligent life out there, I found that the comments and reviews were much more entertaining than the actual movie. I give the reviews 10/10. Rather spend your time reading the reviews than watching this disaster. I do believe this movie is first contact with the lowest form of intelligence.
I don't usually write reviews but this garbage deserved what's coming.

What the hell was that?? Bruce Willis go broke or something? That was the worst movie. So disappointed.
Bad acting, no dialogue. Horrible premise. No character development.Cheeeeeesy.

reviews.review_title: I've seen home movies with more direction
reviews.content:
Hey Bruce if you're reading this, I'll give $100 aussie dollars to make an appearance at my birthday and get you to quote lines from die hard if you're that in need of a pay cheque.
This isn't a movie, it's a bunch of poorly written scenes that were tied together to make a 90 minute hot pile of trash.
I'm not even being mean about this, it's complete rubbish, the whole this is just plot hole after plot hole after plot hole.
Here's a spoiler, none of the script contains any full sentences.

I am sad for Adelaide Kane,Frank Grillo, Eva De Dominici, and others except for the failed Bruce Willis who is rapidly catching up to Nicolas Cage in a race to the bottom. This film is not only a sin it is a mortal sin. It is a mystery why so many accomplished actors went through with this. Perhaps the COVID affects people's minds. Suffice to say I used to dream about Adelaide Kane and now I'm left with a nightmare.
Did Bruce loss a bet or take role advice from Nicholas Cage....I can't decide.

reviews.review_title: If I could rate ZERO I would!!
reviews.content: Worst movie of the year by far, and the bar is not very high at all. Don not waster your time watching this.

How much did they pay Bruce Willis to be in this dumpster fire of a film?There are all the big cliché speeches that you expect from an epic sci fi, lost love, dead friends and the don't tell my son I'm gonna die thing. However the problem is there is no real set up, it's impossible to become invested in any aspect of this world. The characters are so two dimensional and so forgettable. Nothing here is original so you would assume that would give the writers plenty of time to perfect the old formulas, but you would be wrong.Consider this review my gift to you I wasted an hour and a half of my life so you don't have to.Don't watch this movie get a colonoscopy instead, you'll enjoy yourself way more.

reviews.review_title: If you are not an underage male, than this is bad.

reviews.review_title: if you look at the role list it looks more like a po*no

reviews.review_title: I wish I had checked the reviews first!
reviews.content:
What else can I say that every other review hasn't already said...This is an absolute train wreck of a movie! I like Bruce Willis, I love SciFi so I thought this movie would have a bit going for it. How very mistaken I was!I don't think I've cringed this much trying to watch a movie ever. The dialogue was disjointed, screenplay I really think was written by a room full of illiterate monkeys on type writers just mashing keys, the acting was non-existent, the special effects look like they got someone on Fiver to do them (for $5), set design looked like they grabbed everything from a dollar shop and made do.I really think though that it all comes down to the director.... I can only assume that whatever budget was avalible for this film was instead spent of 8kg of blow which the director then spent snorting for the entire duration of making this film, pulled a kid still going to school out of film class to direct for him while he was f@$ked up on blow in his trailer. Whenever the kid had question, the director would just scream out through his closed trailer door between lines that the kid was doing great and just trust the process!I still don't know how this even got out of post production to actually be released.... I think post production likely consisted of a very strung out director stressing he had to deliver ANYTHING to justify the investors money (that he had taken and spent on blow) so did all the post production himself in a single day..... while strung out from all the blow!Maybe there was no blow and it was just a massive brain aneurysm that everyone just overlooked as this movie was nose dived off a cliff....I feel like they should have to pay me to reimburse my time wasted watching this movie.Every single person involved in the making of this movie should take a good hard look in the mirror and ask themselves "WTF were we doing!"Don't pay to stream this movie, its a waste of your money.
Don't download it illegally, its a waste of your internet.
Don't watch this even if its free, its a monumental waste of your TIME!

Sad to see Bruce Willis going all Nicolas Cage in his latter years... With a net worth of 250M it's not like he needs to do plotless movies with 2nd rate special effects and poor actors at this stage... But it's Covid - so maybe he was just bored. Frank Grillo - another good millionaire actor sucked into this steaming pile of a film... such a pity to have their reputations tied to suck a just plain bad movie.
You know when you are so time invested watching a movie that you don't stop watching ? Well, its so bad and cringe-worthy I couldn't finish the last 30 minutes.
Previous reviews have been far more eloquent and in-depth, so I will go no further than to say save yourself the trouble of watching this contender for the Plan 9 from Outer Space Awards.

I'm not sure how this was made. The writing, acting, costumes and the plot were all quite bad. I actually looked up Bruce Willis' net worth online while I was watching this to see if he needed the money. Turns out, he doesn't, so I'm not sure why he made this movie.

That film is a cosmic sin....never getting that time back.Bruce Willis like what the actual, there is no plot and the costumes are shocking. If we are that far in the future still using 2022 machines and guns then we deserved to be shocking.

reviews.review_title: First I thought it was a fan movie made from other movies, then I thought it was Romanian Y movie...
reviews.content:
I did not manage to watch it I simply had to FF it...
After the first minute I actually thought BW will die, and Y class romanian actors will take over, but no...he stayed till the end.Movie is beyond bad....In 2350. - something, Earthlings have quantuum bombs and can fight in space in space suits but still use Glock 19?
Asimilating monsteraliens who can asimilate races, build quantuum gates and a fleet of millions starships are destroyed by one bottle bomb thrown into a gate by a "space cannon"?
DONT WATCH PLEASE
Don't watch. The movie doesn't make any sense. The storie doesn't exist at all.
Worst Sci-Fi movie ever made. But it is fun to watch with friends to predict the replicas and see who is right.

Ok, I'll keep it brief(ish). Bruce - please retire and give up 'acting'. Let us remember you how you were in the Good Old Days. Do not go anywhere near this if you want to retain any sense of fan loyalty.Where to begin??The 'Acting'...oh god Bruce..were you bored throughout, or just didn't care? You look and sound so disinterested. Sad...The 'Aliens'... god that's funny. To begin with they ALL move at the same time with neck twitches...think Michael Jackson's Thriller and you've nailed it! Then they are all dressed like Comicon fans in Assassin's Creed outfits. With masks (convenient cost saving on make-up).The 'Plot'...basically Kill'em All. But from start to finish there are perhaps 15 aliens in total. And the biggest one was killed with 3 pistol rounds.The 'Special Effects'...well, there's a 'SpaceGate' (guess #Stargate was already used?). There's a Kick-A## female soldier carrying an 8ft barrel from a Tiger tank and firing it with ease. There's a secret planetary base for the Orbital Cannon that is lit up like a NightClub in multi-coloured LEDs and has a Military logo projected on it's side (honestly!).The 'Pivotal' scenes... Bruce Willis is led into a cave by multiple Aliens. He has a meeting with someone under bright lights...then walks out later with no-one around?? A 3 minute conversation with a little girl asking if one of the characters can wear her sunglasses is another equally gripping scene.The 'Q-Bomb' Maguffin (from the infinitely better 1959 film -'The Mouse That Roared') ... "if you drop it you'll wipe out from Earth to Pluto"...next thing it's getting shot out of a massive cannon over thousands of miles?The 'Slow Motion' scenes... why?..just why?The 'Armoured suits'...made of thin plastic, there to 'protect' them - but then they say to 'self destruct' one? So your armoured suit has a bomb in it as well??The 'Scientist'...so she just stands around while the Aliens slaughter the humans and says 'don't kill them'?The Imperial Guard Tie-Fighter at 41 minutes... WHY?I could go on and on..but I'll summarise.Bruce - take a leaf from your Hard Rock pals Arnold and Sylvester.. Pick better scripts!! It's not about the bottom line. For the sake of your fans and your legacy - avoid piles of #### such as this. We love you as you are! x

reviews.review_title: Where was Bruce when you needed him

Jesus Frank Grillo Bruce Willis this film was so bad I fell asleep 20 times watching it.

reviews.review_title: I just can't give it 1 star

You can tell there was very limited budget for this film. I expect having Bruce Willis in it cost them most of what they had to try and bring in an audience but ultimately they did not pull it off.That being said with such a small budget they did an okay job. There is a lot of hate on this but when you compare it to big money blockbuster films, with a story as unnecessarily complex and mind boggling, yes you are giving yourself a tough task to keep the audience engaged in anything more than the bad script, story board, acting and costumes.Theis film could have been so much more than what it was if Bruce wasn't in it. The pressure would have been off them and they could have had a bit more fun with it.Anyway overall a bad film with bad acting (even Bruce has his hammy moments) and a bad storyline, all because of a low budget.I mean, what do you expect?!

reviews.review_title: That is not the title, it's the description of this film

Effects were terrible and the cast was clearly not even together most of the time. I sincerely wish I could give it negative stars.

Lock whoever is responsible for this cosmic waste of time up and throw away the key.
The only positive I have is that I laughed throughout, mainly through pure disbelief at how bad it was.

And we're meant to believe that 500 years in the future we've colonised distant planets, but haven't improved our transport, firearms or buildings? The most futuristic thing on earth in this movie is a robot bartender. I MEAN COME ON....

reviews.review_title: Was it meant as a joke? I don't even think so...
reviews.content: I wasn't expecting a lot from this movie, really.. just to lay back, relax and let the stress of the day go. I wasn't looking for a truly good movie, just a litlle bit of action, requiring no brain activity. I was confident Bruce would provide. But life always find a way to surprise you.Sadly my only satisfaction was to imagine that, maybe, someone took time and effort to make this movie as bad as possible... had it been the case, it would have been masterful... clichés everywhere, bad dialogues, the story makes no sense... at the end, against all odds, my brain was on fire, trying to comprehend the magnitude of what I just had seen. Did I see something more terrible in my whole life? would I see something worse before I die ? I wasn't prepared for such life changing questions.Even the CGI for the alien spaceships were old school, maybe from the mid-eighties.. take one ship.. copy/paste the exact same ship x 50 times and you have the alien army.Because I try to be a positive person, I really hope this movie will help Bruce with his taxes, and maybe enable some of the other actors to pay for acting school.

I should have checked here before wasting 2 hours watching this unintelligible mess. Bruce Willis should be ashamed of himself for his part in this drivel. In fact a cardboard cutout of Bruce would have had more personality in this movie!The plot was pointless, but even a pointless plot needs to be able to be followed. This was not able to be followed. The dialogue talks about "first contact ever" with aliens, yet clearly they have dealt with aliens before. The action scenes were so disjointed they didn't even make sense.I rarely write reviews, but this movie was so utterly bad I had to vent my thoughts and warn you good people to NOT WASTE YOUR TIME watching this putrid drivel of a movie!! It is the pure definition of utterly incomprehensible. There are no redeeming features at all, and Bruce Willis is the worst he's ever been. Just a tragic waste of talent.

This movie isn't for everyone, clearly. A bit of a shame really, as it's a classic sci-fi adventure that revolves around exploring an interesting premise.This movie, if turned into a short-fiction novel, would make for a fun Sunday read, even if a bit geeky in nature.Where this movie loses some critics is that it is a low-budget film, with a big-name actor being the only surface-level attraction. If you accept it as a made-for-TV movie rather than a blockbuster, you may be more easily look past its limitations.The premise of the movie is how should terrains, spacefaring humans, react to first contact with a suspected aggressive alien race. Some movies with such a premise play out the notion of humans being being dominated by the aliens and enslaved, which is what critics love to see. This movie takes an aggressive opposing stance, even more so than Ender's Game, and argues for swift action over weakness."I was late once and so he broke my nose. I was never late again."Geeky Easter eggs exist in the movie, such as the space battleships you see appear to be StarCraft Terran Battlecruisers. It helps to explain the universe without needing to say much at all; something critics would miss.Like most of Bruce Willis movies these days, they run counter to modern liberal norms. I'm giving this movie a 7/10, as there were some cheesy fight scenes and some of the props looked a bit silly. The story was a bit abrupt at times, which might cause issues for viewers that need things spelled out for them, but I didn't have that issue myself.Overall, I enjoyed watching it.

The best thing about this (cough!!) movie is its title. Probably, the whole film crew were so embarrassed about this thing, they've felt the need to somehow warn the audience in advance about how bad it is and came up with the title 'Cosmic Sin'. We can't say we weren't warned.
