About up there with Fireball XL5. I so loved Adelaide Kane in Reign and I am sorry she wasn't offered something that better exploited her talents. Bruce Willis sadly made this his last film I fear. Just pure trash.

This movie is simply put the first movie I legitimatly call bad. There are a lot of bad movies but some of them have bad scripts, bad acting and so forth. This movie somehow had bad everything. This is the movie that taught me what a bad movie is. I am the type to watch movies when doing something else but this took all my attention because it simply baffled me how bad it was.I can not think of anything in this movie that made it worthwhile to watch for me.

reviews.review_title: What a waste of an hour
reviews.content: Awful film, and easily the most confusing I've probably ever watched, which is a shame as I usually love Frank Grillo films. One of life's regrets is forgetting to read the reviews.Bruce outdo's his usual wooden acting and I'm fairly sure all the budget has gone on him, no props, CGI is childish and the storyline seems to have been written with crayon.I'd try and spare future watchers by explaining why it's so dire but I've no idea what I've just watched. Bruce Willis puts Keane Reeves and Nicholas Cage to shame in this film.Just do yourself a favour and don't bother, Bruce, you owe me an hour.

It´s horrible to see how Bruce was used as a commodity. Everyone involved in this movie must have noticed hos bad Bruce was doing. I had to watch this one. We have all known for the past year how ill Bruce Willis was in the last movies... And even if this one is from the early stages of the illness, you can see that he is not the same, and that off course affects the whole movie. One expects a story that evolves around Willis, but the whole script is adapted and twisted... So the story flies all over the place, and the insane mish-mash of present and far away future features is not doing it any favours. As a movie, I guess its good for a hang-over morning... Press play, and fall asleep once in a while, and watch with half an eye. Thats how much you should invest in this one, because they clearly did not invest enough to make this script coherent and manageable...Bruce Willis career, and him as a person, deserved a better destiny than this... To be used as a commodity and forced into to movies, where he wore an earpiece just to be able to deliver the lines. The people around him saw him as a cash-cow and used him without regret. I wont remember Willis for this, but I will remember him for the Die Hard´s and The sixth sence.
Terrible screenplay, terrible cast and terrible special effects. Nothing more...
To be honest, Abed would have made a better movie.
I stand by it, this film is asside a few scenes that felt awkward a bit, pure gold. It will be another classic along Space troopers in the genre.

You should watch enough of this movie to learn what a Q-Bomb is, then....... get everyone associated with making this movie. Put them on a planet further away than Jupiter and then drop a Q-Bomb on them.
What did i just Watch? Lowest budget ever!!Is Bruce Willis broke since he said yes to this????The story, the lines, the effects... omg...Don't Watch this!

I think that 2.5 in rating is wrong.2.5 is actually why this movie caught my attention.And of course because of Mr. Willis!I know that he has made a few wrong choices when it comes to movies..
But who cares.Sometimes B - Movies are interesting because they ARE B - movies.I recommend this movie.
This movie had to have been a joke, or a writer losing a bet? Please, DO NOT waste time on this garbage. My head hurts from watching this, it was that bad.
How pay to produce movies like this. I realy havent anything good to say.

reviews.review_title: I cannot think of a situation where watching this is worthwhile
reviews.content: It's like a really really long demo tape by a high school student. Without the creativity.The budget is not really the problem. It's the lack of cohesion.Watch Cosmic Sin or go to the dentist? Dentist.Watch Cosmic Sin or clean the bathroom? Bathroom.
This was atrocious... why I spent the 90 minutes of my life watching can only be attributed to I was bored and drinking bourbon.
Literally blew my mind.....what a mess! Doesn't deserve even 1 star.

reviews.review_title: bad bad movie really waste of time
reviews.content: Okay this was a really bad movie with Bruce Willis.I Think he must have needed some money for Pizza or something for acting in this movie-i cant say enough ....just drop this movie.Regards Peter.

reviews.review_title: 88 minutes of my life I'll never get back
reviews.content: This must be one of the worst movies I have ever seen. The story, the acting, the randomness of some conversations. Really total garbage. I was really annoyed by so many things. You have spaceships and "teleportation" yet the have so many things in the movie that are present in our lives today which I higly doubt will be around in 500 years.
Horrible to watch, super bad acting, no a single good digital effect, nothing to give value to this BS, the presence of Bruce Willis don't made any difference, he is one more loser in this BS Movie.
Frank and Bruce at their very worst. Extremely badly written dialogue and 80's visual effects.The whole premise of the movie make very little sense.

-
-
-
-
-
-
Why? Seriously, why made a movie like this?

Boyfriend: Wow, this a short movie, only an
hour twenty.Me: It's also incredibly long all at the same time.
Unwatchable, even in ffwd, you'd have to be lobatimized to be ab to sit thru it
I love SciFi and Bruce Willis,but this was just terrible.

reviews.review_title: 40 minutes of my life I'll never get back
reviews.content: It starts ok and goes downhill from there. Poor special effects, foggy plot line. It could have been good had the people who made it put more effort into it. Some of the acting is horrendous too. The title says 40 minutes I'll never get back because that's when I turned it off.
This was terrible. No story line. Bad actioning bad music. Only good part was Bruce was script was awful

reviews.review_title: I want my hour back. BADLY.
reviews.content: What the hell? What the hell?It was sooo, sooo bad I just can't. Not enough dialog, an ephemeral plot, bad costuming, a pathetic plot, weird pacing, next to no exposition, and a trash heap of a plot. It's odds and ends from subpar sci-fi plots duct taped together to make a cosmically SINful pile of garbage. I shall forget this mess was ever made.From now on I'm checking IMDB rating first before wasting precious hours of my life.Please don't watch this unless you're immortal.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: Most of this movie had my jaw hanging in disbelief. Not at the story or the acting, but how absolutely terrible it was. Halfway through I had to take a break in order to not break down in tears. This time it was because of the story. Not the contents of it, but how amazingly bad it was.I think most of this movie could have been greatly improved by having a good (or even mediocre) writer. Having a director would also have helped. There's no chance there was one actually present at the set. If there had been, he would have shut down filming on day one.All this said, I have seen worse movies. Something from Uwe Boll comes to mind.If you can, avoid seeing this movie. If you can't, be drunk.

I am wondering why Bruce Willis has acted in this none-sens movie.They had no clue of what they are making!!!500 years from now with mix technologies.it could have been a movie for teanagers with some small changes.

I couldn't finish. Some good-looking aerospace scenes in the opening few minutes but then just seriously awful everything. So thoroughly amateur, cliched, confused. This is an ugly movie. Watch only out of morbid curiousity, but be warned. It will be a waste of 15 minutes and you will have unwelcome feelings of regret for a few days.
The "armor" they wear is just a work overall with plastic pieces glued on.

Poor Bruce. Getting his good name dragged in the dirt by some greedy management just to cash in before too late. A sick person being exploited like this is just sick and mean. Why did his family not put a stop to this terrible exploitation of Bruce back in 2018... ??
Avoid this below c-rate "movie" for your own sake.
Terrible low budget rubbish

Poor script, poor acting, even worse worse overall execution.  If there's nothing else to watch you might give this a shot, but it's probably the worst Netflix movie I've ever watched.  Uninspiring, the plot is far too jumpy, and frankly I wish I had that hour and a half back.

I gave it about 15 minutes but couldn't watch any longer.  The dialogues, the performances of the actors, the storyline... everything had b-movie witten all over it. And it would't be so bad if it was intentional. Then I might have kept watching for a while longer. But with Willis en Grillo in the cast you expect something more.  Too bad. There were a lot more possibilities with this story...

This movie is every bit as awful as the ratings suggest. Purely preposterous, overly cliche. Another one of those - you got a lot of nerve showing your face around here - movies where the big cosmic sin is really just a bunch of every day BS we all know humans do all the time. Not interesting. Just bad. Stay far away.
Was this movie supposed to be a joke? It was so bad. How was this cast so bad. Who made this? They should be embarrassed

I honestly cannot believe that was Bruce Willis. That had to be a clone or someone wearing a mask. This was an hour and a half of pure idiotic filming. The cast was, dare I say decent. The plot could have been good. It wasn't. It looked like Bruce was walking through this film like it was some sort of contractual obligation that he didn't want to do. Whoever came up with this and decided "this is a good idea" must be fired.

It's possible this might happen if we run into alien life but that doesn't make it right, xenophobia at it's finest.  I mean this is 31 flavors of stupid.  I don't blame Bruce Willis, he couldn't have saved this dumpster fire even in his prime.  Plus there brilliant way of going around the faster than light issue?  Shoot people through space like BULLETS!  Because who needs space ships?  Launching people faster than light like missiles makes no sense.  To quote the great Crow T. Robot, "Just because it looks futuristic doesn't make it practical."  Lastly the aliens that they are so quite to kill without any provocation.  They are generic and cheap parasitic goop.  I wish Netflix would be a little more discriminating on what they green light.  Because last 5 years or so, there has been a ton of shit being made.
Well, that was horrible. Incoherency is probably its most defining trait. Sloppy cuts, bad camera work and a script that seems to have entirely opted out of plot.

This movie is low budget, badly acted and boring. Not worth to watch, even with Bruce Willis in it. The plot is bad, the direction is bad, the photography is bad, there's not a single salvageable part in this movie.
Worst movie ever, so bad
Sooo bad its good. Like a covid “why not” for all involved..
The crammed opening and drul opening make me feel like watching paint dry would be more riveting

The notably praiseworthy highlight gets awarded to the decently composed score of emphasized resonance, but the rest of the film's insipid deliverance disposably squandered its effortlessly billed star power to the backseats through an unoriginal, nonsensical ride that's heavily derivative of past, better sci-fi movies across all aspectual elements. (C-)
This is just sad. Expected at least some decent story and VFX considering aliens are involved. But the movie is a huge disappointment on every front.
So dull I couldn't get to the end.

The movie was well acted but poorly directed towards the  end especcially. The movie forsakes physics entierly. This movie was overall confusing and anticlimactic. The ending really left more to be desierd. Also the shady alien menace card is all but played out. I like to see the faces they wear especially in movies like this. The faceless aliens are simply put in my opinion a total lack of creativity there in.

This is rough. A terrible melange of bits taken from other movies, set in 2524, without any attention to detail. People drive motorcycles and motor cars, one scene has a floor fan on a stand from Walmart, amongst other 1990s tech. There are alien zombies and space fights and lots of bullets to skulls. Hopefully Willis got some cash for his family.

I'll admit I only made it 38 minutes in. Who writes this crap? The story is idiotic and the acting is cringe worthy from actors I know can do a lot better. The set design makes no sense for a movie that supposedly takes place 500 years in the future. There is nothing good about this movie.

This movie is beyond awful even for Bruce Willis. Bruce Willis had better films than Cosmic Sin. Hudson Hawk, Striking Distance, and A Good Day to Die Hard. All these other movies were better than Cosmic Sin. Cosmic Sin failed all across the board. The acting was sluggish, the costume deigns were lazy, the visuals were mediocre, the writing was incompetent, and the makeup was deplorable. Everything about Cosmic Sin was awful.

I'm taking every lamp in the living room and going over to the boiler room at the new college campus next door to my apartment complex, mount my Sony 1960 X 1080p video camera on a tripod, string some LED strips along the superstructure, set up my two-laptop computer studio as props, and shoot most of the on-base sequences for the production group that's funding Bruce's retirement. I figure they're working on a sequel and need filler...
Yes, don't waste your time you could've made this at home and had your kid brother write the script.
Awful, every cliche in the book and from very early on i was rooting for the aliens, then i stopped giving a monkeys and gave up

Wow, this is one of the worst movies I've seen on Netflix, and one of the worst I've seen in the past decade. I like plenty of Bruce Willis movies, but this is probably the worst movie Bruce Willis has ever starred in. The entirity of the move is just awful. Bad writing, bad acting, clingy characters, clingy dialogue, bad and cheap costumes, bad editing, no chemistry between the actors, stupid aliens (why are they so humanoid and why are their face never shown, and if they are so advanced, why don't they have better weapeons than the humans?). Some many things in the movie just don't make sense or seems nonsensical. Like why in 2524 are people still driving cars from the 21st century? Why did the survivors need to walk through the base passing by many soldiers before they could be decontaminated? Why was Bruce's ex wife walking on top of the alien ship and what the heck was that orb thing? There were just so many dumb scenes and god awful dialog. Some of the action scenes seem to be copied from other better movies. If this is the quality of the movies Bruce Willis is doing now that he's in his 60's, I think he shoudl retire.

This movie might go down in the record books as the worst movie of all times next to attack of the killer tomatoes. It's so bad I spent 30 minutes afterwards going over how bad it was with my husband. 

Where to start, firstly the movie costumes looked like something out of a high school play. The costumes were clearly made of cardboard. Next the camera work and editing were so bad that you couldn't tell who was talking to each other. They were likely being filmed remotely. Finally, characters would just appear like the little girl with sunglasses or the old couple with flannel shirts out of nowhere for no particular reason.  The fight scenes were hilarious. Let's find the cleaning lady and her husband and throw them into the fight with no armor and a gun to get killed then the main guy can fight the aliens off with a knife. 

This movie might become a cult classic just because you can't stop talking about how bad it is. Wow! A real stinker!

Wow, Bad acting, Horrible editing, Poor sound and the "story" was completely disjointed. There was no character development, not that you gave a crap about anyone in this dumpster fire of a movie. It is almost like they had a script for a 6 hour movie and tried to fit it into an 80 minute bottle.

Ugh.  I should have known … anything that Bruce Willis does these days (actually for quite some time) should be a pass. Another case where I should have noted the wisdom of the crowd by looking at IMDB & RottenTomatoes ratings.

This film is technically a halo rip off just look at the design of the armor and aesthetic, everything about this film is shitty as hell! Bruce Willis went from having an amazing career to a dumpster fire.

I cannot say enough bad things about this movie. Terrible story, wait was there a story? I forgot already being distracted by the worst acting. Bruce Willis was spliced in from a remote location somehow. There were seemingly main characters that sort of vanished from the storyline and then a scene with a child in it that made zero sense and came out of left field. It's not even the good kind of bad that could make it become popular for that reason. It just sucks.

Bruce Willis totally phoned this one in -- and he was barely in the film, too. The sets were apparently whatever was nearby when they decided to actually shoot some film... the bar the camera crew hangs out at, the park across the street from the bar, the woods out back behind the bar, the construction site next door to the bar -- you get the idea. The costumes were good for an entry-level cosplay convention... and I've seen more sci-fi in those 5-minute "Dust" shorts on YouTube -- and better acting, too. Overall: I want my 90 minutes back. Bruce... find a better way to get rent money and stop selling your legacy off like a junkie looking for a fix. It's sad. :(
Another Bruce Willis fall from grace

The sin of this movie is the writer(s) got a paycheck from it. A mash up of Stargate and altered carbon where i am never quite sure who bruce Willis is fighting or why and what everyone is supposed to be doing.  Why do some people have bullet guns, others ray gun and we still drive gas cars 500 yrs in the future? Technology inconsistent.
This is such a bad film that I would sue the screenwriters for coming up with this boring, stupid and awful story.

We all know that Bruce Willis isn't really a great actor, but, even though, he was in a couple of action movies which made him so famous (and arrogant) that some 10 years ago he refused a part because he was offered "ONLY" 75 million dollars for 4 weeks shooting. What an arrogant .... Well, he should have taken that job and retire as the movies that he appeared in over the last few years were all utter crap, but really of the worst kind, like for example Reprisal and now Cosmic Sin (this latest to be considered the worst movie in 2021, and I, in fact, managed to watch less than 15 minutes before changing channels). Please: RETIRE!
Why do people make movies like this? Why is Bruce Willis being  suck a prick now?
Bruce Willis looks embarrassed to be picking up a check for this one.
This movie is BY FAR the worst Ive ever seen, and Ive watched my own colonoscopy

This was TERRIBLE! A terrible waste of the mere £8 I spent, but a great waste of my precious time - I watched to the end in the hopes that it would improve, but failed with every minute that passed. The story has been done so many times. Thin dialogue, corny one-liners, novice cast, bad acting, emotions totally overacted with a lot swearing to make up for the bad dialogue. Don't waste your time or money!

One of the worst movies ever made. An insult to the audience intelligence. Cliched story, dreadful dialogue, terrible acting, cheap production all amounts to an utter waste of time. Avoid at all costs.
Worst movie I've probably ever seen. I feel like an idiot for renting this without noticing the rating first.

B-Grade and boring! The story had nothing of interest, and the dialogue was flat & flavourless. Bruce Willis' character seemed to monotonously 'talk' his lines, like he owed someone a favour to do this movie. The special effects were no consolation prize, either... save your time.
Hands down the worst movie I've seen in a long time. Terrible acting, worse writing and a story line that literally goes nowhere. I wish I could give it zero stars
No redeeming qualities whatsoever - except perhaps its mercifully short run time of less than an hour and a half. Willis looks like his involvement was a favour to someone.

Absolute waste of time watching this pile of nonsense. The acting is so poor it's funnier than the ‘one liners' Deffo not worth the electricity I used to keep my tv on, I would give it zero stars rating but you can't.
Terrible - worst Bruce Willis movie ever made.

I generally like Sci-fi movies. This movie, much like the title, is a sin. Confusing, chopped, disjointed are all appropriate words to describe this mess. I am not sure what to say about the parts that were left in but should have made it to the cutting room floor. It would make a half-way good cheesy B movie if it had any cheese, it even fails on that. Oh well, move on, do better next time.

Do not bother with this movie! The main sin is that this got released. 

The stay at home enforcement of COVID has made people desperate for shows to watch but this is one to avoid at all costs. 
- the script is weak and full of cliches - a high school class could do better
- the set is weak - supposed to be way into the future but little effort is put into this as characters look like they have come from the 2021 pub
- the acting is weak, particularly from Bruce Willis who looked drugged throughout the show. 
- the effects are weak for a Sci-Fi - we can live with these but in the context of everything else it just adds to the appalling nature of the movie. 

Some heads should role that this movie got funded, made and aired. It is an embarrassment and I can only wonder what good, looking for an opportunity, scriptwriters and actors must say to themselves when they see this rubbish. Straight to the bin for this one.
Couldn't engage. Storyline was a mess, plot was non-existent and it was just awful all round

Mr Brucey is taking the piss now considering he looked at the scrip and agreed to be part of this "movie". There was barely any dialogue, and the "director" believed it was appropriate to give it an "80's feel" for a movie set in the 25th century. Meanwhile the cheap armour which reminds me of Fallout 4 power armour was "inspired" by the video game Halo. I've seen better attempts by cosplayers and mums at school concerts making tree costumes. The incel jokes in the script are the worst attempt at humour I've seen in my life and I've watched X-Factor and AGT. With that said, you still understood it was a feeble attempt at a joke which could not be said for the rest of the script. Honestly, I'd rather listen to country music on repeat for the duration of the movie and have to pretend to enjoy it.

It's hard to know what to write about this movie, but at least there's the knowledge that whatever one writes it can't be as bad as the stunningly awful script and unbelievably terrible directing that went into the making of this piece of garbage.
Horribly horrible. Please do not watch. It's like a cheap rip off of Halo the Xbox game but bad
Tedious, confusing and disjointed. Just unbelievably bad.

The only cosmic sin was the time i wasted watching this terrible movie, it felt more like a novice film project for a Youtube mini series and i was definitely as bored watching it as Bruce Willis was acting in it.
One of the worst movies of 2021. I was wondering what was going on the whole time. There was not much explaining in the movie.

One of the worst movies I've made the mistake to watch. It was slow, made no sense, terrible plot and horrible execution. Felt like some cheap movie where a group of friends got together to make, by the lighting, sets and worse than cosplay costumes. Avoid it, not missing anything, simply not worth your time.

The lack of genuine dialogue, character development, and story telling is the ultimate cosmic sin of this film. It's like they thought B grade movies from the 80s were a good idea and needed to be remade.
What did I just watch?

holy fucking shit that was awful, writing, pacing and direction aside, the entire plot was literally "
this soldier wants to commit warcrimes what a badass"

Is Bruce Willis totally financially broke or does he just not care what his career legacy looks like? I was appalled by what is was seeing. Apparently, Bruce is now willing to attach his acting career to something this awful just to make a buck. I've seen college film school videos far better than this disaster. Horrible, really horrible.

Truly woeful. Can't believe Bruce Willis participated in such drivel. Doesn't even qualify as a B Grade movie. Persevered for 40 minutes but couldn't even watch this through to the end, "just so I never have to watch it ever again".
Most bullshit shitass movie i have ever seen... I mean whats a foot soldier doing using a big ass gun shooting point blank at close range. I mean are Bruce and Frank gone nuts or bankrupt?
Absolute rubbish. If there was an option of 0 stars I would give that

I got caught up with the fact that it was a Sci-fi with Bruce WIllis in the picture and expected something like Armageddon however it ended up being more like something watch on Dust that a newbie might create.  Nothing against Dust, I quite enjoy watching those short movies, but I know what I'm expecting and haven't been overly disappointed by much of what I've watched on there, unlike the disappointment I suffered after half an hour of watching this.  It pained me to give this a thumbs up on Netflix just so I didn't disrupt the algorithm.

I did not expect much since its produced by Saban. So I was not expecting a 5 star movie. However, the fact that they got a legend in the form of Bruce Willis for this catastrophe, is straight forward sad. The concept is pretty good. Its just unfortunate that the budget, bad acting, bad scripts and bad directing got in its way.

This is the worst thing I have ever watched. Wtf was that. It's like they used 95% of the budget on Bruce Willis and didn't even hire extras. Also yeah forgot to hire a script writer.
Worse than aids

I love a good Sci fi film, but this? I think this is hands down the worst sci fi film i have seen. Any time anything happens on screen, it's either out of focus or happens off screen.

The general dialogue is so bad the characters tell each other things 20 minutes into the movie, that you don't even feel they have deserved yet, and the acting is so bad, that it seems kinda meta that they talk about how bad the acting is to one another.

I couldn't even finish it just because it was making me angry, either with ridiculous scenes they hadn't earned, or just plot that comes out of no where, like a character mentioning something that they never said before. Even their attempts at comedy is just Awful.

The fact this currently has a 60% is Generous. Jesus.

Dynamic theme, fast tempo, fans of 80's and 90's action and sci-fi should enjoy it.  Slow in some spots with some holes and it could have been fleshed out more but it does satisfy the action/sci-fi itch and did what sci-fi should do - open a new door or two in one's mind.
Help! I urgently need to download Die Hard 1 through 7 to wash the taste of this complete rubbish out of my mouth. Embarrassed we stayed the course.

OMFG as if Bruce Willis puts his name to this dribble, I'm pretty effing sure I seen the crew standing in the background watching the filming in the Forrest scene, only watch this if need something to put you to sleep!!!
Couldn't make it through the whole thing. Oh Bruce. Why did you tarnish our memory of you being part of this tragic piece of crud.

When I read a bad book, I keep getting lost and having to back up and re-read pages because I start thinking of what to make for dinner or if I should vacuum the living room. "Cosmic Sin" had the same effect. I kept realizing that I wasn't paying attention.  Every time I backed up, I discovered that I had missed little more than poor dialogue and, what appeared to be a camera person who may have gotten lost on the set. At some point I thought there was something wrong with my brain. The sequences seemed out of order and scenes seemed to actually interrupt the flow of... of progress? No story here. I did find it entertaining that Bruce Willis seems to want to destroy any career he ever had. See Breach for a better understanding. Maybe Bruce is tired and he just wants to be left alone. Good plan. After watching "Cosmic Sin" I wouldn't ask Bruce Willis to sign a picture of myself.
Absolute crap! seriously guys so much more could have been done with this movie, feels so tacky low quality acting crap background music lost story line etc etc very disappointing.
Cosmic Sin is an apt title, because that is precisely what this movie is.
Absolute trash, a mismash of bad acting, dreadful script, worn out cliches and ridiculous story line. Such a disappointment.

A science fiction massacre (of the genre) set in 2524. The opening scene sets the pace for the entire movie - and that is slow, thoughtless mind numbing dialogue with no substance. The story itself is bad enough  - but the fact we're meant to be in the year 2524, and people are still sneaking smoke breaks... driving old cars and listening to old music  - and apparently buying the props from some late 80's auction house just makes this a painful watch, it really really does. It is a hard movie to sit through.  Not only was practically every scenes terribly lit, shot and directed (and shaky) they couldn't be bothered to put names on any of the soldiers dog tags - in several shots you clearly see they are just blank prop dog tags - sure, a small detail but it's just one of many many lazy-factors that continue throughout the entire film.  And I haven't even started on the acting yet. I'm convinced Bruce Willis was doing a favor for a friend, he had to be. Even the other veteran actors were having a hard time keeping a straight face. 

There is absolutely no redeeming features of this film. Not one. There was not one single 'good part' you could refer back to, it was a total mess from start to finish. It was that bad that I don't think I would even sit through another Edward Drake movie no matter what it was about, or who was in it.

A straightforward but imaginative concept. Only gripe is you would think the common ways we speak to each other, bar fights, and trucks wouldn't be so 21st century in the 26th century, but they are. Fun action and to-the-point

It really reaches for the stars, with big ideas and trying to make an epicly scoped, sci-fi flick with a deep mythology. It's biggest problem though is that it's cheap as hell, and looks as such, and is complimented with horrible acting and a few cheesy, overdone elements. WTF Grillo?! I knew Willis couldn't be trusted at this point, but I didn't know I had to be careful with you now too...

So first looks of the film, thought it was going to be one of these glossy space films but I wasn't expecting such bad cgi in some scenes. A bad story line. To be honest I can't believe Bruce Willis even put up with this crap

I've seen worse. Yes its cheap but you can tell it was trying. The main problem is the writer while trying to float these big ideas ran out of steam and fell back on bad clichés . Glad I didn't buy it on the discount rack, but at least I saw it
embarassed to write, too embarassed to have watched...
Seemed decent in the beginning, but the story just falls apart as the movie continues.
88 MINUTES WASTED. It's like Bruce Willis didn't want to be there.

The movie dealt with a first contact and what if?  The point is when America was visited by the Spanish, what did they do?  Guess what, when an alien visits earth they will do the same.  Although the film was crap, it was an interesting presentation.

Ok, I thought it's got Bruce Willis in it how bad can it be?  Boy was I wrong.  I heard that Nicholes Cage and Bruce were in a competition to see who could put out the worst movies.  Nick was in the lead with Jiu-Jitsu but now after having watched Cosmic Sin, Bruce has regained the lead.   Cons: realy bad acting for a starter.   The story line is weaker than a wet paper towel trying to hold a watermelon.  If you can buy that an advanced race capable of manipulating space would come to our galaxy half ass with a few soldiers dressed as the offspring of mad max road warriors and Star wars Sandmen only to get beat at every turn then this movie is for you.

The film brings a bunch of questions about ethics in warfare while trying to entertain it's audience.

The overall performance is commendable although not memorable. And that my friends is what hurt the critics egos the most. Some of their arguments aim true but there are worst movies out there. They mostly want a chance to lash at Bruce in order to leech some of his prestige.

Speaking of which Bruce don't take too much place because is he not meant to. All the others actors feels more natural around him thanks to that.

In the end I liked the movie for what it is.

You have to watch the whole thing to appreciate how bad the editing and acting can be.   Wife walked away in 30 minutes just as I realized I had to stay till the end.   Bad. It's a good thing it's free on netflix.

This is one of the worst sci-fi movies ever made. The script is very poorly written. Dialog is dry, humorless and has too much profanity that does not add anything to the emotional impact. Acting is really bad and Bruce Willis is just trying to stay awake.  The story makes absolutely no sense. Battlestar Galactica (TV series from 2003) has better special effects, decorations and costume design than this movie. This movie has no redeeming qualities - everything about it is absolutely horrible.

I never thought I would dislike a Bruce Willis movie to this extent.  Between Willis and Frank Grillo, there is enough acting chops in this movie that it could have been great.  But Frank was in the movie for what seemed to be 5 minutes and Willis had essentially zero impact on this film.  It was confusing, the action was basically phoned in, the acting was...well, there wasn't any acting.  I've seriously not seen this bad of a movie in some time.

A real jumble.  The movie presents at least 4 different points of view that could have been used to bind their sci-fi-gizmo shoot-em-up together into the all-war-is-bad, who-are-the-real-monsters thing they're going for, but none of these points of view are developed.  Frank is fine, Bruce is sleepwalking through it, everyone else's performances lower themselves to the level of the screenplay.  I gave it a couple stars because there are cool design ideas here, but the movie doesn't showcase them well.

A lot of sci-fi projects of similar size are doomed from conception, but this is a collection of unforced errors.

So bad. One of the worst movies I have every seen. Like I started an account on here just to say how bad this movie was. The overall plot, the writing, the acting all horrible. Unless I'm missing something and this was a comedy?? So bad...

Also I love how the alien world, 13 light years away, is identical to earth. Could they not have made it look at least a little bit different?

This Tel-Aviv/Hong Kong Saban Films fiasco - more a real estate, film distribution, and investment firm than anything else - is simultaneously 100% cringe-worthy and yawn-inducing.

Writing, premise, CGI, art direction, lighting, storyline, photography, costumes, sets... all laughable.

Ground scenes shot in some leafless backlot forest, while using weaponry that looks like something you can buy next week at any US Walmart, not hundreds of years in the future. Spacesuits that look like they were designed by high school students. (Not even.) Totally whacked timelines. Disjointed storyline. Ridiculous body armour. And on and on.

Wrap all this up neatly with the clause Bruce Willis seemingly has in his acting contract that he won't go over 80 words of dialogue in a movie. (Nice to get millions for a number of words you could easily write on your forearm, which most likely he does.)

One of the two writers on this catastrophe actually acted in it, doubling down on his professional setback. Masochism at its finest.

Oddly enough even thespian talents like Wayne Gretzky and Tommy Lees' sons aren't enough to save this chunk of mouldy cinematic cheese. Go figure.

Apparently, Netflix is more than happy to throw in ANYTHING to feed its streaming content grinder which we witness on a daily basis.

PS... The 1-star rating was only earned due to an annoying housefly who was watching this movie with me having to end its existence from sheer dread halfway through by crashing into the screen like a Word War 2 Japanese kamikaze pilot. Saved me from having to chase it around with a fly swatter.

Aptly titled.  So in the future, mankind crosses paths with an alien race.  This is about a group of rogue soldiers launching a preemptive strike to try and stop an intergalactic war before it starts.  Now I didn't know much about this one other than it the fact that it is the latest in the series of movies where Bruce Willis shows up to collect a paycheck.  Needless to say, I did not have high expectations for this, and the fact that this is currently rated lower on IMDb than Hard Kill made me assume I was in for the worst.  You can already make an educated guess for yourself on where this is going, and there is no point in pretending otherwise: there is nothing here to recommend.  Now I knew that I was in trouble as soon as this started.  They give you a rundown of CENTURIES of science fiction lore within the opening minute like you know what they are referencing.  You can tell that somebody clearly had big ideas at some point in this process, but you can also tell that the majority of this budget had to have gone to Bruce Willis.  This is what his career has become.  It's not like you have to pay for an advertisement budget here.  This and majority of his recent library exist solely for people browsing Redbox or scrolling a streaming service, and when they happen upon his face, they'll say, "Hey, I like Bruce Willis."  He's sleepwalking through this, and at this point in his career, that is all you're likely going to get from him.  All of the actors here are amateurish at best with the one exception of Frank Grillo, and even he doesn't walk away from this looking good since he gets no energy reciprocated back to him.  Because all of the production money went to Bruce Willis, every aspect of this movie ends up looking cheap.  The war suits look like garbage cans, and you don't get a good look at the alien threat until the midpoint.  For a while there, I thought that they exist entirely off-screen when they aren't pulling the cheap option of having aliens mind control humans.  That would have been a better call to make because when you finally do get to see the enemy, they are just faceless men in hoodies, which is just comical.  Much like all of the characters here, this is a movie that has no personality.  You don't get to know what any of these people are about other than the fact that Bruce Willis committed war crimes, and all of the actors are just going through the motions.  I can't blame them since this script is nothing but a collection of clichés.  I am not exaggerating when I say that the phone app for Star Realms has a better story with their opening preludes than what they put together here.  Cosmic Sin never offended me to the point of being angry, but it did offend my sense of taste.  You should go out of your way to actively avoid this.
This was a terrible movie and my only guess is that they blew the budget hiring Bruce Willis and not on writers.  There is terrible cheesy dialogue, a mess of a plot and very interesting acting.

Horrible acting, cheesy dialogue, illogical actions by characters, and they obviously couldn't afford any level of military or combat technical consultants.  Cheesy Dialogue Example, after the aliens attack, one of the characters says to the general "you're going after them, aren't you, sir?"...Duh.  No Technical Consultants, a veteran soldier with a choice of grabbing an automatic rifle or shotgun from a dead soldier chooses instead to grab a pistol when the aliens are shooting at him with long barrel weapons.  The movie looked like something a second year film student may have put together.

This may be the worst film I have ever seen. The shots were terrible. The editing was terrible, The music was terrible, The plot was a total f'ing trainwreck, the special effects were terrible. I can't believe the audience score is 65%, it reflects poorly on humanity for rating this movie so high and shames consciousness in general. So bad, avoid at all costs.

I repeat is the FC positive or negative for both species?", I could feel the tension rising, the suspense... For me to poop on! This movie is a truly a "Cosmic Sin"

The dialogue is stilted and awkward, and written by someone who thinks it looks good on paper, therefore translates to reality. Even the AI interjects countless lines throughout the movie, with very little of it making sense. The storyline left huge gaps in credulity, leaves the audience feeling as though they were cheated out of a proper story. There was an extreme lack of continuity, and scenes that had no meaning, or if the meanings were hidden, I'm sure the smugly smiling writers didn't even know really. Warmongering message veiled in half-hearted philosophical questioning. 

The writers briefly ponder a few morale dilemmas (is a preemptive strike justified for the protection of our own? Is eliminating an entire species justified?) before quickly answering yes (because of course they want to kill us all). It's as if the writers wrote the script without any questions and realized the message was too brutal so they inserted a few questions to soften the message without actually having to explore the counter arguments. The antagonist race was so ham handedly evil the viewer has no choice but to agree with the morally dubious decisions made by the characters. 

The movie is essentially propaganda to justify the use of the Atomic Bomb in WWII.

This movie is like a syfy late night show that you watch for ten minutes and change the channel.. What happend to Bruce Willis, it's like he's lost his ability to act with any believability.. Um. Well the actors were good. Everything else in the movie was random and not well put together. The idea, I'm sure, was interesting. However, maybe they were on a tight budget?
very bad don't bother

What the heck? Blunder of a movie is a kind understatement. 
Don't waste your time!
Oh my word that was terrible. The story, the script, the acting. All dreadful.

Good grief. Where to start? This may be the absolute worst movie i have ever seen. Plot holes you could drive an 18-wheeler through. Phoned in acting. Disjointed scenes. Confusing story. Cheap-ass costumes. Every sci-fi action trope ever piled on top of each other in a waste-skip of a script. It has NO redeeming qualities whatsoever. It's not even funny-bad. It's just bad-bad. They've clearly botted the audience score on this. Don't waste your time and definitely don't waste your money.

Genuinely awful on all accounts, the script is shocking bad acting all round, action scenes awful, the story line is just meh! The year 2500 or some rubbish and not one building or corridor had a bulb above 5 lumens. They use human zombies or purple cloaked random ninjas as the aliens for the reason, that's clearly only due to the fact that that they were too lazy to design and implement a proper alien race. The military lines where literally used just to sound all military, but actually didn't make any sense in the context of the scene, refer to ‘watch my 6' when the bad guys are all in front of him and his mates where behind him. Honestly it's written and directed by a child that's watched a few action films before bed. Your literally better off doing laundry or house work for an hour and a half than watch this, Bruce couldn't even save this sin of a film. Plus the other main actor guy randomly goes missing for half the film.

Execrable rubbish . I only watched it because I like Willis.
 Crap dialogue, Shonky sets
Truly awful. The worst movie I think I've ever seen. Dreadful storyline, terrible acting, awful directing, and a final cut that was disjointed and lacking in any form of entertainment.
One of the worst movies I have ever seen. The story, the acting, the motion picture, the production, every aspect of the movie was poorly done.
Unbelievably awful. Feels like it was written by a 12 year old. How did Bruce Willis not pull out during filming?
Truly awful film. Makes no real sense. Why invade a planet with only a few people on it? All that weird shit in the cave. Why? Just blow up the cannon and game over!
This movie is in fact a SIN. Of cosmic proportions.

Wow! Just barely above dreadful. You know it's going to be bad when your in the year 2524 and the four star general arrives at the base in a 2014 Tacoma. Some one was manipulating the ratings to get it up to 77% fan rating because it certainly isn't. Maybe 20%? If you don't watch consider that you didn't waste an hour and a half of your life.

This is a ‘B' sci fi film, an an amateur production that "somehow" got Bruce Willis. The story is unoriginal and uninspiring. The screen play, the dialogues are sloppy and hard to follow. The acting is generally poor. As a short sci fi the film is not thought provoking. Bruce Willis alone is not alone to salvage Cosmic Sin and it's a miracle that he agreed to be in it at all.
Incomprehensibly terrible. Like a year 8 drama project.
One of the worst movies I've seen in a long time. Dreadful dialogue, wooden acting, flimsy plot and poor camera work.
This movie was so bad I even feel writing a critique is a waste of time. Poor acting all round, very poor directing, extremely poor camera work…. and as for the sound and script ? Give me strength !
Rename this movie Cosmic S**t. Terrible acting, horrible writing. It makes no sense, this is 400 years in the future and the technology the have is supposedly almost no better than what we have now.

1 out of 5 stars. Cosmic Sin is a horrible science fiction action film. The cast ensemble performances are horrible and phoned in. Looking for an easy paycheck. The visual effects are terrible. The action is boring. The story is terrible. The script and direction is terribly put together.
Very slow and not anything unique plot wise with weak acting
The concept behind the movie is better than the actual movie. Seriously: fist-fighting with alien soldiers seems so much like a 1972 low budget backyard sci-fi.

Why did this happen? You could have done anything else instead of making this film. How much cocaine and money did it take for everyone to be convinced people would want to see this? My wife wont let me out of the house if my socks don't match. Is there not a single person in the world that cares enough about Bruce Willis to give him an honest reaction to his costume? He looked like he was one of those off brand mascots that pose for photos in Time Square. I think you meant to make some kind of an homage to movies from the early 2000's. That or you just have a lot of internal struggle. 
-Please pass along to those responsible
The screenplay is terrible and the director isn't been able to fix the issues. The special effects are unwatchable... I don't know why Bruce Willis accepted to act in this project.
Messy, disjointed, hard to follow , couldn't make it more than 3/4 way through and I like Bruce Willis. Awful movie
It's a complete loss of time. Stupid, full of clichés, with bad CGI and zero dept. It's not even a fun action B movie. Avoid it like hell, although hell it's probably less boring.
RT, you got screwed: check your numbers. They do not add up to a 78% audience score -- more like 5%, if that.

The single worst movie i have ever watched, the acting is so phoned in its laughable coupled with what i assume was a conscious effort to make such a terrible movie throughout that its almost worth the watch to laugh at.
It's been impossible to watch till the end. Possibly the worst sci-fi movie ever.
One dud after another. Willis and Cage should have a "dud off" ?! That would be funny to watch ( cringeworthy , but funny ).
The movie is really boring! It's a confusionary story without a beginning and without an end. I'm still trying to figure out how Bruce Willis reached such a low level. Two hours of my life wasted...

Bruce where did you go buddy? You really acted as if you were on some RX meds or something g because you were so sleepy in this movie. The premise was great but the writing and acting stunk! Don't waste your time on this. Just choose to remember Bruce as he was.
WTF? HAHAHAA!!! Did Donald Trump write this movie? HAHAHA!!! "Scorpions dance in my brain!" Horribly delightful! Uncertain to give half a star or eleven!
OMG. Didn't think a movie could be this bad. But it is. There is NO acting, NO believable plot, NO directing, NOTHING. It is awful from start to finish. Don't waste your time.

It's a "cosmic sin" they charged me real money to watch this junk. I think someone must have blackmailed Bruce Willis into this, he looked like he was wanting to be anywhere else in the universe except on this film set.
This movie is so bad as though it intentionally wanted to make me mad. Well, it succeeded.

Very bad.. Thought because Bruce Willis was in it I would give it a watch plus I like war and alien movies, but this was horrible. It felt like I was watching deleted scenes randomly put together. The story was hard to follow and the scripting and acting even worse. Really bad canned responses and just felt so corny watching it. The aliens were not even that cool looking, wearing hooded cloths and the fight scenes just like rushed into. IDK I'm that disappointed that I felt like reviewing it when I usually don't lol.
Awful in nearly every way that a movie can be awful, except maybe the special effects which were okay.

What the @#%$?
Was that a cinema movie or a Netflix movie?
Didn't make any sense at all, nor did it even try to...
Think Bruce Willis has made another Huddson Hawk movie.
Do not pay extra to see it, if you can stream it as part of your account and got nothing else to watch?  Then yeah watch it.
Absolutely horrible movie. Waste of money.

I honestly cannot understand why there are so many positive reviews, i've watched a lot of B movies in my time, and this film doesn't even rate as an F, its terrible. The script is horribly bad, it jumps around all over the place and comes across as so cheap I swear it was shot by Poundland studios, it gives the term 'low budget' a bad name, so much so even the less than entertaining 'action' scenes can't make up for it. I'm a massive fan of Bruce Willis,and unless he's really fallen on hard times and needs the cash, I cannot understand why he would have agreed to take part in this horrible pile of excrement

I created a Rotten Tomatoes account just to make sure I could give this movie a terrible rating. I love Bruce Willis. I think Frank Grillo is great. But please dont waste your time watching this completely non-sensical mess.

The first 20 minutes of this movie consisted of a confusing scene in which the viewers try fix their sound system. The audio track it defaulted to was out of sync with the video, and I assumed this must either be a problem with our equipment or a glitch in the streaming app. "The sound can't be messed up on the movie, that's something that you'd expect in a bootleg or something."

The movie we thought we were watching - a Bruce Willis movie that didn't make a lot of sense, like a worse Armageddon - "couldn't possibly be so low budget as to have this issue" I assured my wife, "we must have hooked up the new TV wrong". Nope, my wife was right.

After giving up on the surround sound, 20 minutes into the actual movie, it was painfully clear that the production value was actually just that low.

This movie is a think piece that will have you asking some major epistemological questions:

"Did you just skip a scene by accident, honey?"

"Are you sure you didn't elbow the remote? We definitely missed a big chunk of exposition."

"Are these characters supposed to be in the same room?"

"Are they talking to each other or talking to themselves, separately?"

"Was this script written by a human?"

"How did he get here?" "Where did she go?"

"Who's fighting now?""Are we supposed to know what's happening?"

"Was that scene confusing on purpose because Bruce Willis is concussed?"

"Why is that doomsday device on the desk like a coffee?"

"Why are there orcs now?"

Truly awful movie, Willis has reached a new low and skipped B & C and gone straight to D grade in this insult to the intelligence. Lackluster and dis-interested performances from all involved, contrived well worn (out) plots abound. Cosmic....maybe.....Sin....absolutely.
Maybe not the worst film ever, just close to...   Amazingly dissapointing.

Absolutely Horrible! We thought it was funny that a couple before us was still sleeping in the theater when we got there. After watching the movie we now know why. We thought because Bruce Willis was in it it was going to be a good movie it was absolutely horrible. Dont waste your time or money.
It's fine. What do you want RT? Yes, story just ok, some bad parts, but it's Sci-Fi with decent effects. Unless you've watched everything else under the sun, check it out.

All I can ask is who green lit this POS movie? I've seen pornos with better writing. Think its safe to say that Bruce Willis' career is officially in an underwhelming futuristic interstellar crapper.

Audience members who give this movie a high score must be blind, deaf and dumb. It is completely unwatchable!
Cosmic Sin... The title says it all about the movie. It was a sin to make this movie.

It's a sin that they made this movie and slapped Grillo and Willis' name on it. Both main actors disappear for over half the run time and get lost in between lackluster writing, cheesy one liners and poor acting. This film is reminiscent of a low budget Syfy channel flick you'd find on at 2am.

We got fooled by 83% audience approval ... for once believe the 7% critics.   You could close your eyes, throw a dart at the Sci-Fi section and find a better movie.  Cant find one thing redeemable about this movie.

This movie is a disgrace to film industry. Seriously, no adult should be making a movie this bad and waste the viewer's time. Fixing my eyes at a blank white wall for 90 minutes is more satisfying than watching Cosmic Sin. 

I even created my first account on rotten tomatoes just to leave this review to give justice to the wasted time I spent watching this movie.
Nothing to see here.  Audience score must be all of the cast And crew voting. Critics got this right.
By far the most ridiculous movie I have ever watched.  Shame on everyone involved .

Trash. I mean trash TRASH. There are about 4 action scenes in the movie, all trash and cheap. The rest is talking, and by talking I mean TALKING. About what? Who knows? It was all over the place. The MVP of this whole production was the editor that got me to watch this POS. The biggest loser is whomever paid for it.

Terrible, bad acting, bad effects (they weren't even special), story (what story?), random plot elements that made no sense.
And to top it all off, their main star Bruce looked like he didn't even want to be there; even he knew this was a flop.

cant undestand why it is rated so high. background audio was so loud you couldn't hear a lot of the lines. stupid plot and poor special effects. Dissappointing poor B quality film. Dont waste your $$.
I laughed so hard ! the perfect B-movie , the space flight scenes made me dizzy especially when they blur the scene it's like oh my god I feel like I'm flying in space !
If I had to choose between eating fecal matter or watching a minute of this movie, I'd choose the obvious option
Movie was so confusing and didnt under stand the end
Wow, this movie sucked. i cant believe the positive reviews.

This movie was a grueling experience.  Bad acting, bad dialog.  I watched because of Bruce Willis, but his performance was underwhelming.  He was there, just to bring in viewers and nothing else.
Funny how it was supposed to be set in the year 2524, but yet on earth, modern era motorcycles and cars can be seen.  Many scenes, it appears that actors were taken of the streets in their original closes, slapped on some plastic armor and started filming.  At every turn, there was something noticeable, and made it very difficult to sit through.

Well, I tried to watch the whole thing.  Really tried.  Horrible acting, horrible plot, horrible special effects, horrible exposition, horrible direction...I started to feel very ill 2/3 of the way in, and it wasn't the Kung Pao chicken.

I get annoyed when I start to watch a movie and have that feeling I'm wasting my time. In the old days poor directors used darkness to add to the effects. These days it's moving the camera around incessantly to somehow add to the "realness". This alleged movie has garbage direction, has-been or no-named "actors" and a rubbish story. The protagonist Grillo is not an actor. That's 45 minutes I'm not getting back! The best apart about this so-called film is reading the reviews.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR YOUR TIME. Absolutely a bomb.  My 4 year old niece could have written a better script.  Seriously this is the "How Not to Make A Movie" movie. Would have given a negative 5 but not available.  Undoubtedly, the favorable audience reviews were placed by the movie promoters not actual viewers so as to lure people into seeing this.  I paid 6.99 for on demand.  I so wasted 7.  If it's free, you will be out 90 minutes you'll never get back.  I was ready to turn it off after 5 minutes, but since I paid for it, I thought I would watch it.  I did FF.  YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.  and Yes the 8% professional reviewers as stated in other reviews was exceedingly generous. Don't they have a razzle berry or something award?
This is the worst film that i've saw in a long time!

I saw that it had an 85% audience score and am 8% critics. I think the critics were far to generous. This is one of the worst film that Hollywood has let slide out in our faces in awhile. If it was a smell it would be raw sewage on a hot august day. The writing was lazy and vapid and the sets looked cheap and terrible. This was supposed set in the 26th century but all the sets looked like a warehouse today, they were even driving around in pickup trucks. What a joke. The movie is like a 12 year old would shoot on an iPhone in the basement. Just terrible.

OMG.  No matter what, regardless of how desperate you are, do NOT watch this movie.  It is so awful it will actually cause genetic damage.  For the good of all I forced myself through the whole thing.  It will be years before I recover.

I bailed at 35 minutes in to this dumpster fire of a movie. How is RT showing an 86% positive ratings score from the public? Put me in the Critics column which aggregated at 8% positive.
Thankfully when I scrolled through public comments, people who wrote actual reviews thought it was horrible. 
I usually let a lot of things slide in action movies (plausibility, anachronisms, "alpha male" clichés, etc.) but this movie was abusing the privilege.
N
One of the dumbest movies ever!!
Wait for it to come out on Netflix. 🙄
This movie was trash. No plot, no character development. One of the worst movies I've ever seen.

"Cosmic Sin" is a cinematic sin against moviegoers. It teases us in with Bruce Willis in what appears to be a sci-fi thriller, but it has nothing to back it up. The effects are poor - sometimes blurry - and unimaginative. (It is supposed to be 2524, but Bruce has an old pickup and good guys and bad guys still use rifles and pistols. And the aliens are just faceless humanoids dressed in shiny black pleather like they are going to a Goth parade.) If is full of tired clichés, and attempts at humor are actually sickening. (For example, when Willis has to "put down" a mortally-wounded comrade, the sidekick character enters the silent, stunned room with the groaner, "Who died?" Only Adelaide Kane as "the wrench" seems to be making an effort in this one. For me, Willis just dropped into the Ashton Kutcher level - avoid there movies at all cost.

Among one of the worst movies I have ever seen, definitely the worst sci fi movie. No doubt the high audience reviews are faked by the movie's promoters, there's no way in hell this movie received a true 81%. Perhaps only worth watching to laugh at Bruce Willis daydreaming his way through scenes and how absolutely terrible every aspect of the movie is.

I was expecting so much more from a Bruce Willis movie but the acting and cinematography were both a disappointment.   The plot is slow and hard to follow, the plot does not flow and the characters are one dimensional.

There is a named genre for this type of movie.  It's called 'Movies So Bad That They Are Actually Funny'.  This one is really bad, so bad that it's entertaining.  It's so bad that it comes around full circle and is worth watching.  The people who made this thing, everyone involved, have no shame.  Set 500 years in the future, things look remarkably similar to present day.  Many of the set props can be purchased at Costco or Walmart (at a reasonable price).  This is the best awful movie I've seen in ages.  Nearly every scene has something amusingly bad about it.  I can think of one or two small things that could make this movie worse. I would like to have seen a Sam Peckinpaw style treatment of the fight scenes with the aliens (ie. heads explode, guts fly, blood spurts).  Also, Bruce's spacesuit is reminiscent of 'Buzz Lightyear'. 
 I would have gone with a techno update of 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles'.  This movie is a perverse paragon of bad moviemaking.  I don't know why Bruce Willis keeps making these films.  I figure he must have tax troubles or something.
So bad! I can't believe Bruce Willis would have taken this script. He must of had a family member or close friend directing. Story line was terrible as well as the directing.
I usually never agree with the critiques, but do not pay for this movie. It's as awful as the title. They literally spent their entire budget on Bruce Willis.

It was entertaining.  Plenty of areas to fault, but I enjoyed the action and general story line. The science fiction is what we see too often - a few areas that are so beyond our science (like light speed travel and black hole bombs) set in a world where it looks like little has changed (combustion cars and contemporary looking people and structures).
Well that is time I will never get back. Cosmic sin tries hard but really it dies hard.
This movie is half entertaining and half dull.  It tries hard but it doesn't get there.
Pretty terrible. Well shot but the plot makes less sense than flat earthers.
Worst movie ever. No plot. Bad acting. Awful

Hear me people of Earth! Flee! Save yourselves!  Cosmic Sin is a Migraine-inducing "shite fest" and a classic example of an interesting idea meeting a violent and mindless demise at the hands of disinterested or inept stewards.
 Mindless Derivative Drivel with no discernible script after the first 15 minutes. One would be excused for surmising that the Film Editor quit after completing the first 10 minutes, leaving Grillo, Lana and Lee to patch together a movie that gave them as much screen time as possible, story-line be damned. Ugh! I rate this movie three disgusted Ughs.
Slow moving show. Not what you expect to see for a Bruce Willis movie.just another alien movie.

Do not watch this movie. Unless you want to see what a sci-fi movie with a $200 special effects budget looks like. It's only 88 minutes, but long before that, you will be wanting it to end. It starts nowhere, and rapidly goes downhill from there.
The audience score is NOT 83% it's really 14% - and deservedly so.

Cosmic Sin is an incoherently boring action film. Bruce Willis is terrible, and is clearly only there for the paycheck. Frank Grillo tries, but is barely in the film. The rest of the acting, including WWE’s Lana, is also horrible. The film does an awful job setting up this world. They just put up blocks of text in the beginning and expect you to comprehend 500 years of history in 30 seconds. The CGI is pretty bad and makes up the majority of the film. The directing is headache inducing, and the writing isn’t much better. Overall, I hated this. I really wanted some dumb fun, but instead it was just boring bad. I can’t wait to forget about this movie.

Bruce Willis must owe the IRS a ton of money. This movie didn't make any sense on any level. Convoluted plot, disconnected dialogue, and stilted performances all around. Bruce Willis was sleep walking.
It seems like theres some bots here. There is no possible way that this has an 85% audience score and a 5% critic score. I'm sorry but something fishy is going on. Btw the movie is utter shit.

When a film has excessive use of red and blue layered lighting it should always serve as a warning sign, like danger colours on an animal.  Occasionally coloured lighting is delightful and ambient and just a palette choice.  Mostly, too much coloured lighting suggests a film has gone to the dogs but they're trying to make it pretty, and if it's pretty we won't notice it's bad. In Cosmic Sin the lighting is trying desperately to bring a sense of vibrance to an otherwise dull talkfest.  They even insert coloured lights into the space suits so they're always on the actor's faces.

If you were curious to see this movie because you've read The Swiss Family Robinson for the hundredth time and need something a little more exciting, might I suggest watching paint dry instead. Maybe turn on the stove and wait for the water to boil. The story line in both scenarios is far superior as well as the action. While watching paint dry will have no dialog, sometimes nothing is better than words which are regretable and can never be unheard.  The ultimate fault of Cosmic Sin is that the producers thought anyone in the cosmos would enjoy this.  The Q bomb tech is cute. Half star for that.
It's a shame that you can't rate a movie 0 stars.

Cheap B sci-fi that takes place in 2524, one year short of the song, shot in mostly cheap darkly lit sets, with some standard outer space VFX, insubstantial & predictable plot, the current Willis's school of wooden acting with soldiers wearing half torn Star Wars Storm Trooper plus Toy Story Buzz Lightyear space suits, couldn't even afford to make transparent glass visors for their helmets! Laughable at best.

Fun movie! While it may not be on the same level as the timeless space opera that is Starship Troopers it's still an excellent film.  Okay, yes, it may not prompt you to have an existential crisis and if you're looking for a film that forces you to reflect on the vapidity of everyday life then it may not be for you, but there is something to be said for a movie that is just fun to watch (especially coming off the heels of the hot mess in a  dumpster-fire that was 2020).  And, for the record, the critics are wrong: more Bruce Willis does make for more action.
keep getting them checks Bruce...but just not like this.
The worst movie ever!!! Bruce Willis come on! And why is the rating high when everyone giving it 1 star?

Worst movie ever. Will never watch Bruce Willis or Garillo film again. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE ... waste of money and time. Upset with Flixster that suggested high audience score? WTF? Flixster is the worse critic app. Will find another source for movie review.

Film looks like it was slapped together by first year editor and is grossly mismatched with veteran actors having dialogue with extra level actors... I walked out after 30 min mostly cause I was finishing my popcorn. :(

Just watched tonight with a mate and both of us agreed was the worse film we both have watched in theatre ever. Willis looked bored, Grillo not even in it much and the rest of the cast was really forgettable mostly. Alot of the exposition was delivered in a voice that made it hard to hear or understand and the dialogue was sadly very badly written. I wondered if the movie was mostly lost in editing  which might explain things but unfortunately not recommended.
When the movie was over I asked the only person in the theater did he understand it. He said he didn't understand it either.

WORST. MOVIE. EVER. MADE! My parents and I watch almost every movie we can find - about 4 every single weekend. And we all agreed: this was the worst movie we ever saw! This movie should be outlawed, it's THAT bad. You have been warned.

Worst movie ever. Plot was all over the place. Nothing made sense. "47 min since first contact" "oh 4 hours ago they made contact". Gimme a break Bruce Willis has 2 words per sentence and was so bad it's unreal.
WTF is this for real?
I only watched it because I trust Bruce Willis but I was betrayed.  Bad writing, predictable scenes, just all bad.

Too bad, it was a general premise that could have worked under different direction. There are the low-budget sci-fi films that are great because they had great story telling. This felt like they had some decent budget, but very poor directing and editing gave most of the scenes a phoned-in feeling. Definitely a huge waste of talent and story. OK to skip.
This movie was dog shit, felt like i was at home watching a cheap movie on the syfy channel.

Let's put it this way. This movie made monster hunter seem like the best sci-fi of the next decade....
The movie sucks and is a big waste of money. Please believe the reviews. I did not listen to the other reviews and regretted it half way through the movie.

We got so confused during this movie. The beginning started with two people being on a remote planet where first contact happens but somehow it turns to around 6 people who made contact? Then when they leave Earth, they go to some planet where there are humans on it that are fighting the aliens....but where did the people come from? From the ships that were attacked in space? Like what? They bounced around so much that you couldn't figure out the story line. It was like they had so many story lines to make the movie and instead of choosing one or two, they added them all.
Epic fail, boring and predictable, not sure Bruce Willis will look back at his career and be proud that this movie was part of it
I wish I could get my money back!🤢
This movie is like a really bad, really corny Syfy channel movie. Don't let the big names attached to this movie convince you that it is going to be a good movie, because it's just not..

I am literally sitting in the cinema watching this right now, and it is honestly the worst movie I've ever seen. It makes Uwe Bill films look like masterpieces. Terrible acting, DREADFUL script, utterly stupid and confusing plot. I have so many questions as to how they persuaded Bruce Willis to star in this shitshow, but I assume he needed the money. It's real bad.
This is a a waste of time. Terrible sh... t. Avoid at all costs.

I can't think of the last time I saw a movie this bad and I'm a big Bruce Willis fan. The acting was horrid, the special effects looked like an 80s movie and the dialogue was awful. This movie is supposed to be set hundreds of years in the future with a space faring humanity yet much of the technology and weapons they use are from the 90s. It really seemed that the cast wasn't even trying to act or put any effort in. 90 minutes I'll never get back

Worst movie I have ever seen. Egregious! People are walking out and a bunch of teenage kids snuck in here without paying and I think sitting through this movie is punishment enough! I think they're really regretting their actions now.
It was terrible. The acting, the story, the dialogues ... everything was sooooo bad.

such a waste of my time! the story was horrible and same with the acting! If it wasn’t for Bruce  being in it, i wouldn’t have bothered going. I’m guessing Willis chose to act in this movie out of boredom because i’m sure even he knew it sucked!
Confusing and really badly acted.

This is the single worst movie I have ever seen in my entire life. I simply cannot think of a move that I have ever seen that was one tenth as bad as this film. The dialogue was written by 5th graders. 5th graders brain damaged in a horrible accident.
The characters were caricatures of caricatures of caricatures. If the actors had been replaced by meerkats, no one would have noticed. The story was not a story. There is no plot. I would rather have been haunted the rest of my life by The Ring girl. If you watch this film, you have been warned, it has exactly zero redeeming values. If it were possibly to give it a negative score, it would deserve one.

Dog shit movie, don't belive the 97% audience rating and the time of writing this. It is obvious botted reviews. Worse movie of 2021 and its only march, but I assure you nothing will be worse than this dumpster fire.
Movie blows. Lame plot, acting and direction. Can’t believe I wasted money on this.

Overall it was just entertaining and since it was short I was able to stick with it.  Felt a little disconnected and all over the place with plot and speed. While some VFX were good, other things like the suits looked like 3d printed cosplay costumes.  Not to mention the fact that after 500 years we are still riding motorcycles and pick up trucks with no attempt to make them "futuristic" lol. If you like space movies and want to water a little time go for it, other wise skip.

If I could give "Cosmic Sin" a negative 5 rating, I would. The story and script was cliched and held together with cheap masking tape. Some of the VFX bordered on the home movie variety. And some scenes were clearly shoe-horned in to make you like the weaker characters more, and to justify drastic shifts in the story and action. To be honest, I wasn't expecting much out of this movie. But, why it was even green lit in the first place is the biggest question of all.
Total waste of time. Bad acting bad film
The exact same thing as most of Bruce Willis latest films that goes straight to VOD, which is trash!!

No plot, some of the worst VFX to ever grace the screens. 

The budget clearly went on Bruce and some other names, all of whom clearly wished for the movie to end as much as you will as viewer. 

No redeeming factors, just rotten!

rt_summary: Bruce Willis and Frank Grillo star in the new epic sci-fi adventure set in the year 2524, four hundred years after humans started colonizing the outer planets. Retired Military General James Ford (Willis) is called back into service after soldiers on a remote planet are attacked by a hostile alien fleet. The threat against the human race escalates into an inevitable interstellar war. General Ford teams up with General Eron Ryle (Grillo) and a team of elite soldiers in a race to stop the imminent attack before it is too late.
